story:
Who I am, and why I need your help!

Hi folks,

I'm Andy. I'm what you'd call an occasional freelance videogame critic (known mostly for my freelance contributions for IGN AU and for hosting the Switch Focus Podcast), and videogames have been a huge part of my life for as long as I can remember.

During early childhood they captured my imagination. They were a constant escape in my awkward teens. Most pertinently, they helped me through some pretty tough times in my twenties. At my loneliest, when I was sick to the back teeth of working in a job I hated, when I had nothing else, games were often the only thing that brought me joy.

That's what this is about.

For years I've wanted to try my hand at writing fiction, and last year I finally gave it a go. I started small and followed the old idiom of 'write what you know' to pen a short, 8-page semi-autobiographical comic script about how important videogames were to me at a time I had nothing else.

The comic revolves around a character called Geoff, a twentysomething man working a 9-5 job that he absolutely hates, with nothing else going on but the repetition of existence. Yet, there is one escape that makes him happy. I think you can guess what that is.

Since I finished the script, I've been on the hunt for an artist to help bring my comic to life, and months later I've finally found one I want to work with.

Only, artists cost money...

What this campaign is for

For me, this project is absolutely non-profit. It's an experiment. Me taking my first steps as a creator rather than a commentator. When the comic is completed, I will release it on the internet for free.

The small amount I'm trying to raise in this campaign is solely to pay the artist, Skye, so that she can turn my words into pictures.

Here's a test panel she did:

With that, I'm keeping the campaign low-key, asking only for small donations from those that would like to help.

All backers will receive regular progress reports, while $10 backers will get advance access to pages as they're completed.

The impact

Should I achieve my funding goal, it will not only ensure that the comic definitely happens, but happens much quicker than not reaching it. If I don't reach the goal, I will still make every effort to get it completed and explore other avenues if I have to.

I have set the campaign up as 'Flexible Funding', so even if I don't beat the full total, I'll still be able to get the ball rolling.

Other ways you can help

If you think others would be interested in this comic, please spread the word.

story:
Who are We

We are a group of Indie comic book artists, writers and creators who have come together to form a new and exciting vision in the publishing world- Outer World magazine The creators of the magazine comprise both the editorial and the creative team and hail from diverse backgrounds giving us a unique view of the culture. Many of us have been working in the field of comics for at least 15yrs and seek to bring attention to those often overlooked in their field. Our magazine with be geared towards a mature audience 17 and over.

What is Outer world Magazine

Outer World will be an anthology publication done in a magazine style format. It will feature the genres of superheroes, sci-fi, noir and fantasy stories for a mature audience.The goal is to collect artwork and stories done by indie creators of color for people of all races and backgrounds. Done in the style of classic anthology magazines such as Heavy Metal, Outer World will feature rotating creators and stories with each publication.



How your donations can help this project

Here’s the break down on how your donations can make a difference:

Funding from the donations made by you will go towards paying the artists, writers, creators and editors of this magazine. Our team is important to us and the least we can do is pay them.

Paper is expensive. Funds will also go to the printing and marketing of the magazine. Each creator and artist taking part in this project will be given a certain number of magazines to take with them to book store signings, comic book shops and comic cons.

List of comic book artists and creators involved are:

Al Hobbie

Al Stewart

Bradley Golden


Devon Camel

Jason Richardson

Jiba Molei Anderson

Joe Robinson Currie




Travis Louis


Editors

LuEllen Joy Miller Giera

Ra’Chaun Rogers

Lana Maria

Jiba Molei Anderson

Joe McFee

Kimberly Moseberry

story:
Who is Ghost Man?

Kyle Glass was just a young freelance graphic artist trying to make it on it his own. His interest inlcude drawing, reading, playing videogames... and the paranormal. Together Kyle and his roomate Zach Hutchins report and blog about the things that go bump in the night.  

It all changes for Kyle when his grandfather dies, a man he respected more then anyone. At his grandfathers will reading Kyle is surprised to recieve a generous sum of money from the estate and something else. As a child Kyle's grandfather was a collecter of odd trinkets and artifacts, one thing in particular always caught young Kyle's eye. It was a necklace adorned with a blue crystal with a scythe blade on one side and an angel wing on the other. On the way home as Kyle admires the necklace he mugged, shot and left for dead in alley. Upon his death his spirit fuses with the strange trinket and transfroms Kyle into Ghost Man. Now he walks on both sides of the living and the dead trying to figure it all out

Want to know what happens next? Then help us get the first issue of Ghost Man off the ground. Come with us on his journey as goes up aginst zombies, black eyed kids, The Mothman and more. However to get to these adventures we need to Make Issue one a reality. 

What's the Money for?

The bones you through towards Ghost Man will go toward paying the artist to draw the book, as well as printing up a small run. These copies we'll be used to help it go digitally later, they are basically being used to get the word about about Ghost Man and Illo comics which we hope to make into an online comic book company in the near future for not only Ghost Man but other titles as well.

The money we get from you is crucial to Ghost Man and Illo Comics. We don't have any funds right off the bat to make this happen we have to get it all form you guys, it's about as grass roots as you can get.

Any extra cash we get will go towards getting a few extra books printed up and go towards the second issue and maybe even the website for Illo Comics..

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't throw us a couple of bucks? Thats fine there are other things you can do to help us out. If you can spread the word then please do so. Do you have a comic book relevent  podcast? Then throw us a shout out. Do you know someone who has said podcast then let them know about us and maybe they can give us a shout out. Do you run a blog, twitter account or facebook account and want to give us a mention then feel free to do so. If you can't do that then just tell a friend help us get a word of mouth campaign going. Thanks

story:
INTRODUCTION

Welcome to the last place on earth...overrun by the crime and vermin determined to keep it that way.

Where the light of hope has been snuffed out by the musty blanket of despair.

Where every tomorrow is yesterday's nightmare from which you cannot awake.

Welcome to Big City...abandon all hope...until now...

This is the opening to the critically acclaimed comic book, Brotherman: Dictator of Discipline, created in 1990.  Since then, Brotherman's unique style and mythos has become ingrained in the culture, not only in comic books but in the thinking of what could be.  This campaign launches another level of artistic creativity with the Brotherman Graphic Novel: Revelation.

The Brotherman Graphic Novel: Revelation tells the long awaited origin of Brotherman...but not simply how he ended up in the suit.  This story delves into his environment, family and his psyche.  Intense, full of action, humor, and heart; this story will set a new bar for books of this kind.

The time is now!  Join us as we create a masterpiece of creativity.

* The autographed copy of the graphic novel, Brotherman: Revelation is a perk for donations $40 and up.



CULTURAL SIGNIFICANCE

Brotherman Comics has already inspired a generation of artists world wide and has sparked a movement in comics never before seen. It is documented in research books, libraries and museums for it's impact on the comic industry and it's influence on young minds around the world.

With your support you will be a part of history as Big City Entertainment resurrects this important piece of literature as it appears for the first time in the form of a full color 100 page graphic novel. To show our appreciation we are offering some fantastic rewards ranging from collectors items in our vaults to limited collectors items that will only be available to our campaign supporters.

Brotherman comics has always represented more than just comics but it is a metaphoric representation of those who fight against all odds to rebuild their communities . . . never giving up . . . and inspiring others to join in that change. As an African American owned, independent company, we understand and have faced those challenges head on and have been fighting for the past 25 years to bring balance to an unbalanced comic book industry. In the process we have been receiving testimonials ranging from people who learned to read from our books to being inspired to strive for a better life and build a better community.

Our mission is to continue to inspire more people to become greater.


IMPACT

Since its inception, Brotherman has been more than just entertainment. Brotherman has served to be an intellectual ignition for the  entrepreneurial spirit, creativity, cultural awareness, and positive self-esteem.  From the moment Brotherman hit the streets, a generation of artists and would-be artists saw that depictions of themselves was not only possible but cool.  They realized that not only did they have stories to tell but now a different and unique vehicle to tell it.  They found the confidence that images of heroism, strength, intellect, and love, was neither monolithic nor absent from their own images. 

The impact of Brotherman has and continues to be the creative catalyst for people of all backgrounds, ethnicities, and nationalities; There is a truth that transcends boundaries and empowers.

INFLUENCING LIVES

We have found over the years that Brotherman served to inspire people to look inside themselves, tapping into the things that illuminate their lives; reading more, learning to draw, starting their own business, or becoming more socially conscious. Today, the influence of Brotherman continues, not only in our own families but in the families of our many Brotherfans.

Your support will not only help us in bringing this project to light but will continue the history of providing a movement which helps people draw from their soul and enlighten the world in which they live.

Some say...be a part of history...we say...be a part of our future!

story:
BRAAAINS: Behind the Campaign

Hi! I'm Rori! and I love making comics. I've made many autobiographical strips, comics about hip youth and naked runners, but this is my first horror comic and I'm so excited about it!

I've been a fan of zombies ever since I was a wee Rori and the PBS Halloween broadcast of Night of the Living Dead scared the bejeezus out of me (it still does, a little). So I knew my first horror comic had to include them. I also knew that many others share my passion for flesh-eating hordes, and many stories have been written about zombies. I knew my story had to be different.

And it is. And I want to bring it to you!

We're Only Gonna Die! features a diverse cast of survivors: Beatriz the brave and Pasquale the faithful, the bowman from Michigan, Alisha, the storyteller, and Emmah, a strangely knowing young girl. We join them on their journey across the Midwestern plains and follow them to shelter in a quaint farmhouse...
Check out the 5-page preview in the Gallery.

This campaign will let me print my story We're Only Gonna Die! so I may sell it at comic conventions, local comic shops and online. Hopefully it will delight zombie fans like myself who are looking for a story a little off the well-worn (and corpse-strewn) path.

The Hunger: What We Need & What You Get

For the initial color printing and all rewards I need to raise $500 US.

  • In order to get this book out to my contributors as soon as possible, this is a stripped-down, bare-bones 21-day campaign.
  • The biggest reward is the 26- 36-page book, but I don't want to leave you all feeling hungry, so there are limited-availability art rewards (please see Gallery for examples).
  • All printed books bought during this campaign come with an exclusive, personalized book plate and feature a velvety matte-finish cover.
  • If the campaign really takes off, I'll revisit the reward tiers and add more extras.


*Please see Gallery Tab at top for more art examples.
**Cover is not final.

Stretch Goals

YES! Than you for making this possible! If we reach $750 the book will get EXTRAS: extra pages of sketches, alternate covers and other behind-the-scense stuff at the end of the book. We did it! Thank you! We're Only Gonna Die! will now be 36 pages long!

$1,000 Stretch Goal: ACHIEVED!

Wow! You are amazing! Okay, we made it to $1,000  so everyone with a print copy of the book gets a sweet Zombanimal sticker:

There will be Zombie Kitty here, plus I'm working on more Abomidable Zombanimals to throw into the mix!

Stretch Goals: Final Week

There's still almost a week to go, so here's the next stretch goals:

$1,250: Super-nice books! Premium printing and heavyweight paper. 

$1,500: Satiny-finish 4x6 art print (zombie-themed, of course) for everyone with a print copy.

Thank you so much for your support. I am so grateful to all of you. Please keep being awesome and keep sharing the campaign with your friends! 


Onward Zed-words! Impact, Risks & Challenges

I truly believe in this story and think readers will enjoy its diverse protagonists, intense color palettes and unconventional resolution. I want to share this with the world! With your help, I can, and in bleeding color.

I've run successful crowdfunding campaigns before and have learned from my mistakes. Realistic postage has been factored into all rewards and rewards have been kept small, easy and quick to produce. I assure you, even if buried six-feet-under in problems, I will rise to any challenges.

Send More RTs: Other Ways You Can Help

So you really want to help, but you're dead broke? Help me spread the word like a angry lab-monkey virus! Share this campaign on your social networks! Let your zombie-loving friends and family know about it! Ask your local comic shop to order a retailer pack! Be groovy.

Thanks for coming by!

story:
Would you like to support the alternative arts and youth education at the same time? If so, please invest in my political comic book!

I took a cartooning class at the Educational Alliance in New York City to fulfill my childhood dream of being a cartoonist. This experience has inspired me to create my own comic book, The Global Kid, about a kid who grows up in countries around the globe (mirroring my own childhood). Through the first person narration of the main character, 14 year old Sami, we will learn about his nomadic life and his understanding of each country's politics. The comic book ultimately aims to entertain and educate teen and adult readers about political risk, prediction and strategy around the world – a topic I teach and write about for my work at NYU, Wikistrat and the Huffington Post's WorldPost.

But The Global Kid is also about helping youth reach their potential through education. 100% of comic book sales will go to global education non-profits that help youth reach their potential. Please help us cover production costs for a 32-page color comic book and support youth education at the same time. 

About Me & My Drawing Background

These days, I'm a part-time politics professor in the MA Program in  International Relations at NYU GSAS, a lead analyst at geopolitical crowdsourced consultancy Wikistrat, and a former Businessweek and CNN columnist who writes about political risk, prediction and strategy for The Huffington Post's WorldPost who formerly served as chairwoman of the board of the New Silk Road Generation (the 1st e-mentoring program for Afghanistan's university students).

But I am also the quintessential global kid, having lived in 7 different countries by age 14 and whose first love was cartoon drawing. When my family and I moved from Riyadh to London and then to Singapore in the early 1990s, I threw myself into my comic creations. Here are some of my first sketches of familiar characters when I was around 10-13 years old:

                       

Over 20 years later, I have returned to my first love, thanks to my cartooning class and teachers (artists extraordinaire Jude Killory and Josh Bayer) at the Educational Alliance. Here are a few sketches I did this year – some familiar characters which I gifted to my nieces, nephew, godson and friends' kids:

  

These were all drawn using pencil, then inked with black pen and finally colored with markers. For the comic book, I am exploring different coloring techniques, including paints, brush pens and digital software for richer colors and a more professional look. Here is one of the first drafts of Sami, in pencil, ink, marker and digital color:

 

Below are a few very rough thumbnail sketches of introductory panels from different pages of The Global Kid. But keep in mind they will be redrawn (and the text will be typed) as I continue to develop the story. I'm also doing more research into the politics of the relevant countries and getting more input from education specialists about appropriate content on politics for teen readers.

What We Need & What You Get 

With your $10 pledge, you will help with production costs of The Global Kid; you will feel the satisfaction of supporting the alternative arts and youth's global education at the same time. For $20, you will also receive a copy of the comic book upon completion.

Pledge $100 or more to also get some really fun reward gifts. That includes everything from:

*$100: a sketch of your favorite cartoon character

*$500: a sketch of your own personalized character

*$1,000: a sketch of your own character with your favorite cartoon character in color

*$5,000: a combo of the above plus a character resembling you in The Global Kid

*$10,000: a combo of the above plus your own personalized comic book

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember – investing in The Global Kid means you support the alternative arts, help young readers learn about global politics and support an education non-profit that helps youth reach their potential. Please help spread the word to anyone you think might be interested. Feel free to contact me (maha.aziz@nyu.edu) if you have any questions about this comic book project.

Let's make a difference!
story_txt:
Would you like to support the alternative arts and youth education at the same time? If so, please invest in my political comic book!
I took a cartooning class at the Educational Alliance in New York City to fulfill my childhood dream of being a cartoonist. This experience has inspired me to create my own comic book, The Global Kid, about a kid who grows up in countries around the globe (mirroring my own childhood). Through the first person narration of the main character, 14 year old Sami, we will learn about his nomadic life and his understanding of each country's politics. The comic book ultimately aims to entertain and educate teen and adult readers about political risk, prediction and strategy around the world – a topic I teach and write about for my work at NYU, Wikistrat and the Huffington Post's WorldPost.
But The Global Kid is also about helping youth reach their potential through education. 100% of comic book sales will go to global education non-profits that help youth reach their potential. Please help us cover production costs for a 32-page color comic book and support youth education at the same time. 
About Me & My Drawing Background
These days, I'm a part-time politics professor in the MA Program in  International Relations at NYU GSAS, a lead analyst at geopolitical crowdsourced consultancy Wikistrat, and a former Businessweek and CNN columnist who writes about political risk, prediction and strategy for The Huffington Post's WorldPost who formerly served as chairwoman of the board of the New Silk Road Generation (the 1st e-mentoring program for Afghanistan's university students).
But I am also the quintessential global kid, having lived in 7 different countries by age 14 and whose first love was cartoon drawing. When my family and I moved from Riyadh to London and then to Singapore in the early 1990s, I threw myself into my comic creations. Here are some of my first sketches of familiar characters when I was around 10-13 years old:
                       
Over 20 years later, I have returned to my first love, thanks to my cartooning class and teachers (artists extraordinaire Jude Killory and Josh Bayer) at the Educational Alliance. Here are a few sketches I did this year – some familiar characters which I gifted to my nieces, nephew, godson and friends' kids:
  
These were all drawn using pencil, then inked with black pen and finally colored with markers. For the comic book, I am exploring different coloring techniques, including paints, brush pens and digital software for richer colors and a more professional look. Here is one of the first drafts of Sami, in pencil, ink, marker and digital color:
 
Below are a few very rough thumbnail sketches of introductory panels from different pages of The Global Kid. But keep in mind they will be redrawn (and the text will be typed) as I continue to develop the story. I'm also doing more research into the politics of the relevant countries and getting more input from education specialists about appropriate content on politics for teen readers.



What We Need & What You Get 
With your $10 pledge, you will help with production costs of The Global Kid; you will feel the satisfaction of supporting the alternative arts and youth's global education at the same time. For $20, you will also receive a copy of the comic book upon completion.
Pledge $100 or more to also get some really fun reward gifts. That includes everything from:
*$100: a sketch of your favorite cartoon character
*$500: a sketch of your own personalized character
*$1,000: a sketch of your own character with your favorite cartoon character in color
*$5,000: a combo of the above plus a character resembling you in The Global Kid
*$10,000: a combo of the above plus your own personalized comic book
Other Ways You Can Help



Remember – investing in The Global Kid means you support the alternative arts, help young readers learn about global politics and support an education non-profit that helps youth reach their potential. Please help spread the word to anyone you think might be interested. Feel free to contact me (maha.aziz@nyu.edu) if you have any questions about this comic book project.
Let's make a difference!

story:
The Hobo Shack

THE HOBO SHACK is a weekly podcast that delivers comedic and intelligent conversation every Sunday morning.  Typical shows average about two hours in length and feature interviews with Twitter and internet personalities, authors and members of popular metal bands.  

As longtime listeners know, our computer has been dying a slow death over the past few months with multiple issues, occasionally causing delays in releasing and recording new episodes. Recently, what we refer to as the "Hobo Shack Supercomputer" finally met it's inevitable end.  The show has been limping along the last few weeks on an 8 year old laptop that is also nearing death. 

We come hat in hand asking for listener support.  As the show is already being run on basically no budget and with no financial backing behind it other than the host's pockets, THE HOBO SHACK is begging for help.  What it comes down to is this: the show's host does not currently have the money to buy new equipment.

We need a new computer to keep the show running.  We have released well over 100 hours of free content this year and hope to release hundreds more over the next few years.  

We have never asked anything from our listeners and hope to never have to ask for help again.  The listeners of THE SHACK are a dedicated bunch of people and we hope that they feel like this podcast is worth supporting financially.

So we are asking listeners to help this podcast through a rough patch.  If you listen to the podcast on a regular basis, please throw a few dollars our way so that we can continue to provide you some of the weirdest, funniest, and most intelligent content for free on a weekly basis.


Thank you in advance.

XOXOXO

-@xhobosexualx

story:
Why am I doing this?:

Satanic Mojo is spawned from a fascination with underground pop culture, youth tribes, street fashion, musical movements and so forth.

Whereas Victorian children were often clad in miniature versions of the three-piece-suits grown-ups, the modern teenager has always striven to find their own style.

The rise of pop culture is in many ways the history of the teenager, the rebels, the fashion tribes. Elvis hip-thrust was deemed indecent by TV as were Mary Quants high slashed mini skirts and The Beatles long hair.

 From Hells Angels to Punks, Headbangers, Goths, Ravers or the hoodies of today youth tribes have routinely been demonised, shunned or banned from the pubs. The main connecting thread between all of these is that from Rock'n'Roll to Acid House, even comics and role-playing games, they have, at some point, been labelled as Satanic by a hysterical mass-media.

In Jan 2012 I started a blog, www.satanicmojo.blogspot.com, taking a tongue-in-cheek look at the influence of the dark arts on pop culture.

Following this thread of influence I developed the idea of producing a series of limited edition artworks resembling ephemera from past decades.

Phase One looks at the counter-cultutre of the late 1960s.

Inspired by the dark side of psychedelia, The Process Church Of The Final Judgement, The Church Of Satan, the influence of Aleister Crowley & his Thelemites on the hippy scene, LSD, Underground Comix, The Manson Family, conspiracy theory, Heavy Metal, Hammer Horror, etc.

The first collection of works comprises of:

a 36 page underground comic, lovingly rendered by a team of artists (inc Shaky Kane & Garry Leach) to resemble the style of the day (36 pages limited to 666 copies); a psychedelic black-light poster with velvet flocking (artwork evocative of a classic rock festival poster), t-shirts, badges, patches, stickers and more...

With the current insipid, P.C. safeness of popular culture I feel it is important we remember the pioneering spirit and unabashed bravery of those psychedelic radicals who defended the right of free expression through their raw and visceral creations.

See below for further information...

 Jason Atomic, London MMXIII

 

 

 

What's the story?:

The legend of Satanic Mojo begins with a potent batch of Black Acid known as Satanic Mojo or LSD666.

This acid is reputed to give dark occult visions, out of body experiences, and allow contact with certain entities.

As the 'Summer Of Love' makes way for the 'Summer Of Bad Craziness', "Black Acid" achieves a cult status amongst a certain sector of the hippy community obsessed with the occult revival and rennaissance of Satanism.

In 1968 a San Francisco-based artist collective is established, woking under the Satanic Mojo banner.

 

 

Over the next year they produce a series of t-shirts, posters and comix, until things are brought to an un-timely end when the studio is destroyed by fire.

Myriad rumours circulate regarding the fire. It is believed that they have 'stepped on the toes' of a local Coven, or that they had caused the fire themselves by meddling with forces man was meant to leave alone. These rumours in turn go on to inspire a shlocky and exploitative grindhouse movie, and a whole generation of artists and musicians throughout the 70s up to the present day.

Movie still from Satanic Mojo 1972 AD, courtesy of The Schleyer Archive, Brooklyn

In Jan 2012 the popular Satanic Mojo blog appears, dedicated to providing a tongue in cheek look at the influence of the dark arts on popular culture.

Research by this blog uncovers 'The Legend Of Satanic Mojo' and, ultimately, charred fragments retrieved from the burnt out Satanic Mojo studio.

 

The Creative Team:

Please allow me to introduce myself, my name is Jason Atomic. I'm a London based British artist. 

Despite having a background in self produced comix, I have been away from the medium for the last 20 years, concentrating more on drawing and painting from life. I have exhibited internationally and in 2008 set an un-offical World land speed record for portraiture at the National Portrait Gallery.

Recently I began curating comic-inspired group shows and performance events at Resistance Gallery & Orbital comics in London. These include The Iconography Of Mask, Hail To The King, Stripped and The Magick Eye. I have written for various magazines in the UK & Japan including Tokyo Journal, Pimp, Alternative London and The Illustrated Ape (for which I art-edited the latest issue)

For this project I have recruited a team of comic creators including UK comics legends Shaky Kane (Deadline, Bulletproof Coffin)and Garry Leach (2000ad, Warrior,A1) as well as American indie/underground creators Paul Lyons (Monster) and Dennis Franklin (Monster & movie art department for 'House of the Devil').

 

Shaky Kane rough sketch for Satanic Mojo Comix

Shaky Kane concept sketch for Satanic Mojo Comix 

So What Will It Look Like?:

Satanic Mojo Comix will do its best to emulate the art styles of the late 1960s. It will be printed on an off-white pulpy paper stock, using old-fashioned risograph 'stencil duplicator' technology to reproduce a vintage 'off register' effect. 

It will feature a '4 color' cover, made using hand-drawn separations. 

Interior pages will be in black and white, with the possible addition of further colours or pages should sufficient funds be found.

This 36 page comic will run to a limited edition of 666 copies. 

The t-shirts will be short run, hand pulled screen prints produced using home-made D.I.Y screens to give that low budget vintage effect. This will also allow for special one-off/experimental garments to be produced, employing multiple prints, hand colouring etc.

Also, we plan to produce a poster print, in the style of the classic UV posters of the period, featuring a psychedelic witch enacting the rite of the Black Mass with a goat-masked cultist.

The poster will be a 4 colour screen print at A2 size

(420 x 594mm - 16.5 x 23.4 in)

It will be printed in UV reactive fluorescent colours with flocked blacks to give that traditional black velvet effect.

There will also be a cheaper Mojo Dayglo 'diffusion range' version in black on fluorescent paper.

These items are intended as art objects which will form a metafictional collection of facsimile ephemera from the mythical Satanic Mojo Studio.

Only half the print run will be available through this indiegogo campaign. The rest will go on to form part of a multi-medi group exhibition and performance event to be held in London.

 

What you'll get if you contribute:

There are a wide range of perks available. 

Badges, patches and stickers featuring the sigil of Satanic Mojo.

This sigil was designed by Jinx Dawson, of Satanic psychedelic acid rock group Coven. 

It was Jinx, a practicing witch, who back in the 1960s introduced the sign of the horned hand to the rock scene. 

All perks will come together with a specially distressed certificate.

 "Do What Thou Wilt... Then Split"

(See image above in Legend of Satanic Mojo)

A t-shirt featuring a cartoon version of Aleister Crowley in familiar triangle hat making the sign of Pan whilst walking in a pose reminiscent of R. Crumb's classic "Keep On Truckin'" shirt. 

 

"Creepy Crawl" 

Manson family inspired t-shirt featuring the title "Creepy Crawl" and a hairy hippy spider with a Charile Manson death's head on its abdomen.

"Satanic Mojo T-shirt"

The Satanic Mojo logo flanked by a pair of winged demons.

 The Satanic Mojo Black Light Poster

 The Satanic Mojo diffusion range Poster

The same design as the other poster but printed in one colour (black) on fluorescent paper.

Satanic Mojo Comix, 36 page comix with colour cover and B/W interior.

 

 Where Will Your Money Go?:

The funds raise through this indiegogo campaign will go towards printing/material costs for Satanic Mojo Comix, the posters and t-shirts, as well as a fee for contributing artists.

Should the goal be exceeded, additional money raised would allow me to pay a bonus to contributors, to further enhance the finished product (better quality material, more colours, etc) or to add new designs to the collection.

 

Flexible Funding:

I am committed to producing this comic & poster and will go ahead with or without my complete goal being reached. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you're still not convinced but want to help this project gain some momentum, we would be delighted if you'd share our links on Facebook, twitter and other social media platforms. 

Wether you are contributing of not we'd be delighted to hear your feedback in the comments section above.

Follow the Satanic Mojo blog.

Any bloggers or journalists out there with an interest in the Satanic influence on pop culture - I am available for interviews and will be happy to discuss this project in more depth. 

 


"For Open Minded Adult Intellectuals Only" :

In the spirit of the counter-culture of the late 1960's these limited edition art objects will feature erotica, macabre themes and drug references. As such, they are intended for a mature audience.

story:
Titanium Rain and The AudioComics Company

In the year 2031, a civil war begins in China and eventually envelops the entire world. For US Air Force pilot Alec Killian, survival in this new age means that man and machine must exist as one, courtesy of a new military project called Prometheus. This is the basis for one of the most acclaimed graphic novel series in recent years: Titanium Rain, created and produced by 01Publishing (www.01publishing.com/) and published by Archaia Entertainment:

 

"A different kind of war book, making statements about the politics and nature of war and not reducing itself to mocking the whole thing...I have a feeling that this is going to be one heck of a ride." (Broken Frontier magazine)

"This is well worth the buy, I can't recommend it enough." (Graphic Policy online)

"The feeling of realism is taken up a notch by the recognizable story elements. Add in just enough cool tech to give it a fresh feel and you have my positive intial impression of Titanium Rain." (Chuck Moore, Comic Related online review)

 

Now TR jumps from the printed page to the aural stage as it comes to the world of radio drama...with your help!

 

So, who are we? We are the AudioComics Company, an audio theatre/radio drama publishing company devoted to the production and distribution of professional full-cast adaptation of licensed and world-premiere productions featuring properties from the worlds of creator-owned comic books and graphic novels (www.audiocomicscompany.com). Our debut production of Starstruck (based on the play-turned-comic series by Elaine Lee and Michael Wm. Kaluta) has received rave reviews from comics and audio professionals alike. Now we turn our attention to Titanium Rain, which will be adpated for audio by co-creator Josh Finney and directed by Starstruck director William Dufris. The first book in the Titanium Rain saga is scheduled to record in Portland, ME in September of 2011. THAT'S THIS YEAR, FOLKS!

 

The AudioComics team and 01Publishing's Josh Finney and Kat Rocha all share a love for the medium of comics and of full-cast audio. Audio theatre is one of the visual mediums there is: you are no longer an audience member outside of the action but a direct participant making the action happen, with the help of voices, music, sound effects, and silence. The images you create based on what you see in the graphic novel allows you to create a billion dollar budget movie in your mind! Our passion is to take an existing medium and translate/transform it into an aurally stunning production that engages and entertains you from the word...or sound...go! Titanium Rain, with its timely meditations on the very nature of war, is one such production.

Your Investment in Our Project

Producing a full-cast audio drama is not an easy task, nor is it an inexpensive one! For every minute you hear of an audio drama, one to three hours of production time is involved. This includes voice-over sessions, editing, proofing, layering of sound effects (and believe you me there will be plenty in this one), music, and a final edit. Not to mention the manufacturing of compact discs for conventions and sales through stores such as Amazon, and payments to the creators and the performers, some of whom will be flying in to Maine from San Diego (not only are they skilled actors in front of microphones, but their likenesses were used in the visual designs for characters in the book).

 

We're looking to raise enough to cover of recording the first volume of Titanium Rain and making it available to a worldwide audience through compact discs (sold online and at comic book/sci-f- conventions), pay-per-Mp3 downloads, and on community radio, with the hopes that listeners will in turn purchase the graphic novel series!

 

So, what will your contributions fund? Hey! How about the following:

 

  • License fees
  • Transportation to ME for the creators and guest actors
  • Payments to our gracious talent (10 -15 actors)
  • Catering (because a hungry actor is a grumpy actor)
  • Post production at Mind's Eye Studios (anywhere from 60 to 180 hours)
  • Indie Go Go's percentage

 

And any additional contributions will go toward funding on Parts 2 and 3 of the trilogy, with plans to record these chapters in 2012!

 

We have some exceptional swag to the right, ranging from complimentary digital downloads to exclusive TR prints, to one-of-a-kind commissions, and opportunities to have "under fives" (five lines or less) in the production regardless of your physical location.

 

Furthermore, for every $1,000.00 raised, AudioComics Company co-founder Lance Roger Axt will donate 100 comic books from his personal collection to Operation Comix Relief, which sends care packages of comic books to our men and women fighting for our country overseas. 

And Finally...Other Ways You Can Help!

Help spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, over the phone and in your next e-mail! One of the most powerful forms of promotion is word of mouth. Any leads or connections you may have to other potential donors that may be interested in Titanium Rain will be greatly appreciated! See you in the studio!

 

HEAD OVER TO OUR WEBSITE TO HEAR AN EXERPT FROM JONATHAN SHARP'S INCREDIBLE SOUNDTRACK! IT'S ON THE HOME PAGE!

The first book in the Titanium Rain saga is scheduled to record in Portland, ME in September of 2011. THAT'S THIS YEAR, FOLKS!
 
The AudioComics team and 01Publishing's Josh Finney and Kat Rocha all share a love for the medium of comics and of full-cast audio. Audio theatre is one of the visual mediums there is: you are no longer an audience member outside of the action but a direct participant making the action happen, with the help of voices, music, sound effects, and silence. The images you create based on what you see in the graphic novel allows you to create a billion dollar budget movie in your mind! Our passion is to take an existing medium and translate/transform it into an aurally stunning production that engages and entertains you from the word...or sound...go! Titanium Rain, with its timely meditations on the very nature of war, is one such production.
Your Investment in Our ProjectProducing a full-cast audio drama is not an easy task, nor is it an inexpensive one! For every minute you hear of an audio drama, one to three hours of production time is involved. This includes voice-over sessions, editing, proofing, layering of sound effects (and believe you me there will be plenty in this one), music, and a final edit. Not to mention the manufacturing of compact discs for conventions and sales through stores such as Amazon, and payments to the creators and the performers, some of whom will be flying in to Maine from San Diego (not only are they skilled actors in front of microphones, but their likenesses were used in the visual designs for characters in the book). We're looking to raise enough to cover of recording the first volume of Titanium Rain and making it available to a worldwide audience through compact discs (sold online and at comic book/sci-f- conventions), pay-per-Mp3 downloads, and on community radio, with the hopes that listeners will in turn purchase the graphic novel series! So, what will your contributions fund? Hey! How about the following: 
License fees
Transportation to ME for the creators and guest actors
Payments to our gracious talent (10 -15 actors)
Catering (because a hungry actor is a grumpy actor)
Post production at Mind's Eye Studios (anywhere from 60 to 180 hours)
Indie Go Go's percentage
 And any additional contributions will go toward funding on Parts 2 and 3 of the trilogy, with plans to record these chapters in 2012! We have some exceptional swag to the right, ranging from complimentary digital downloads to exclusive TR prints, to one-of-a-kind commissions, and opportunities to have "under fives" (five lines or less) in the production regardless of your physical location. Furthermore, for every $1,000.00 raised, AudioComics Company co-founder Lance Roger Axt will donate 100 comic books from his personal collection to Operation Comix Relief, which sends care packages of comic books to our men and women fighting for our country overseas. 
And Finally...Other Ways You Can Help!
Help spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, over the phone and in your next e-mail! One of the most powerful forms of promotion is word of mouth. Any leads or connections you may have to other potential donors that may be interested in Titanium Rain will be greatly appreciated! See you in the studio!
 
HEAD OVER TO OUR WEBSITE TO HEAR AN EXERPT FROM JONATHAN SHARP'S INCREDIBLE SOUNDTRACK! IT'S ON THE HOME PAGE!

story:
Hello everyone! My name is Jean-Sebastien Lajeunesse. Welcome to my Indiegogo 

page! To all my extraordinary friends, old and new, I need your support in 

bringing my new Artbook to life.

My New Artbook: For Stomach Ulcers Vol 1 Deluxe Edition. 

All my new works from 2010 and 2011 available in portrait 

version : 80 pages, portrait version with my short movies compilation : 80 

pages, also trade and pocket version:80 pages. Hardcover and sofcover. Then 

find the right company to distribute in major and specialized bookstores as 

well as selling online.This is where I need your help! Right side of this 

screen, you'll notice there are several reward packages. For every level of 

donations I receive towards making my Artbook, you get more and more cool 

stuff! I'm trying to raise $4500 in 90 days, which is a big goal, but I know 

that together we can reach it. There are other ways to help, too. By reposting 

links to my Indiegogo account on your facebook profile, more people can hear 

about the project and see it for themselves. Grants being so inaccessible, i 

turn on your support help bring this project to life!!!! 

 

Tell your friends and everybody!!!!!!!!!!

 

Please, take this journey with me!!!!!!!

 

All items are Packed carefully and shipped free worldwide!!!!

 

www.artjslajeunesse.ca

www.ebay.com/sch/artjeanseb/m.html?_nkw=&_a...

www.illustrationquebec.com/jean-sebastienlajeun...

www.etsy.com/shop/artjslajeunesse

www.artjslajeunesse.blogspot.com/

 

Comme see me on Youtube and Facebook!

 

Truly yours,

 

Jean-Sebastien Lajeunesse

 

 

About me

 

The art of jean-Sebastien Lajeunesse reflects a search and exploration on 

imaginary worlds. Within his strange universe, he sits on the ground surrounded 

by archives, tools, sculptures and recycled materials. Pencil in hand, the line 

dares, bursts, comes alive and multiplies, creating stretched forms, texturded 

and contrasted. Fantasy characters come out of nowhere, twisted, fragiles and 

fluids, they all juggle with old memories. All these small symbolic creatures 

tell about their joys and sorrows. A theatrical study that plays with the 

character's emotions. New worlds surges on heterogeneous objects in various 

techniques and different mediums. The idea starts with a vision, will tranform, 

shimmer and expand like a dance reaching for the indefinable, always open to 

new interpretations.

 

Biography

Jean-Sebastien Lajeunesse realizes many personal comic book projects, then, 

does etching art on funeral monuments. Being inventive, he works on prototypes 

and movie decors. Back to study in 2d-3d animation for video games and 

television, he works on the concept of many comic books, illustrations and 7 

video games for the young ones. He then works on programs of self esteem, and 

different causes. In 2005, he produces the animated film ''Cardamome'' which 

awards him best of young artists in Visual Art Contest at the Contemporary Art 

Museum of the Laurentides.The following year, solo exhibit ''L'archipel de 

Cyan'' (Animated film, sculptures and illustrations). Will follow, 2 solo 

exhibits and 12 group exhibits. He then teaches in different schools the art of 

stop-motion animated films. In 2009, he designs logos, websites, short films, 

book and cd covers... Highly motivated and working on his numerous projects he 

also works as animator and illustrator for customers such as:

Air Transat

Rogers

Brault et Bouthiller publishing

Brome Bird Care

Justin time Records

Yannick Rieu

Vieux port de Montreal

Centre des sciences de Montreal

Mass ensemble

Actonel

ICE Multimedia

CLSC

Lucion media

Traces magazine

CSDCCS

Éditions Pierre Tisseyre

Éditions de l'hopital Ste-Justine

 

He collaborates actually on a major multimedia project with

Denis Rodier (Batman, Captain America, Wonder Woman, l'ordre des dragons etc.), 

Martin Vanier (Talisma), Trey Gunn (King Crimson, KTU), Tony Levin (Peter 

Gabriel, Yes, Pink Floyd), Pat Mastelotto (King Crimson, Mr. Mister, XTC), Bill 

Munyon (King Crimson, Warner Bros, Disney)

 

About this project:

"Impressive and unique, a valuable inspirational tool."

"Fascinating and fun, full of rock-solid designs."

"Captivating and meticulously crafted, you are inside an amazing journey."

-Nicolas Lajeunesse

Senior Visual Designer

Ubisoft Vancouver

 

 

"Real cool Artbook from a guy with hyperactive creativity!"

-Denis Rodier (Batman, Captain America, Wonder Woman, l'ordre des dragons etc.) 

 

Comic book artist

 
 
Than you to all!!!!!!:):):)

story:
Our Story

Hello possible contributors! My name is Will Laury, character actor, comedian, musician, singer-songwriter and CEO of Bad Daddy Productions. I am currently attending The Los Angeles Film School in Hollywood, scheduled to graduate in April 2011. I studied cinematography, production, editing, screenwriting, etc., although my passion by definition, is being an entertainer. I’m set to star in this screener film as a pre-emptive showpiece of the premise of a concept I have for a film, then series, of a weekly variety comedy/drama called “WIL:DO’S WORL:D”  that I have created and of which I am the star talent. This short film is a pre-emptive showpiece of the premise of this aspiration. I understand the general inner workings, or should I say the background of film and production, and of being on “the set” and all that it entails that this short film will set the stage for in this show based on the struggles of a street performer, Wildo, (pronounced Will-doe) who goes totally “Hollywood” sans the Hollywood ego, after much resistance. As a consequence it will exhibit the range of my talents (well, some of them anyway) and to introduce “Wildo,” the main character, to the (entertainment) world.

The Impact

The contract I have made to and for myself:  I am determined to not only complete this project, (even with minimal funding), but to proceed with the larger than life ambitious goal to effect my brainchild, “WIL:DO’S WORL:D”. Oh yes people, it’s going down.


What We Need & What You Get

The Basics in what I need is donated time ,energy, and work ethic, but mostly your contributions...

...Because that will pay for:

             *The make-up person, costumes and props--which is extensive for I will be portraying several characters.

             *Craft services to supply eats for my cast and crew.

             *Permits and fees

             *And and all other costs incurred that is bound to rear its ugly head.

Any excess of raised contributions--which we obviously don’t anticipate at this juncture--will be applied to the production and funding of the film and subsequent series, “WIL:DO’S WORL:D”.

           


Other Ways You Can Help

This is an ongoing project for the future production of the "Wil:Do’s Worl:D” series, and a little help goes a long way and word of mouth advertising is a good thing, so...spread the word!

story:
My name is Sara Simms, I'm a international DJ, turntablist and electronic music producer. I've been playing professionally for over a decade, and am one of the few female turntablists in North America. I'm also an advocate of futuristic DJ technologies; I write articles and lead workshops about new DJ technology, and the future of music.

Here's a link to one of my turntablism videos:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mUk3WILeMAY

For the past two years, my younger sister Melle and I have been working on writing a comic book featuring me as the leading superheroine. We are ready to produce our first issue; and create an epic digital comic series for you!

What is The Future Prophecy?

The Future Prophecy is digital comic book for mobile platforms that tells the timeless story of Sara Simms, a superheroine who wields the power of the future of music. In a world full of ancient magic and dark technologies Sara's mission is to unite the people of Toronto to save their city from the villains of Bogtown Records.

Who are the main characters in the story?

I'm the leading superheroine, and am accompanied by my loyal sidekick and younger sister, Melle.

What makes our story special?  

Each of the story's heroes and villains is based on a real musician and/or DJ.

The story's leading female villain, Dextra Delano, is a seductive temptress whose character is based on Melleefresh. Melleefresh is a performance artist, and the founder of Play Records. She discovered Deadmau5, one of the world's most successful electronic music producers, and together they produced a steady stream of #1 hit singles on Beatport.

Who are the villains?

Bogtown Records are a highly successful record company owned by Doyle Delano.  Bogtown has taken over the city of Toronto, and the company is using negative soundwaves to build their CACU army.

The Plan

We will launch the project with a digital comic book that will be published to all e-book platforms. We need your support to help us produce our first issue, and begin the series. There will be approximately 20 issues released in total. Following the launch of the comic book, we will create a collaborative musical concept album based on the story, featuring music composed by the heroes and villains.

Our Team

The Future Prophecy will be produced by Sara Simms Productions, my new production company.  My sister and I will work together to find a strong team to create the digital comic.

"What does my contribution go towards?"

When you contribute to our project, you help us to be able to hire professional talent; (an editor, artist, and artists for coloring and lettering) so we're able to create a dazzling comic for you.

"Any other cool additional features for me?"

You bet!

We'll also create:

-A 'behind the scenes video' showing you how we created our comic

-A DJ mix by to launch the series

"Ok, so how about those rewards?"

We've got some great incentives to give you if you're willing to help us reach our goal.  Check them out on the right hand side of the page.

“I'm a little short on rent this month, how else can I help?”

If you're not able to help us financially, you can still help out by:

-Telling your friends and family about our campaign

-Sharing this campaign online on your Facebook, Twitter, other social media sites or blog

-Joining us on our The Future Prophecy Facebook page:

http://www.facebook.com/thefutureprophecy

-Contributing next month when you're a little richer.  :)

We would like to thank you all for taking the time to check out this page, and send out an even bigger thanks to all of you who have pledged to support us. We're grateful for your help!

My sister and I look forward to creating an great comic book for you!

story:
Masked vigilante THE PURPLE TIGRESS first appeared in print in 1944. After two short adventures she disappeared from publishing...until now.

Scott T. Hicken, a longtime comic book reader and fan, conceived and wrote the new story for The Purple Tigress and her fellow masked vigilantes. His friend Greg Baker, a fellow comic aficionado and writer, helped edit and refine the story. Using old comic book characters that have lapsed into the public domain Scott and Greg decided to pen a new tale that maintained the 1940s setting instead of flashing forward the characters to the present day. The comic will be drawn by the amazing artistic team of Andrea + Ale.

Anita Morgan, a.k.a. The Purple Tigress, has been reimagined as a fiercely independent woman trying to find her way in the societal boundaries of the 1940s - even while maintaining continuity with her first two published adventures. Assisted by her housemaid Prissy and the miniaturized informant Ritty, Issue #1 introduces a new and fantastic transformation of Anita's goals and abilities. Nearly forgotten characters Mavara, Merciless the Sorceress, Jean Starr, and Bert McQuade round out the cast.

This Fundraiser is to raise the money needed to illustrate the 30 page Issue #1, and there will be two ways to get it - pledge $10 or more and you will get a PDF copy when all the pages are complete. Once those have been distributed, Purple Tigress #1 will start posting page-by-page on PurpleTigress.com for everyone to read. Revenue generated by ads and other income will go towards the creation of Issue #2 (of a planned 6 issue arc).

Please note: the writers view incidental and tasteful nudity as part of life and art. There are two versions of Issue #1 that will be available; one artfully censored and one uncensored. You will be able to specify which you want when pledging.

What We Need & What You Get

$3,000 will fund about two-thirds of Issue #1 (thanks to fees), but we think it is the most realistic goal to set. We have a few rewards for funding our project:

$1 - $4 pledge: Our appreciation, and the knowledge you can read Issue #1 as it posts page-by-page to PurpleTigress.com

$5 - $9 pledge: The above, and your name listed on a dedicated Thank You page on PurpleTigress.com

$10 - $14 pledge: The above, and the completed Issue #1 as a PDF (It is estimated it will take no more than 15 weeks for completion.)

$15 - $19 pledge: The above, and a Character Guide highlighting some of the public domain characters you will see in Issue #1, with old and new character art

$20 - $25: The above, and the first two Purple Tigress adventures redrawn by our artists to act as a bridge between Anita's original adventures and our Issue #1

$100 - $150: The above, and a single-panel cameo as a restaurant patron seen when Anita dines out during Issue #1 (limit three)

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

You can send out the link to this page to friends and family!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And check out PurpleTigress.com for updates and repostings of the original stories that will make up the fabric of this new Untold Golden Age!

story: Thanks for your support.
story_txt: Thanks for your support.

story:
Tattoo Flash - inspired by Sailor Jerry tattoos

Traditional tattoos redesigned to corispond to issue #1 of Anchor Face. 

 

 

Who is Anchor Face?

Welcome Aboard. Anchor Face has resurfaced after having gone missing somewhere on the bottom of the ocean for 10 years. He went missing after being double-crossed by one of his team members and when he finally resurfaced everything had changed. His old superhero team had been decommissioned. All teams have been decommissioned except one government approved superhero team. Achor Face has heard that some of his old team members had escaped to various locations around the world. Come and join Anchor Face on his Odyssey around the world to find his old team members and discover what has happened over the past 10 years as he explores exotic locations, battling ancient beasts and encountering bizarre cultures as well as making new friends and powerful new allies in the fight for all that is good and just.

Some of Anchor Face's adventures are set out at sea but many more are set in the countries and far-off lands that he is forced to explore.

 

Progress Update

 

26 pages of the comic have been drawn, painted and lettered already. When it is completed it will be a 32-page comic book and is the 1st in the Anchor Face series. The funding will be used for the printing of the book.

 

About the Creator

 

My name is Jerry Richardson. I have been living in Japan and China over the past 10 years. When Anchor Face was forced into exile I just happened to be on the same ship that he set sail on. We got talking and he asked if I could write his adventures in comic book form. Before he had a team of writers when he was leading the top superhero teams but now he is exiled he is going indie.

There weren't many others on the ship we set sail on and my background in tattoo design was the closest he could get it an illustrator. So the style in the book is influenced by nautical tattoo designs of the early 1900's. Norman Collins is one of my favorite tattoo artists so his style influences my work. I also like to read Popeye comic strips and watch Hayao Miyazaki's Studio Ghibli movies so there might be a little of that in the work as well. If Anchor Face likes my style for this first book then I hope to do more issues for him but from what I can gather we are sailing to Japan or China at the moment, he might get a new artist from there if he doesn't like my work. I hope I can illustrate another few issues for him at least, even though I get seasick I have loved creating this first issue.

I have seen some amazing things so far on our adventures, things that I could never have imagined. I've been to places that I didn't even know existed and this is all because of Anchor Face. That being said my favorite part of sailing with Anchor Face has been getting to know him and his new crew. Even though I'm just the comic book writer he has still made me feel part of the team. Some say he can be a little cold and steely-eyed but getting to know him I've found he has a good heart, he always looks out for his mates, he has a passion for justice and has dedicated his life to doing what's right. I respect that a lot. The thing I'll remember the most are the people I've met on this journey.

I will be making youtube videos over the coming weeks explaining my process and introducing you more to Anchor Face. My youtube is Jerry Richardson or jerryanchor@protonmail.com

story:
YerStory Comics is a start-up indie comic book and multimedia microstudio.   We are ALL about telling ADDICTIVE STORIES with GENUINE CHARACTERS and REAL STAKES! 

We have invested in producing 4 original titles to showcase the range of storytelling and creative art that we can do! 

In addition to our great storytelling and art, we love the large magazine-style format, so all our comics are in the 8.5" x 11" format, perfect-bound comics! Large pages for large stories -- and ALL high-quality!

We want to begin growing our readership and fan community who love great stories and art as much as we do!

We went the extra step to invest and produce the first issue of each of our comics, and are now looking for funding to get the next issues of comics going by offering these first issues as perks!

 

The River Knows

Two rival detectives must team up to investigate abnormal occurrences and happenings in their small mid-western city...from ghosts, to ghouls, to murderous telepaths and rampaging sorcerers using magic, they must solve all the weird mysteries that come their way...and keep it all undercover...

 

 

 

 

Through Space & Time & Stuff

The worst crew running the worst ship through the worst part of space...what could go wrong...?!

 

 

 

AEON

A disgraced reporter gets the scoop to end all scoops -- his boyhood favorite superhero toys may actually be real--and it's up to him to find them!

 

 

 

UFO: UNDERCOVER!

A blend of "A Current Affair" and "Twin Peaks", this story is for those who are looking for that perfect blend between comedy, "news shows", and horror!

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what we're doing and want to help out, it's pretty simple: subscribe to our instagram page... 

yerstory.transmedia

...and like and follow what we do, and help us spread the word!

story:
*If you receive your perk in person at Comicdom Con, the shipping cost will be returned to you at the con. But, please, keep in mind that I will have limited copies of the book, prints etc. If you want to make sure that I will have your perk at Comicdom send me an e-mail at elenagarts@gmail.com titled "Bloodfest-Comicdom"  with your full name and your perk.

About the book

Bloodfest: Bad Blood is the first installment of a bigger story and my first attempt at creating a webcomic. It launched on Tapastic in 2016 and has since gained a small but solid following. A little over a year later it was successfully completed. You can read the entire thing online:

  • https://tapas.io/series/bloodfest
  • http://bloodfestcomic.tumblr.com/

The goal now is to create a printed version of the comic, so that you can enjoy it whenever and wherever you want, even when the Wi-Fi is wonky. The printed version will include the already existing pages and some exclusive comics & illustrations that are not available online.

The campaign will run on a fixed goal, so if you want a physical copy make sure to contribute to the campaign before it ends. The money raised will be used to cover the printing and shipping costs and various other fees.

The comic book will be a full-color paperback. It will be 88 pages long and 17x24cm in size and it will roughly look like this:

Please, note, that the comic is not suitable for younger readers as it contains intense violence, blood and gore, sexual content and strong language.

 

About the story

Bloodfest: Bad Blood is about vampires, humans and whatever is in-between. It has a little bit of action, a little bit of horror and a lot of suspense. And leather. A lot of shiny leather.

The protagonist is a vampire-human hybrid who calls himself “Nate”. The story starts as Nate wakes up, exhausted and disoriented, in the company of two Vampire Hunters. The three of them are being held in a cell by the Brotherhood, a vampire criminal organization. Now they have to sort out their differences and work together in order to escape.

The story and the characters are heavily inspired by some of my favorite movies from the late 90s and early 2000s, like Blade, Underworld, Resident Evil and a variety of Van Damme and Seagal movies. The idea behind this comic was to take elements from these movies and combine them into a more modern and diverse story.

About the Perks

But the comic book isn't all you get! 

Bookmarks:

With every physical copy of the comic you get two of these badass bookmarks!

Prints:

(A4 Print Pack, A5 Prints Pack, ALL Prints Pack, EVERYTHING Pack)

And don't forget the wide variety of prints! From A5 to A3, on good quality paper. Hang them all over your home and drive your housemates mad!

 

 

 

Tote Bag:

(Tote Bag Pack, EVERYTHING Pack)

You can also get this sexy 33x33cm tote bag, made of Polyester Poplin fabric, with a 35cm-long cotton shoulder strap. Perfect for carrying your copy of the comic around and making all your friends jealous!

 

 

Original Artwork & Commissions:

Original Artwork Pack: One lucky contributor will get to have the two original ink drawings below, on thick A5 paper. 

EVERYTHING Pack: Two other lucky people will get two ink commissions on thick A5 paper (like the ones below)! You can ask for one character of your choice with a simple background (nothing too explicit, please).

"Undead" comic:

(Bloodfest & Undead Pack)

Are you a Greek-speaking contributor? Well, It's your lucky day! If Bloodfest: Bad Blood wasn't enough, you can also get the three issues of my zombie comic Undead!

 I self-published it in three parts from 2015 to 2017. It's about a zombie outbreak in the Greek town of Patras. Each issue is 20-24 pages long and 14,8x21cm in size.

Undead IS NOT IN ENGLISH. Please don't choose this perk if you can't read Greek.

How can you help?

If you want to help but your budget won’t allow it, don’t fret! There are other ways:

  • make an 1$ contribution
  • favorite the campaign
  • leave a comment on the campaign
  • share the campaign on social media
  • write about the campaign and/or the comic on your site or blog
  • tell your friends, your family, your dog!

Timeframe

The comic is completed and the book is ready for printing. Once the campaign is over and the money transferred I will, immediately, start getting all the items ready. Since I have never used crowdfunding before, I may deal with unexpected difficulties. But I’m sure that all the books will be shipped in the following 1-3 months after the campaign's end.

Of course, I will keep you updated about everything!

About the creator

Elena Gogou is an aspiring artist from Greece. She recently received a Master’s degree in mechanical engineering from the University of Patras, but, to her family’s disappointment, has decided to pursue a career as an illustrator and comic artist. She has been creating comics as a hobby since 2014. You might have stumbled on her work at a Greek comic convention or on social media.  Or you might have never heard of her, in which case, hi. Nice to meet you. Thanks for clicking on my campaign. Please contribute. Or comment. Or share. You’re the best. Thanks!

If you want to see more of her work or keep yourself updated about the campaign, follow her on social media. (She uses them a lot. She has no life.)

Since I have never used crowdfunding before, I may deal with unexpected difficulties. She recently received a Master’s degree in mechanical engineering from the University of Patras, but, to her family’s disappointment, has decided to pursue a career as an illustrator and comic artist. story:
Who is BUTCH CLEAVER?

Legend has it...In the town of Oubliette lived a brutal butcher named Butch Cleaver,  Townsfolk say he was murdered then resurrected by a voodoo hex that granted him power to control and weaponize bone, now he uses said power for revenge, reckoning and possibly redemption.

If you threw Batman, Swamp Thing, Jonah Hex and Hellboy into a meat grinder then BUTCH CLEAVER would come out.  With influences of Spaghetti Westerns, SIN CITY, EVIL DEAD and horror movies from the last 80 years BUTCH CLEAVER a 72 page fantasy/horror/western might make the cut that your aiming for to add to your comic collection.

FOR MATURE READERS INTENDED FOR ADULTS ONLY! FOR GORE AND VIOLENCE!

 

UPDATE!  BUTCH CLEAVER #1 TRADING CARD FOR ALL BACKERS!

 

 UPDATE!  ALL BACKERS WILL RECEIVE THE FIRST EVER BUTCH CLEAVER STICKER! BY SIX AM COMICS!

 

 

                   UPDATE!   ALL BACKERS RECEIVE THE DEATH METAL MP3​ TRACK

                           "Roll The Bones" by DEATH METAL HERO & ROT10 GLORY

 

.

 

Back The Sketch Perk

 

Back the Sketch Perk and get a sketch similar to this by Matt (me)

 

 

 

STRETCH GOALS

 

+$4000 Stretch Goal- Added Pages of Behind The Scenes Content and Character Design to the Graphic Novel!--UNLOCKED!!!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to hit our goal.  The funds we are raising are going to the printing of the book, the packaging, shipping, taxes etc...This goal does not include paying me (Matt).  The book is 90% finished I just need to do all the last edits and new campaign art, hopefully stretch goals etc..then it's off to the printers.

 

The Impact

My name is Matt Burke, I'm an indie comics artist/writer, and creator of BUTCH CLEAVER.  BUTCH CLEAVER is a book almost a decade in the making.  It has always been my dream to make comics and entertain people with them that's why I'm excited to launch BUTCH CLEAVER a part 1 of a 3 part monster arch that I will continue to put my blood, sweat, and tears into.

With this book I wanted to tell a story in a Gothic universe where some of my favorite archetypes (cowboys, vikings, banditos, pirates, barbarians, historical figures, legendary figures and folkloric figures.. to name a few) could interact with each other.  I printed 3 issues of BUTCH CLEAVER over the last few years and I have done a successful couple of conventions and signings promoting the story and I think Indiegogo is the next step in bringing Butch to a wider audience.  This campaign would include the first three issues in one perfect bound graphic novel, the best book it could possibly be.  I have created a whole universe of characters and stories that I want to share with the world and BUTCH CLEAVER is a stepping stone into that universe.

 

Risks & Challenges

I am still new to the comics industry and I can promise you that I will always do my best to grow as an artist, writer, story teller and entertainer, but I need your help on this quest to get me there.  This is not a political propaganda pamphlet, just a 90's style influenced comic that will hopefully help you escape reality and entertain you for a bit

I was told I couldn't be an artist, and I keep drawing,  I was told I couldn't make a comic, so I became a self publisher.  I never give up, now I am here and with your help we can make BUTCH CLEAVER LEVEL-UP.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can't back BUTCH CLEAVER then help out by spreading the word and sharing on social media
