story:
The Story Continues in FALLEN #2

FALLEN #2 is a 22 page, full colour second issue of an ongoing series printed on standard American sized comic format on high quality paper.  Fallen will blend the genres of mystery, thriller and fantasy by creating a thrilling mythological detective story. The story takes place in the vibrant, synth-pop filled era of the 1980's in the loud, crowded streets of New York City. 

 Where we left with FALLEN #1, the Godfather himself Zeus was murdered right in front of his ward Casper Clay. The criminal world of deities was sent reeling at the news of an immortal god being taken out. While the Greek family is scrambling to react, Casper's life is sent spiraling as he is expelled from his previous life and exiled from the world he once served...

Who Will Like FALLEN?

Obviously fans of the first book will really enjoy this one but if you're just getting on board now and you like any of these things, you're going to love FALLEN;

80's Pop Culture - FALLEN is inspired by and infused with a lot of the 80's classics from music,  movies and style.

Mythology - Doesn't matter if you're a fan of Greek, Norse or any other mythology, FALLEN is going to touch on it all.

Crime Thriller - If you're intrigued by stories of crime, murder and mystery. It's like a mash up of John Wick, Constantine and Clash of the Titans.

FALLEN is inspired by neo-noire stories like Blade Runner, Blade Runner 2049 and fantasy stories like Fables and The Wolf Among Us.

Press:

"FALLEN provides a new spin on an old tale and does it by infusing the story with dirt, grime, and some godly magic. FALLEN is a must-read for lovers of mythology, crime dramas, or well-constructed comics." -  Monkeys Fighting Robots 

"If you enjoyed Hercules or The Odyssey (the Poem and subsequent 90s mini-series) – then you’ll lap up what this comic book has in store for you." -  Soda and Telepaths 

 

Rewards

 

Preview:

Issue 1 Cover

Issue 1 Variant Cover

Issue 1 Page 1

Issue 1 Page 2

Issue 1 Page 3

Issue 1 Page 4

Issue 2 Cover

Issue 2 Page 1 (black and white)

Issue 2 Page 2 (black and white)

Issue 2 Page 3 (black and white)

Creative Team:

The team has stayed the same with the three of us still passionately working on the series;

Matt: Creator and Writer of FALLEN. Matt has been working on the concept for the story for over 2 years. It was originally developed for a comic format and then  considered making it a novel. As Matt continued writing, the imagery that he wanted to convey would only be given justice in the colourful pages of a comic. 

 Henry: Henry is a talented and professional artist based out of the Philippines. He is a published Graphic Novel Artist on books like Children's Vampire Hunting Brigade volume 1&2, Alterna Comics Tinsel Town, The Devil Within, Seven Legions and various contributions on anthologies. To see more of his work visit:  https://www.artstation.com/henryponciano 

 Toben:  Toben Racicot writes and letters comics. He’s worked on Beastlands, The Wild Cosmos, Thorn Squadron, Menagerie, and Rumble Kings. Together with his wife, Alaire Racicot they created Crown & Anchor, the fantasy sci-fi pirate adventure. He also runs multiple Dungeons & Dragons campaigns and continues the hunt in Bloodborne, and is taking parenting lessons from Kratos as he plays God of War (2018). He’s also working on a PhD in Role Playing Games and Adaptation Theory at the University of Waterloo. To see more of his work visit: artstation.com/letterdrone

 

Timeline

Here is the projected timeline for the project;

Artwork completed: November-December 2020

Book manufacturing and freight: December 2020

Shipping of rewards: December 2020

Risks and challenges

FALLEN #2 was successfully funded on Kickstarter. The risks are relatively low for this one. I learned quite a bit from the last one and plan on applying my experience to streamline the process and speed up production. The script is 100% complete and the artwork is 25% complete. One of the issues I had with the last campaign was the printing service I used had a hard time getting the shipments through customs in a timely manner and added some huge delays to the project. The new service I switched to, and will be using on this one is extremely fast and will cut down the wait time for books by months.
story_txt: The Story Continues in FALLEN #2FALLEN #2 is a 22 page, full colour second issue of an ongoing series printed on standard American sized comic format on high quality paper.  Fallen will blend the genres of mystery, thriller and fantasy by creating a thrilling mythological detective story. The story takes place in the vibrant, synth-pop filled era of the 1980's in the loud, crowded streets of New York City.  Where we left with FALLEN #1, the Godfather himself Zeus was murdered right in front of his ward Casper Clay. The criminal world of deities was sent reeling at the news of an immortal god being taken out. While the Greek family is scrambling to react, Casper's life is sent spiraling as he is expelled from his previous life and exiled from the world he once served...Who Will Like FALLEN?Obviously fans of the first book will really enjoy this one but if you're just getting on board now and you like any of these things, you're going to love FALLEN;80's Pop Culture - FALLEN is inspired by and infused with a lot of the 80's classics from music,  movies and style.Mythology - Doesn't matter if you're a fan of Greek, Norse or any other mythology, FALLEN is going to touch on it all.Crime Thriller - If you're intrigued by stories of crime, murder and mystery. It's like a mash up of John Wick, Constantine and Clash of the Titans.FALLEN is inspired by neo-noire stories like Blade Runner, Blade Runner 2049 and fantasy stories like Fables and The Wolf Among Us.Press:"FALLEN provides a new spin on an old tale and does it by infusing the story with dirt, grime, and some godly magic. FALLEN is a must-read for lovers of mythology, crime dramas, or well-constructed comics." -  Monkeys Fighting Robots "If you enjoyed Hercules or The Odyssey (the Poem and subsequent 90s mini-series) – then you’ll lap up what this comic book has in store for you." -  Soda and Telepaths  Rewards Preview:Issue 1 CoverIssue 1 Variant CoverIssue 1 Page 1Issue 1 Page 2Issue 1 Page 3Issue 1 Page 4Issue 2 CoverIssue 2 Page 1 (black and white)Issue 2 Page 2 (black and white)Issue 2 Page 3 (black and white)Creative Team:The team has stayed the same with the three of us still passionately working on the series;Matt: Creator and Writer of FALLEN. Matt has been working on the concept for the story for over 2 years. It was originally developed for a comic format and then  considered making it a novel. As Matt continued writing, the imagery that he wanted to convey would only be given justice in the colourful pages of a comic.  Henry: Henry is a talented and professional artist based out of the Philippines. He is a published Graphic Novel Artist on books like Children's Vampire Hunting Brigade volume 1&2, Alterna Comics Tinsel Town, The Devil Within, Seven Legions and various contributions on anthologies. To see more of his work visit:  https://www.artstation.com/henryponciano  Toben:  Toben Racicot writes and letters comics. He’s worked on Beastlands, The Wild Cosmos, Thorn Squadron, Menagerie, and Rumble Kings. Together with his wife, Alaire Racicot they created Crown & Anchor, the fantasy sci-fi pirate adventure. He also runs multiple Dungeons & Dragons campaigns and continues the hunt in Bloodborne, and is taking parenting lessons from Kratos as he plays God of War (2018). He’s also working on a PhD in Role Playing Games and Adaptation Theory at the University of Waterloo. To see more of his work visit: artstation.com/letterdrone TimelineHere is the projected timeline for the project;Artwork completed: November-December 2020Book manufacturing and freight: December 2020Shipping of rewards: December 2020Risks and challengesFALLEN #2 was successfully funded on Kickstarter. The risks are relatively low for this one. I learned quite a bit from the last one and plan on applying my experience to streamline the process and speed up production. The script is 100% complete and the artwork is 25% complete. One of the issues I had with the last campaign was the printing service I used had a hard time getting the shipments through customs in a timely manner and added some huge delays to the project. The new service I switched to, and will be using on this one is extremely fast and will cut down the wait time for books by months.

story:
Story Summary: 

  • In a distant star system the soldier known as Lazerith tenaciously maintains peace and security on his home world of Darason.  He is a Lancer Lieutenant commanding a special recon Lancer Squad.  Strife rages throughout the Inner Sphere Protectorate demanding a hard life for the Lancers. 

  • Will Lazerith succeed in his endeavor being a loving husband and father as he struggles against an expanding threat bigger then he could ever imagine? Will he give everything in the service of his family, people and even the celestial creator herself?

Who We Are (Crew):

Hello my name is Craig and I’m representing the company Antiquity Films who is producing this graphic novel.  I have worked in the film industry within the production and wardrobe departments.  I have produced a number of short and full feature films.  I have also worked on other film productions with multimillion dollar budgets.  I’m now ready to start this “Celestials” story.  I have gathered a professional team of comic book artists and writers and know we will have a high quality and valued book as a result. 

Craig Alarie (Creator, Writer, Editor, Co-Art Director & Publisher)

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3910229/

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4577347/?ref_=ttfc_fc_cr176

Randy Kintz (Artist)

http://rantz.deviantart.com/

Ozzy Fernandez (Artist & Co-Art Director)

http://dovianax.deviantart.com/

Jesse Heagy (Colorist)

http://heagsta.deviantart.com/

Taylor Esposito (Letterer)

http://www.ghostglyphstudios.com/

Angel Fuentes (Assistant Editor)

http://www.panicopress.com/author-bio.html


What we are doing and Goals:

  • Antiquity Films is proud to introduce the heroic character known as Lazerith whom will be later known as Sunfax.  We have invested a lot of time and money into this stories development including short films that have helped smooth out the world creation.

  • We have big plans for the “Celestials” title starting with a 2 part miniseries graphic novel that will lead into a web series truly capturing the world that is trapped between the conflict of heaven and hell.  In order to do this we need for this first book a budget of $14,850 to cover artist, designers and various other expenses. 




Money Destination:

Contributions from $5 to $1100 are all appreciated, but 1 Billion would be welcomed happily...


Perks:




Risks& Challenges

We confidently guarantee zero to none and the reason is the book is almost done.  What’s required is paying the artists and designers.  Wither the full amount for the campaign is reached or not we will acquire the remaining funds on our own to complete this book and deliver it immediately with perks to our fans.

Other Ways You Can Help

Free Ways to Help:

If you can’t contribute financially but still want to help this project become a success we have some ideas that we will truly appreciate your assistance with:

  • Let others know this project exists! Share on facebook or other social networks! Be sure to like our Facebook page! Everything helps! 
  • Inform your friends, family or people you don’t like about the project!
  • Email and or text friends you think would be interested!

Thank You:

Thank you for your time and we hope you will take this journey with us!

story:
Hi! I’m Brian Defferding – author, artist and publisher of the gothic horror graphic novel series “School.” This is my Indiegogo fundraiser for the sixth issue of the series.

For those of you who are not familiar with the story, I’ll give you a little background. The story centers around a 12-year-old girl named Lindsay, it begins with her “waking up” inside an elementary school, covered in blood. Furthermore, she realizes she’s not just covered in blood, she is actually dead and is a ghost, ever-living inside the walls of the school, with little memory of her past. This story is about her recollecting her past, unraveling the mystery behind her death, and meeting some other ghostly friends – and enemies – along the way. It’s creepy, it’s frightening, it’s tragic, it’s something COMPLETELY different from any other comic you have ever read or seen.

This book started out as my senior project at Minneapolis College of Art and Design all the way back to 2001. I got 12 pages done; almost one-half of the issue. After I graduated, I put the pages away, forgetting about it for a few years. When I moved back to my hometown in Wisconsin in 2003, after unpacking my art I found those pages again; and realized this was a great idea with so much potential to be a wonderful story. Thus, I picked up where I left off, and my first 32 page self-published, self-distributed comic came out in June 2005. I have been at it ever since, working on it when I can, selling and promoting it at conventions around the US.


What I Need, What You Will Get

Because this venture is pretty much a one-man show, and it is not distributed through Diamond Comics Previews catalog, this is where you come into play. I need to raise money for printing costs of both the sixth issue as well as reprints of the previous issues; and I have TONS of awesome merch and swag to toss in for anyone that wants to jump on board - from custom commission drawings, hand-painted tile coasters, T-shirts and mugs to an eight-piece poster set. I’ll also be selling paintings. Stretch goals will include reprints of previous issue, hardcover options, and more merch/swag for the masses!

"Squidface" 9"x9" print - goes with a $30 contribution along with a copy of the book.

"The Lake" 11"x17" print - goes with a $50 contribution along with a copy of the book.

"Transistor Infection" 12x12 print - receive this with the sixth issue with a $30 contribution!

Receive this 11x14" drawing on Bristol paper for a $60 contribution!

Receive this 11x14" drawing on Bristol paper for a $50 contribution!

"Goodnight, My Sweet" 9x9 acrylic painting - receive this with a $80 contribution!

The Impact

Without gushing too much, this is my labor of love. I’m doing this project because I believe in the story, and I truly think you will be blown away. Your help bringing this dark tale to light means the world to me.

Risks & Challenges

This comic series is not carried through any major distributor - specifically, Diamond Comics. In comics, if your book is not carried through Diamond's catalog to all comic retailers, it likely won't see print because retailers will never know your comic exists. However thanks to years of promoting at pop culture conventions, I have assembled a fanbase and it's constantly building. With the help of donors, I can set aside money to attend more conventions around the US, maybe even the globe, to bring my comic to the masses without the need for a major distributor.

I already have almost all the art done; I just need to scan the art and design the cover/inside cover pages. The biggest challenge for me is time to scan all the art into files for the printer; I work in a size that requires me to scan the art from four pieces, then assemble it all together through Photoshop. Scanning 120 pages is quite the task. I will be spending a lot of time in front of the computer with spirals in my eyes, ha! The fortunate thing is, this is probably the toughest part of the job. Everything else will be fun and exciting.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.  This is an independent creative endeavor and I would love to be heard!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!  Put this link in your social media news feeds, anything that can bring some clicks towards this project will be a positive effort!

Last but not least - THANK YOU for supporting independent comics!

story:
Short Summary

When The Voluntaryists rescue Edward Snowden, Julian Assange offers a safe house in Ecuadorian shelter. However, the NSA has other plans to disrupt this attempt at asylum. Can the Voluntaryists keep both Snowden and Assange shielded from impending doom? Join us in this epic battle to expose invasive government spying as the Voluntaryists take on the NSA in this continuation of their most daring adventure yet!The Voluntaryists versus the NSA part 2: Shielding Assange!

· HISTORY: Voluntaryist was created by liberty fanatic and costumer Jaime Sherman, whose passion for liberty is only matched by his passion for cosplay photography. He began the long process of creating the series while trudging through his graduate studies.

· GOAL: To get The Voluntaryists versus the NSA in digital copy and print to share with you, and, eventually, the world via a free download.

· PAGE COUNT: 22 new pages estimated for a 100% funded campaign.

We will produce as much of the comic as we can get funded for! The storyline may be adjusted to tailor to the funding level.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $4,000 to get this comic’s potential fully going.

The expenses are largely for the cost of hiring artists to produce the comic and the expenses associated with putting the comic into print format. 

You can support us by making a contribution on the right-hand side by Credit Card/Debit Card or Paypal.

In addition, you can redeem perks for your support such as:

--->$2 – Thank you A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address to receive this. A personal “thank-you” will be made by having your name read among others in a Youtube video. (Aliases are permitted but must be specifically stated and PG rated.)

--->$6– Sticker A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address to receive this.

--->$10 – Early Release Digital Comic The DIGITAL COMIC in .pdf format early release. - Make sure you provide your correct e-mail to receive this.

--->$15 Sticker + Comic in .pdf format - A Voluntaryist sticker mailed to you + the Comic in .pdf format. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$20 Desktop Wallpaper + Comic in .pdf – Receive a digital Voluntaryist desktop wallpaper for your computer background. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$25 Comic .pdf + ArtCards The DIGITAL COMIC in .pdf format early release + (2) 4x6 inch Voluntaryist artcards. Make sure you provide your correct e-mail to receive this.

--->$35– Signed PRINT COPY of the comic. - Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this.

--->$50 Comic + Sticker + Art Print The signed Snowden comic, art print, and a sticker mailed to you. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address to receive this. International supporters add $5 USD.

--->$65 – NSA Issue 1 & 2 Signed Receive a signed Shielding Assange: The Voluntaryists versus the NSA part 2 and Saving Snowden: The Voluntaryists Vversus the NSA. International supporters add $10 USD.

--->$85 - Signed Comic + Poster Signed PRINT COPY of the comic AND a Voluntaryist comic poster 19"x13". - Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. International supporters add $10 USD.

--->$120 All 5 Issues Signed Receive a signed #1 Special Edition, a signed copy of the Voluntaryists Versus Statist Zombies, a signed Voluntaryists Versus the TSA, a signed Saving Snowden: The Voluntaryists versus The NSA, and a signed Shielding Assange: The Voluntaryists verus the NSA 2. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. International supporters add $25.

--->$150 Volun-tee Get a Voluntaryist T-Shirt + signed printed comic! Choose a color (Red, Black, White) and a character (Voluntaryist or Voluntaria). Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. International supporters add $20 USD.

--->$250 –½ page Ad Sponsor - ½ page Ad Sponsor -Get an advertisement (PG-13 rated) for half a comic page.  Buy two of these perks for a whole page. Receive a signed printed copy of the comic. Must provide shipping address to receive comic. International supporters add $10 USD for comic.

--->$300 ACTION FIGURE STANDALONE Get your unique Voluntaryist team action figure made by the talented Short Fuse Media Group + signed comic in print format. Choose from Voluntaryist, Voluntaria, AnCat, or Mack Lee. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. International International supporters add $50 USD for shipping.

--->$350 ACTION FIGURE IN PACKAGING Get your unique Voluntaryist team action figure made by the talented Short Fuse Media Group with custom packaging +signed comic print format. Choose from Voluntaryist, Voluntaria, AnCat, or Mack Lee. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. International supporters add $50 USD for shipping.

--->$400 Comic Caricature Get a custom hero caricature of yourself in an 8.5 x 11 inch print + the signed comic. (Note: This is not the comic appearance perk. Final design and implementation is subject to our creation. We will do our best to make it great!)  International supporters add $20.

--->$600 Comic Appearance Have you ever wanted to experience comic form? Get cartoonized in a custom caricature and appear inside the comic. Also receive a signed comic copy. Make sure you provide your correct mailing address and e-mail to receive this. (NOTE: Final design and implementation is subject to our discretion. We will do our best to make it great!)  International supporters add $10.

--->$1000 Voluntaryist SuperSuit + Comic Have you ever wanted to suit up for liberty? Now you can with a custom Voluntaryist zentai suit. You will receive your very own custom-tailored Voluntaryist hero suit as well as the signed comic. You will need to provide your measurements to receive the tailoring. A sizing guide will be provided. Make sure you put down your mailing address to receive this perk.  International supporters add $25.

While the comic is a fictional storyline, our hope is that the comic is something that goes beyond its entertainment value. We would like the comic to get into the hands of people who are unfamiliar with the NSA's spying and the current state of affairs. We want to wake people up to Voluntaryism and truly-free living using the comic medium because it breaks traditional genre barriers.

PUBLIC RELEASE:

We will be releasing the comic to download for free eventually, but those who paid to get the comic e-mailed or printed will receive it FIRST and will receive the comic about a month AHEAD of everyone else.

SO, with that in mind, don’t be shy about supporting at the $2 or $5 levels because EVERY dollar counts to making the comic come into existence. That we need you to be our hero for

<-----Sample Comic Pages from Saving Snowden: The Voluntaryists VS. the NSA----->


<-----Saving Snowden: The Voluntaryists VS. the NSA----->

STRETCH GOALS!

If we raise above funding, we will begin to produce the origins story graphic novel, which is also our next comic campaign. All who support this campaign will receive digital previews of the origins story. Those who support this campaign with physical perk purchases will receive a special print from the next issue's pages. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have pocket change to spare, you can still help us get the message out by sharing our campaign and sharing our videos on YouTube.

Use the indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:

WEBSITE:http://volcomic.com

FACEBOOK:http://www.facebook.com/sire.voluntary

YOUTUBE:http://youtube.com/thevoluntaryists

Share Tweets about the campaign with: #SHIELDINGASSANGE

ALSO! Please make sure you give us your proper address for whatever perk you redeem. If you have any questions, please direct them to Jaime at mr.voluntary@gmail.com. 

READ THE FIRST NSA DIGITAL ISSUE FOR NO COST HERE: FREE COMIC DOWNLOAD

And that’s all there is to it. ( :

story:
What's P2 anyway?

President- Charsya Paul
Vice President- Moyia Hardeman
Video Editor- Kimberly Rogers

P2 Manga was established in July 2008. It was created by Charsya Paul, an aspiring OEL manga artist who wanted to make her mark for something she believe strongly in. So why the word manga instead of comics? "Manga" in nothing but a word that means comics. Because manga is so popularized in American society, what other way to get artist interested than to have them relate to something so familiar.

Charsya realized how a lot of American artist who were interested in the manga drawing style weren't really looked upon for the very reason OEL is frowned upon--they weren't from Japan. OEL mangas have a story to tell too,and this sparked the birth of P2. Although some of the artist that worked along side her were not American, she also pushed for their work as well. Along with her cousin Moyia Hardeman, we have dedicated ourselves to our artistsby making their dreams come true and even helping artist improve where their weakness' are. Moyia has taken out time in her school schedule to critique artist, help them develop a stronger story and grasp the concept of the importance of being original. 





Our Titles

Blood + Cross
Can't Learn
Daemonology
Dark-N-Light
DeathFairy
Freakshow
Moonlight
My Boyfriend is an Anime Character
NeverenD
Ophir
Ribon
Scherzo
(Yui & Yusuke) School Fight
The Glass River
X2

ARTIST FROM DIFFERENT PARTS OF THE WORLD UNITE!

How can you help P2 and what do you get outta the deal?

Moyia and I have struggled to get a good fan base over these 5 years we've been active. So far our statistics show that we have a good fan base in France, Philippines, as well as the United States. HOW AWESOME IS THAT! We've had fans purchase our unique books from our site as well as online stores. However, even though we've had sales with our books, we also had to belt out more than what was coming In. so here's how you can help, we are relying on you our wonderful fans and supporters of OEL mangas everywhere to help contribute to our cause. We want to keep the good fight for fellow OEL manga artists' everywhere to show them that there is a company out here that want to help people realize their dreams of being published. If you are able to help support this cause you will recieve a nice bundle of stuff depending on the amount you give.

The Impact

As we mentioned, in our quest to expand our reach in the publishing world we hit a lot of bumps In the road. We had to belt out a lot of money to try to straighten things out and to be sure to pay our lovely authors of these wonderful books That they created. We were able to limp this far but our legs have finally given out. We are hanging on by a thread to keep this dream alive for not only us and our authors, but to those who believe in our goal we set forward. This money would be used to slowly pick up the damaged pieces of our fragile little company so we can start over and try another approach at pleaseing all parties involved in this endeavor. We are proud to have said that we started out as an artist trying to realize her dream and backed up by family and friends able to stand for 5 years. Year by year we have learned what it means to publish OEL titles and the hardship it takes to push these titles to become equal with that of Japanese manga.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to help us financially then help by spreading the word to other fans of OEL manga artist and small press companies. Either way we will be greatly appreciactive of any help we can get. Please help us in our campaign, and trust  us when we say that we hate to even ask this, but our authors wanted us to give it our best shot! So we hope to do our best for them!

Future Plans

P2 Manga started out as a small project but has grown to much, much more. If our goals are met we have a couple of ideas in order to help our artist. They include ebooks, magazines, and possibly more titles. These funds are for the sole purpose of being able to help young artist get their stories published. Because of the trouble we are in, we had to close our submission period disappointing A LOT of aspiring artist. With this money, we can push our titles further out of Louisiana and get the physical books in stores around the world. With this, we can possibly expand our company little by little. We can continue being the light that allows artist to take a stand and say "I want to be recognized!" We have so many ideas and because of what has happened we havent had the chance to show how great P2 Manga can truly be.

With this money, we can push our titles further out of Louisiana and get the physical books in stores around the world. With this, we can possibly expand our company little by little. We can continue being the light that allows artist to take a stand and say "I want to be recognized!" We have so many ideas and because of what has happened we havent had the chance to show how great P2 Manga can truly be.

story:
STORY

After Ruby’s family is murdered by command of the evil warlock, Hadomeer, she swears revenge upon him. She knows she needs power and numbers to stand a chance against his magic and his army. She needs to find the Lost Grimoire containing all the known secrets of the ancient world. Along her quest she will find new powers and new warriors to join her quest.

Preview

" ...Spotti’s art is all very precise and done very well, nothing out of order, nothing there that wasn’t absolutely necessary and beautiful looking." Ian Yarington of Comicbooked.com



P

Perks

story:
Dear Reader,

My name's Atabay and I'd like to tell you why I think my book 21st Century Man is worth your investment. 

21st Century Man is an original graphic novel of 70 pages with art by Kostas Pantoulas (Lost In Space: The Lost Adventures, Electromagnate: The Book of Rebel Nations), lettering by Buddy Beaudoin (Prat) & Lucas Gattoni (Kinetic), and beautiful covers by up-and-coming concept illustrator Julian Cruz. 

21st Century Man focuses on the daily life of David, a jaded city  dweller struggling to keep up with the expectations of modern society. 

The world births us, raises us with its own arbitrary and often times nonsensical standards of behavior then shoots us like a cannon ball into adult world. We're left with very little insight as to how we tick, or what we truly want. How could we possibly hope to understand our fellow travelers when we're complete mysteries to ourselves? This is where the Monster comes in. The Monster's vicious, unrelenting and he has an insatiable appetite for human flesh. He also pushes away everyone close to David and ruins his every shot at having a productive, successful life. Just like the monster inside of you, then.

Chapter 1 deals with the place the Monster takes in David's life as he attempts to live the way one ought to. Well paying, but menial job. Finding a soul compatible with your own. Becoming something more than just a complex system of synapses in a closed off vessel. Chapter 2 sees our protagonist suffer the repercussions of his innate malevolence and his struggle to drop his bad habits, complete with nightmarish visions of a world dead-set on making his life a living hell. Chapter 3 investigates the role the Monster plays in the lives of others, and the various ways it affects them, for better or worse. Would David put a hold on his own suicide to help a child retrieve his lost balloon?

You might think that all sounds like portentous dribble (it is), however the book will employ these grand themes to tell a character driven story of ordinary people playing the game of life with a bad hand. Our protagonist is molded in the tradition of Patrick Bateman (American Psycho), Elliot Alderson (Mr. Robot), and Tyler Durden (Fight Club); all intellectuals suffering from a deep moral rot, of which is usually manifested as a hatred of others and a disconnect from reality. We will take that template of protagonist and drop him in the framework of something like (500) Days of Summer.

The book is finely penciled, hand inked and painted with water colors. It is also mostly presented to you in pages with 5 or 6 panels of equal size like window panes allowing you to bear witness to the intimate truths of peoples' souls. It truly looks like nothing else on the stands today. I now present to you the covers of our 3 chapters, as well an excerpt of chapter 2.

 

What we're funding right now is for the first book in a trilogy. Our book is one we believe in and have worked hard to fully produce to be printed and read by you, dear reader. Our brilliant artist, Kostas and our talented letterers, Buddy & Lucas each have various industry credits to their name and thus have years of experience of successfully fulfilling expectations of quality and speed. Any bumps in the printing process will be promptly communicated to all backers.

Thanks for reading,

Atabay

story:
A Unique Veteran History and Art Project.

At Full Mag we work with military veterans to present their first-person stories, in their words, in our high-quality graphic novel and military history magazine.  Our team of veterans and historians captures stories that would otherwise be lost to the ages while providing a platform for artists to honor the veteran storytellers.  Each story presented is the result of an interview by the Full Mag team, or the written word of the storyteller. 

Our second volume just won the 2020 MWSA Gold Medal award in the graphic novel category. 

Now we are set to publish the third volume of this award winning series and we need your help.

Full Mag: Veteran Stories Illustrated, Vol. 3 is bigger and better than ever... 10 stories, 88 pages,  magazine sized, perfect bound, printed in the USA in full color on 80# paper.   These amazing first-person stories, illustrated by the best graphic artists, can only be told by those who experienced the events themselves.  This volume includes the amazing veteran stories of:

  • WW II Combat Engineer, crossing the Rhine- by Harold Vachal, art by J.W. Erwin
  • WW II Soldiers overrun during the Battle of the Bulge- by Bob Buntin, art by Gary Martin
  • WW II Airman shot down over Italy- by Eldon Dahl, art by Nossretep
  • WW II and just after, B-29 crew over the Pacific-by Norm Meuller, art by Thomas Muzzell
  • A Marine's Story: from childhood during the Depression to Pacific island battles to Korea, presented in four chapters plus a Q&A, by Marvin Strombo, art by Gary Martin, Fernando Ruiz, Kim DeMulder, and Max Davenport
  • WW II, Nisei 100th Battalion, Go for Broke- by Stan Izumigawa, art by Lou Manna
  • Baghdad ER, 86th Combat Support Hospital-by Dacia M Arnold, art by Cassandra Dale
  • Afghanistan, bird's eye view over 10 years-by Darin Gaub, art by Thomas Muzzell
  • Operation in Cambodia-by Mark Potes, art by Lou Manna and Bill Anderson
  • Replacement at Inchon and rodeo rider-by James Aplan, art by Thomas Muzzell

What We Need & What You Get

The largest expenses, by far, for this unique veteran history project are the costs of paying artists and printing. 

We believe in paying artists competitive page rates and that is what we do.  For many reasons Full Mag must be printed in the USA and it is!  We believe in putting out the highest quality product and putting quality and care into every step of this process and that is what we do.  This volume represents untold thousands of hours of time from the veterans and our team.  You the customer and sponsor benefit from all of this. 

When you support our campaign and receive your copies of Full Mag, you are part of the team that obtains and presents the stories of these veterans while supporting the arts in a real way, by providing paying work to artists.  You receive the product of thousands of hours of work and the opportunity to read these amazing first-person accounts in a wonderfully engaging format.  This is unlike any other veteran history project. 

Gold Medal Review & Testimony from Veteran Participants

The feedback from veteran participants and/or their families is quite moving.  Here we share some of those quotes and from the Military Writers Society of America review of our most recent volume, which won the 2020 Gold Medal in the graphic novel category...  

FULL MAG is a terrific read, a terrific graphic novel, and a terrific tribute to the men and women of the armed forces. Strongly recommended. -- MWSA Review

The whole magazine is excellently done. I was so impressed by the art. The story is so well done. Thank you for a great job.  I can't wait till I can give them to my family. --  quote from Vietnam veteran storyteller

I also want to tell you how meaningful it was for my Dad to know that his stories would live on. What you are all doing is such important work.  Thank you from the bottom of my heart.-- quote from daughter of WW II storyteller

Yesterday was the 75 Anniversary of Operation Market Garden.  They celebrate it still. Yesterday church bells ringing at 10:45: the hour the airborne forces left England: ceremonies and memorials all day long.  Today allied vets come for ceremony at Grave just north of St Hubert's.  I sent a copy of Full Mag... to.... She took your Full Mag to her class: this Anniversary they wrote essays on the subject: over here [America] none know about it unless you're a historian!!! -- quote from storyteller wife of WW II veteran.

A Great Opportunity

This campaign has a very low risk of non-fulfillment.  We have done this before and practice the philosophy of continuous improvement.  You will receive your product. 

The art and printing costs for this veteran history project are very high.  However, Full Mag also makes a great gift and it is important to share these veteran stories.  This combines to create an opportunity for sponsors.  We humbly ask that you pick up some extra copies.  Providing copies of Full Mag to your network shows folks that you are part of the team that is obtaining and presenting these stories so they are not lost.     

You are not alone!

Full Mag is also sponsored by First Spear, Magpul Industries, Hoplite Industries, Hamilton & Co. CPAs, and the Veterans Leadership Program.  Without these sponsors, we could not do this.  You will see their amazing ads in this volume. 

In addition, Full Magazine Publishing has also donated ad space to several organizations in this volume including: Warriors and Quiet Waters, the American Legion, the Montana Veterans Memorial, and the Semper Fi & America's Fund.

Yesterday was the 75 Anniversary of Operation Market Garden.  They celebrate it still. Yesterday church bells ringing at 10:45: the hour the airborne forces left England: ceremonies and memorials all day long.  Today allied vets come for ceremony at Grave just north of St Hubert's.  I sent a copy of Full Mag... to.... She took your Full Mag to her class: this Anniversary they wrote essays on the subject: over here [America] none know about it unless you're a historian!!! -- quote from storyteller wife of WW II veteran.


A Great Opportunity
This campaign has a very low risk of non-fulfillment.  We have done this before and practice the philosophy of continuous improvement.  You will receive your product. 
The art and printing costs for this veteran history project are very high.  However, Full Mag also makes a great gift and it is important to share these veteran stories.  This combines to create an opportunity for sponsors.  We humbly ask that you pick up some extra copies.  Providing copies of Full Mag to your network shows folks that you are part of the team that is obtaining and presenting these stories so they are not lost.     


You are not alone!
Full Mag is also sponsored by First Spear, Magpul Industries, Hoplite Industries, Hamilton & Co. CPAs, and the Veterans Leadership Program.  Without these sponsors, we could not do this.  You will see their amazing ads in this volume. 
In addition, Full Magazine Publishing has also donated ad space to several organizations in this volume including: Warriors and Quiet Waters, the American Legion, the Montana Veterans Memorial, and the Semper Fi & America's Fund.

story:
The Why

Hey Knuckle Head,

D-String here and today I'd like to tell you a little bit about my life.  Since I was 6 years old my only goal was to be a writer. While all the other first graders were coloring, playing games, and making friends (three things I was not very good at) I was drawing and writing books.  On every front cover that I drew on torn out pieces of spiral notebook paper I would proudly write "By: Daniel Ravenda" in the bottom right corner. I knew back then that what I really wanted to be was a writer.

 

  Countless novel drafts, series, poems, and children's books later I have finally realized my dream of being a published author.  Back to Your Roots Is the first written work that I have ever seen come to print, so naturally It means a lot to me. Oh and ironically I forgot to tell the artist to put "By: Daniel Ravenda" in the bottom right corner.... Sorry six year old self, but hey at least we made it. 

What We Need & What You Get

Ok great, I did it.  I wrote, published, and printed a written work.  Now what?  Well now comes the real hard part, making more.

Illustrating comics isn't cheap, and well for those of you who know me you know I have the artistic ability of an iguana... and iguana who's lost a hand.... Two hands.....  Anyway, I was very lucky to come across an artist Brook Waterwriter, who illustrated the entire comic, and commissioned her to bring my work to life.  WOW! As you can tell she did an amazing job, every page is exactly how Imagined it when writing the script. 

I am setting a goal of $5000 to help me put out an entire series of GKM comic books, because as you'll see, I've only just begun telling this story.  Thats where you Knuckle Heads come in.  Every dollar you pledge to our campaign is another dollar towards making that 6 year old boy's dreams become a reality, and to show our appreciation we have come up with some fantastic perk packages for you!

What's it About?

Back to Your Roots tells the story of GKM from the very beginning.... 2000 years in the future.  Everything you will read is based on real events.

Now you OG Knuckle Heads may remember Back to Your Roots as our first Studio LP, and yes it was, but Scatterbrain, YDK, and Sax Dan were sadly not feature on any of those songs. =( 

Worry not though because we re-recorded and reimagined 3 GKM Classics.  Its the songs you love with the sound you love even more.  We will be releasing these songs as an EP on  FridayMay 24th 2019.

Track list

-Childhood

-Rebels on the Run (Featuring Jenna Rose)

-Go That Way

 

Thank you for your continued support of GKM and our artistic endeavors.

D-String Plushie

Limited Quantities Available

Physical copies of the Back to Your Roots comic are extremely limited, so you wont want to miss your chance to get this exclusive merchandise.

Only 50 Physical copies of the comic will be printed.

Only 30 Vinyl will printed.

Plushies will only be available through Indie GoGo

story:
I’m Scott, the publisher and writer of this book, and I’m joined by Ian Waryanto (The Mighty Mascots) and he is killing it with his art.  To complement him I’ve recruited Farah Nurmaliza to color this beast and Eric Weathers (Monster M.D., Jawbreakers) on letters.  I know the covers had to represent, so I got Tedd Lehman (Flying Fortress) and Faradilla for Cover A and my boy Narwahl (Earthbound) to give his special touch to Cover B. 

This book is for YOU.  If you see something that you like or something that you don't please let me know and either we will do more of the good and weed out the bad.  If the customers don't buy this book then it won't exsist so THANK YOU!

More Stretch Goals to follow!

DIGITAL COMIC: High Quality digital version of DOORKICKERS: Panzer Demon in PDF format with all the extras included in the printed book.  

SIGNED COMIC BOOK: A 48+ page perfect bound, high quality printed, signed comic book telling the entire first story of DOORKICERS: Panzer Demon in its entirety!

PIN-UP POSTER: A high quality foldout poster with striking art by Gabo Elias.

story:
With the full support of living Drexciya member Gerald Donald and the surviving family members of James Stinson. This project will be guided to its completion by A. Qadim Haqq. Haqq’s legendary concept imagery associated with the Detroit techno community and beyond for almost 30 years and his contributions to the mythology at the time of conception makes him uniquely positioned to lead this endeavor. He will be supported by his team of artists (including fellow Detroit Techno Art Gallery partner, the legendary Alan Oldham) and members of X-971 Northwest Drexciyan Outpost.

The novel is currently in development and targeted for completion on what would have been James Stinson's 50th Birthday September 14, 2019.

We are seeking financial assistance through this fundraiser from the Drexciyan community and beyond to lend support in a time of need to help bring relief to the family of the late Drexciyan member James Stinson through the completion of this first volume of the graphic series.. As many of you know James was one of the members of the infamous duo Drexciya of Underground Resistance fame. In 2002 James Stinson sadly left us early to prepare the Drexciyan Empire for its next chapter! Since then hardships have fallen on his family which include his mother.

Funds are needed to compensate artists and production costs.

A full 50% all funds raised will be given directly to James Stinson's mother. Therefore, a goal of $10,000 has been established to support:

1.) To help the family of James Stinson - His mother and their family

2.) The completion of the graphic novel, The Book of Drexciya Vol.1, by September 14, 2019

story:
Short Summary

Campbell Con 2015 is a one-day pop culture convention in beautiful Campbell, CA.

Why Campbell?

Campbell is a city in Santa Clara County, California, and part of Silicon Valley, in the San Francisco Bay Area. It is a community that never experienced a pop culture convention. We want to change it and bring a convention to the city of Campbell for the community to enjoy and be proud of.  

It will be a one-day event celebrating pop culture in all its forms - from comic books to movies to games to toys to cosplay. It is going to be a day of fun for all ages - and right in the backyards for those living in Campbell. 

What makes Campbell Con different? 

Campbell Con is an experience that is pop culture with a touch of intimacy.

This convention is something new to the arena of comic book/pop culture events in the fact that corporations have taken over the convention scene with such events as SDCC and New York Comic Con. The one thing these conventions miss in the throngs of celebrity and fans wanting to catch a glimpse of the latest thing in the industry is intimacy with the event. More and more we hear of fans disappointed in those corporate conventions stating that they get shuffled along to see their favorite convention guest like cattle. These conventions are more than happy to take your hard earned money, but leaves you unfulfilled.

Campbell Con is different because it offers intimacy with the guests who appear. There is no rushing you out of line or pushing a fan to the side. We cater for the fan, this convention is ran by fans for the fans.

This is why there is only a small limited exclusive number of tickets available so the fan can take their time being one on one with their favorite guests and artists at the convention. There is plenty of space and yet it will have all the fun of those so called conventions. It is time to bring back the conventions back to the fans, and Campbell Con is dedicated to that endeavor.

There is only a LIMITED number of fans who will be able to attend this incredible event that one must act now to cement their place, but once you're in you will have the time of your life conversing with guests, friends, and all those in attendance. Campbell Con is a convention where there is no strangers, just friends we haven't met yet.

Come and join us for fun and friendship in this amazing time for pop Culture.

What to do at Campbell Con?

  • Meet special guests. Our confirmed guests include Marvel & DC artist Chris Marrinan, writer and creator of the comic book "CruZader - Agent of the Vatican" Omar Morales, and actor starred in the films "Friday The 13th Part 5", "Busted", "National Lampoon’s Last Resort", writer, producer and radio host Dominick Brascia, and more to be announced. 
  • Shop. We will have a number of exhibitors and creators offering comic books, vintage toys, collectibles, original art and more.  
  • Cosplay. Portrait your favorite characters or take unique pictures with amazing cosplayers. 
  • Play games. We will have a Magic tournament.
  • Meet old and new friends and HAVE FUN! 

What We Need & What You Get

To make Campbell Con happen and make sure everyone - from guests to attendees - has the best experience possible we need your help. 

  • We need to raise $3,500 to make sure we have the right venue for the event and bring in some amazing guests for everyone to spend time with. 
  • Supporting Campbell Con you become a part of history because it will be the very first pop culture convention ever held in Campbell, CA. 
  • We have great perks for our backers - it is our way to say 'Thank you' to those who support Campbell Con 2015:
$20: Free admission to Campbell Con 2015
$50: Free admission to Campbell Con 2015 + Signed copy of comic book CruZader - Agent of the Vatican
$100: Free admission to Campbell Con 2015 + Exclusive Campbell Con 2015 T-Shirt
$250: Free admission to Campbell Con 2015 + One exclusive Chris Marrinan (comic book artist and Campbell Con 2015 Guest of Honor) 11x17 print featuring international best-selling author Davidson L. Haworth (w/autographs)
$500: Free admission to Campbell Con 2015 + Two exclusive Chris Marrinan (comic book artist and Campbell Con 2015 Guest of Honor) 11x17 prints featuring international best-selling author Davidson L. Haworth (w/autographs)
$1,000: Free admission to Campbell Con 2015 + Free admission to all related event parties + Free lifetime admission to all future events + Mention in the Campbell Con 2015 Program Book
The Impact
Campbell Con is a history in making. It is the very first pop culture convention ever held in Campbell, CA. It puts the city on the map and give the community something to look forward to and be proud of. 
Campbell Con brings kids and adults together to celebrate pop culture, creativity and talent. 
Campbell Con is an intimate event that allows everyone to spend quality time with friends, exhibitors, creators and guests without being rushed out. It is a fun and friendly event run by fans and for the fans. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Everything helps. If you can't helps Campbell Con financially please help us to get the word out. We appreciate it very much! 

    Thank you!

story:
Godsend

Godsend is an ongoing superhero/supernatural comic book series from About Time Comics. Each issue of Godsend will be 22 full color pages!

The Story

The time is now.

The Templars have a new leader for their terror cells, the Mercurian monks have fallen, the blade of power is missing. When the gates of Hell crack open and the damned swordsmen spill out into the real world leading their legions of Hellspawn, only one thing has a chance of holding them back.
The power of the Godsend.
Austin Jackson was just after a chance to make a new life for himself in the big city. Now he must risk his life, soul, and those of his loved ones in order to live up to the responsibilities thrust upon him.
The time is now and Austin is all that stands between us and Armageddon.

 

Thank You for checking out Godsend on indiegogo.com!

Godsend is a superhero/supernatural story that I created in 1994 and after many years, I have finally been able to put together a fantastic creative team to help make the Godsend comic book a reality.

Godsend follows the adventures of recent college graduate  Austin Jackson, whose life is turned upside down when he meets a strange man who leaves him with a powerful, ancient artifact known as the Blade of Power.

Now Austin must adjust to life in a new city and a new job all while trying to deal with the strange events that have been occurring since he came into possession of the sword.

Soon, Austin discovers that it is up to him to protect the Blade of Power from the Knights Templar and to protect humanity  from the unholy Swordsmen and their demon horde!

Be sure to check out the first six fully completed pages of Godsend #1 in the Gallery! 

Godsend contains no gratuitous sex, foul language, or over the top violence/blood and guts. Godsend would be rated PG-13 if it were a movie and will contain action akin to superhero movies like Iron Man, Batman, or Captain America.

Sharing Godsend's Story

Being a comic book creator is a lot of fun, you can create anything that you can think of and the possibilities for stories are unlimited. Someone once said that being a comic book creator is like being a movie director with an unlimited budget because the things you can do with a comic book would cost many millions to do in a movie. 

This is true, however, the second best part of creating a story is sharing it with others. It has been my dream, for a long time, to be able to share my stories with others. This is especially true with Godsend since it is the first character/story that I ever created. 

Comic books excite me. The stories, the artwork, and how a well done comic book can draw you in and captivate you as well as any well written novel can.

Getting Godsend funded would be a dream come true. The thought of being able to share the adventures of Austin Jackson/Godsend  with readers around the world excites me! I have an amazing creative team working on Godsend and knowing that these books will be professionally done really makes me proud. It is my goal to not only make sure that these books look professional, but to make sure the story will entertain you and make you look forward to the next issue!

I have a lot of stories to tell with Godsend and with your generosity and help, I, along with the Godsend team, will be able to get the series off the ground and get Godsend's journey started.

Thank You!

Godsend Creative Team

Godsend wouldn't be possible without these extremely talented people.

Writer- Peter Mcleod

Pencils- Oski Yanez

Inks- Eric Dotson

Colors- Nate Tingen

Letters- Bram Meehan

Cover art by Ken Hunt

Cover colors by John Ercek

Variant cover art by William Allan Reyes

Variant cover colors by Bryan Magnaye

Why $3000?

The $3000 will strictly be used to pay the creative team, for advertising, printing, indiegogo incentives, and any other production costs of Godsend #1. We have a fantastic creative team working on Godsend, most of who are working for little or no up front pay. It's very important to me that they are paid for their fantastic work so, that hopefully, they will stick around for future issues of Godsend. Advertising is imperative for the success of Godsend. We have to be able to spread the word so that everyone will kinow about the Godsend comic book.

Up until this point, I have been funding the production cost of Godsend out of my own pocket. We have been able to get a lot accomplished but, it's a slow go since I just don't have a lot of extra money. If I can get Godsend funded, it will definitely expedite the process and we can get the book finished and into the readers hands a lot faster. Like with most independent comic book creators, money is the biggest hurdle we have to overcome. You can have the best project in the world but if you can't afford to produce the book in a quality manner, the world will never know. That is why it is so important to me that Godsend get funding.

If we should surpass our goal, that money would go strictly to production costs of Godsend #2.

Shipping

Shipping costs are included in your pledge. We do, however, ask that international backers add $5.00 to their pledge to help with shipping costs

 We Need Your Help

We have accomplished a lot in the production of Godsend #1 but, we need your help to make the book a reality. Without Godsend #1, there will be no Godsend series. So, this is where it all starts.

With your financial assistance, we will be able to get Godsend finished quicker and, therefore, get it into the readers hands quicker.

We know money is tight for most people right now, so, if you can't make a pledge to our campaign but would still like to help out, here's what you can do.

You can visit our Godsend facebook page here http://www.facebook.com/godsendcomic

and our About Time Comics facebook page here http://www.facebook.com/abouttimecomics

and "Like" us. 

Also, you can mention our campaign on any forums or blogs that you think would be beneficial to the project.

And, of course, tell everyone you know about Godsend and our campaign!

If money is the biggest hurdle that we indie comic book creators face, marketing is a close second. It doesn't matter how great a project is, if no one knows about, it will never succeed.

So, these things are huge and would most definitely be appreciated more than you will ever know!

Thank You, Thank You Very Much!

I'd like to thank you for taking the time to visit Godsend on IndieGoGo. 

Whether you make a monetary pledge or just help spread the word, I really do appreciate it!

Godsend #1 wouldn't be possible without your help.

Lee Jiles

Variant cover colors by Bryan Magnaye
Why $3000?
The $3000 will strictly be used to pay the creative team, for advertising, printing, indiegogo incentives, and any other production costs of Godsend #1. We have a fantastic creative team working on Godsend, most of who are working for little or no up front pay. It's very important to me that they are paid for their fantastic work so, that hopefully, they will stick around for future issues of Godsend. Advertising is imperative for the success of Godsend. We have to be able to spread the word so that everyone will kinow about the Godsend comic book.
Up until this point, I have been funding the production cost of Godsend out of my own pocket. We have been able to get a lot accomplished but, it's a slow go since I just don't have a lot of extra money. If I can get Godsend funded, it will definitely expedite the process and we can get the book finished and into the readers hands a lot faster. Like with most independent comic book creators, money is the biggest hurdle we have to overcome. You can have the best project in the world but if you can't afford to produce the book in a quality manner, the world will never know. That is why it is so important to me that Godsend get funding.
If we should surpass our goal, that money would go strictly to production costs of Godsend #2.
Shipping
Shipping costs are included in your pledge. We do, however, ask that international backers add $5.00 to their pledge to help with shipping costs
 We Need Your Help
We have accomplished a lot in the production of Godsend #1 but, we need your help to make the book a reality. Without Godsend #1, there will be no Godsend series. So, this is where it all starts.
With your financial assistance, we will be able to get Godsend finished quicker and, therefore, get it into the readers hands quicker.
We know money is tight for most people right now, so, if you can't make a pledge to our campaign but would still like to help out, here's what you can do.
You can visit our Godsend facebook page here http://www.facebook.com/godsendcomic
and our About Time Comics facebook page here http://www.facebook.com/abouttimecomics
and "Like" us. 
Also, you can mention our campaign on any forums or blogs that you think would be beneficial to the project.
And, of course, tell everyone you know about Godsend and our campaign!
If money is the biggest hurdle that we indie comic book creators face, marketing is a close second. It doesn't matter how great a project is, if no one knows about, it will never succeed.
So, these things are huge and would most definitely be appreciated more than you will ever know!
Thank You, Thank You Very Much!
I'd like to thank you for taking the time to visit Godsend on IndieGoGo. 
Whether you make a monetary pledge or just help spread the word, I really do appreciate it!
Godsend #1 wouldn't be possible without your help.
Lee Jiles

story:
For too long Hollywood and the entertainment industry have been only catering to one side of the aisle. Now it's time to even the score.  

 

Introducing Agent Poso: TASK FORCE AEGIS

Set ten years in the future a global threat has arisen, and the President must turn to those he can trust. An off-the-books team that works directly for him, in the shadows. For the most sensitive missions, he calls upon Agent Poso and TASK FORCE AEGIS

 

Together with Agent Draino, Agent Tay, Agent Fairbanks and the help of the mysterious operative ALX, the Task Force takes on the NO FAIL missions that the President assigns Tier One.

 

Agent Poso: TASK FORCE AEGIS issue #1 is a 32 page graphic novel and a high-energy rollercoaster of action, espionage, geopolitics and tongue-in-cheek political satire. It's an adventure everyone in the family can enjoy.

 

Agent Poso: TASK FORCE AEGIS #1 has been made possible thanks to the exclusive pre-campaign sponsorship of the American Priority Conference. Attend AMPFEST2019 for a special AGENT POSO panel with Jack Posobiec and the Task Force.

 

 

The Agent Poso Story

The entertainment industry is in crisis. Hollywood and the streaming platforms are busy attacking American values, and the major comic book companies are no longer interested in telling great stories of high adventure — only of showcasing their own progressive politics.

Agent Poso sets out to reverse that trend by telling a real adventure story backed up with world class art and writing. We became sick of the Hollywood elites cramming their values into their products, and wanted to create a series about young conservatives that could be enjoyed from anyone from 2 to 92. After the success of Trump's Space Force, we approached Jack Posobiec about this spy thriller. In real life, Jack served as a US Navy intelligence officer, and now serves as a tireless conservative warrior in the fight against the Left. We are excited to work with Jack and others in the new conservative/MAGA movement to send a message to Hollywood that they don't own us or pop culture anymore. Help us build a successful franchise with Agent Poso and TASK FORCE AEGIS, the tip of the spear of a new wave of conservative counterculture.

  • Jack Posobiec has been part of the creative team since day one as co-creator along with comics industry vet and Creative Director Brett R. Smith.
  • AGENT POSO is written and illustrated by American comic book industry professionals, at the top of their field, and will be printed in America.
  • This project is our chance to prove the market for not only great adventure stories which entertain, but also stories with a conservative point of view.

 

Introducing TASK FORCE AEGIS

TASK FORCE AEGIS exists to diffuse situations that are too politically sensitive for the CIA. AEGIS is a specialized group of professionals who remain hidden from the public eye. Although its network of specialists and operators is growing, we will introduce you to the key operatives found in issue #1.

Jack Posobiec

Jack, or AGENT POSO as he is known by the team, leads Task Force AEGIS field operations. Jack is a master of disguises, stealth, espionage, and both armed and unarmed combat. He has the skill to blend in to any group to gather intel...except for one thing: cargo shorts.

Tanya Tay Posobiec

You don't seriously think Tanya would let Jack go into harm's way without her help, do you? Born in the USSR, and now a proud American, Tanya is an expert with languages, and a crack shot with a rifle. And she is more than capable of keeping the agents of Task Force AEGIS in line when they cause trouble... like using the fancy hand towels.

Cassandra Fairbanks

Cassandra is the Cyber-Ops specialist for Task Force AEGIS. She has been involved in cyber operations since the internet was created, and is always there to be the moral voice for the team or to let loose a little Puerto Rican attitude. Especially where animals are concerned. But don't expect any sympathy for clowns. 

DC Draino

Agent Draino is Task Force AEGIS' special equipment and weapons expert. The cigar-chomping, country-music loving, truck-driving heavy. Sometimes in life you need a hammer, not a scalpel. And a well-maintained beard. 

 

 

 

 

 

Introducing Team Poso

This project has brought together the emerging stars of conservative news & commentary and an A-Team of the best comic book industry talent in America. Beyond having tons of experience creating the biggest comics in the industry's history, The Agent Poso creative team has big-time conservative cred, including creating Trump Space Force, Thump, and Clinton Cash: A Graphic Novel, which reached #1 on the New York Times Best Sellers list and #1 on Amazon.

Jack Posobiec

Jack Posobiec is a host on One America News Network. Prior to that he served as a US Navy Intelligence Officer, and as Special Projects Director for Citizens for Trump during 2016. Jack has served numerous deployments to East Asia, as well as one year at Guantanamo Bay. Jack is the author of two books: Citizens for Trump: The Inside Story of the People's Movement to Take Back America, and 4D Warfare: A Doctrine for a New Generation of Politics Before entering conservative politics, Jack wrote the infamous Game of Thrones blog 'AngryGoTFan.' He is a Co-Creator of Agent Poso: Task Force Aegis.

Brett R. Smith

Brett serves as Co-Creator, Creative Director, Editor and Colorist on Agent Poso: Task Force Ageis. Brett has 25 years of experience in the comics industry working for Marvel and DC comics on titles such as The Avengers, Guardians of the Galaxy, Batman, Superman, Harley Quinn, Wonder Woman, The Hulk, Wolverine, X-Men and many others. He has also helmed and worked on other conservative projects including Clinton Cash A Graphic Novel, Trump's Space Force, and Thump: The First Bundred Days.

Chuck Dixon

Chuck Dixon is the most prolific comic book writer in the history of the industry contributing thousands of scripts to Marvel & DC comics and many other publishers. He is most notably known as the co-creator of the infamous Batman villain, Bane. He is also known for his seminal work on Batman, The Punisher, Birds of Prey and Nightwing as well as writing his own novels over the course of his 40 years in the industry. He was also the writer and co-adapter with Brett R. Smith on Clinton Cash A Graphic Novel and the writer on Trump's Space Force. 

Sergio Cariello

Since 1992 Sergio Cariello has been producing artwork for Marvel Comics on such titles as Captain America, Spider-Man, Daredevil, Thor, Iron Man, The Avengers, Hulk and Conan. He also has contributed artwork for DC Comics on titles such as Batman, Green Arrow, Superman, Wonder Woman, The Flash, Blue Beetle and many others. He is a graduate and instructor at the Joe Kubert School of Cartoon and Graphic Art. Cariello illustrated the worldwide bestseller, The Action Bible and contributed cover and interior artwork on Clinton Cash A Graphic Novel. 

Agent Poso logo & Task Force: AEGIS logo and cover trade dress by Bob Stone of IRIBIS Creative Solutions.

Special thanks to Carpe Donktum for producing our Agent Poso intro video. 

Although not part of the creative team, this group effort was made possible thanks to the exclusive pre-campaign sponsorship of the American Priority Conference. Attend AMPFEST2019 for the AGENT POSO panel.

Thank you for your support! Team Poso looks forward to creating the best comic book you've ever read! We expect to finish the book after the holidays and have it in the hands of all backers by early April or sooner.

We will keep you up to speed on the progress of the book over the course of the production, printing and shipping/fulfillment with Indiegogo email updates and social media updates.

story:
Hello everyone

In this installment of The Oswald  Chronicles "Fallen Gods" we meet Maliket a mad sorcerer who will do  anything to rule the world of both fae, and men. He will challenge ancient  gods, the fae of the Seelie, and Unseelie courts and anyone who will dare stand in his way, even a gentlemouse. Written by creator JD Calderon, Illustrated by  Jade Gonzalez, and colored by Liezl Bienaventura, cover art colored by  David Montoya.

In this installment of The Oswald  Chronicles "Fallen Gods" we meet Maliket a mad sorcerer who will do  anything to rule the world of both fae, and men. He will challenge ancient  gods, the fae of the Seelie, and Unseelie courts and anyone who will dare stand in his way, even a gentlemouse. Written by creator JD Calderon, Illustrated by  Jade Gonzalez, and colored by Liezl Bienaventura, cover art colored by  David Montoya.

story:
www.futureboundcomics.com    www.facebook.com/futureboundcomics

Emily: Emergence is a dark adventure told against a backdrop of quirky & sexy science fiction, mystery and horror. We're in the home stretch of finally being able to finish this story and we need YOUR help! We have completed 38 pages of this estimated 50 PAGE COMIC BOOK. Funds from this campaign are NEEDED to complete the final pages and publish this for the world to see.

THE STORY

Emily: Emergence is a dark adventure told against a hellaciously groovy 1968 backdrop-- a giant canvas for the thrashing brush strokes of relationships and emotions.

 

So, how is this story different?

We are turning science fiction on it's head and forcing it to take a good, hard look in the mirror. The typical "turn me into a superhero" ray now pivots on the driving emotion lurking within us all: Desire. 

 

Dr. Carnegie has built a "Future Field" ray that can turn the right subject into an amplified genius with the potential to save the world. But there is a grave side effect for the subject: strange and horrible things happen to those they care deeply for!

 

 

The well-meaning Dr. Carnegie must find the right subject for his experiment before his past catches up with him.  But what awaits him as Emily turns up at his door one night? Can he be certain of her desires and their effect on those in her life? Or will the experiment bring out the worst in them both?

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,000 to finish this story and send it to print and we have some incredible perks for our supporters!

  • $2 - Digital Copy of the Comic
  • $4 - Full Emily: Emergence Wallpaper Package
  • $7 - Paper Copy of the Comic
  • $15 - Your name printed in the "Thank You Section" of the Comic
  • $25 - Signed Paper Copy of the Comic
  • $100 - Signed Original Pencil Art Page from the comic
  • $250 - Have yourself drawn as a "BING" in the Comic

 

 

The Impact

Your contribution will help us to bring the final product to life!

We have completed ~38 pages and have ~12 more to go making this one behemoth of a story! We're cranking away, but we need your help to push it through and share this with the world!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute but still want to help? Tell all your friends! And tell your friends' friends! And tell your friends' friends to tell their friends!

Check us out on Facebook or visit our website for more updates and projects!

 

The Team

story:
"The King's Demon" is a light fantasy short story by myself, Jess Ange. It focuses on a female knight who has dedicated her life to the kingdom, but now finds her loyalty compromised by evidence that shows the kingdom is corrupted. The King's Demon Project is both a personal and school project that will result in two book versions that will be printed and then hand bound by me. This campaign will fund the creation of editions, or copies, of the books, and to also introduce "The King's Demon" to an audience.

What IS The King's Demon Project?

"The King's Demon" (now referred to as KD) is a short story I wrote a couple of years ago. It is very close to me, so I've attempted a couple of times to bring it out to the world in a visual format. Why did I fail those times? Well, because I sucked at drawing comics. Drawing comics is hard! If you ever meet a comic artist, give them a hug or a bro fist.

That said, KD has had plenty of time to stew in my brain. I swore to myself that I'll make it see the light of day again. That opportunity arose when I signed up for an independent study course at school. I essentially get to create my own assignments for credit. Being a design major and an amateur bookbinder, I wanted to marry the two, but what to do for content? Then I thought, "Hey dummy, you DO have content for a book sitting around!" And so I brushed the dust off of KD and pitched the assignment to my professor, which as you can see, was given the green light.

The Story

Despite all odds, Leona Wilds is the king's best knight. Not only does her status as knight bewilder many, she also came from a recently annexed province, making her dark features and height stand out amongst the fair people of Correxia. When Leona is sent on a mission to recover the kidnapped first prince, she walks into a trap and is forced to question her ideals...and the very kingdom she serves.

You can follow The King's Demon blog on Tumblr for more work in progress shots and process images!

Above: A sample spread without the story text on it.

One Story, Two Experiences

I will be making two books. One is the Text Version. It'll be just that, a small book with just the written story in it. It will be a small book sewn together with a paper cover; it will effectively been the highest quality paperback book you've probably ever seen! The point of this book is to focus on typography layout, as an exercise of laying out content in a publication. There aren't any pictures, but this is the story in it's original format, which is different from the other version. The second book is the Graphic Novel Version. I say graphic novel, but in reality, this won't be a normal, straight-up comic. I'll be experimenting with sequential art, with fewer panel grids and more of a, well, "artsy" feel. This version will be a bigger book, printed in full color, and case bound with hard covers.

In the event that someone grabs the New King Award, I'll be making a special third book that includes both versions of the story, concept work, and the original drafts of the story.

Above: The graphic novel will have a printed canvas cover and matching end papers and bookmark ribbon.

 

The Obstacles

There are two major obstacles in front of me, that I'm sure everyone is familiar with: time and money.

I'm a full-time student, I have a part-time job on the weekends, I am the promotions person for my school's art club, and I am half of an art studio I run with a friend. Needless to say, I'll be managing my time carefully and doing my best to not procrastinate or be lazy, regardless of how badly I want to watch Sailor Moon or read The Lord of the Rings. As the project goes on, I'll be updating with a to-do list/calendar to stay on task. Keeping my actions within view of the public will also keep me in line!

When my professor mentioned the idea of making editions — or copies — of KD, I said sure...but paying for printing is beastly! The Text Version will be printed on my studio printer, but the Graphic Novel Version will need to be printed at a store depending on how many of that version I'll be making. Even then, there's the cost of book board, paper, ink, and the intangible cost of time. My first solution to this problem is this campaign. How many editions of these books I make is dependent on how much money I can raise. It will truly be a test of my skills in marketing a product, by seeing if anyone would even want this or not!

Just the Start

KD has the potential of a continuation. My goal is to get these books in the hands of you, so that you can help me continue Leona's story. This initial print run will be a stepping stone along the project's path; first, a few books, then more to be sold at conventions, and then a continuation. So please, even if fantasy isn't your thing, share the project! Sir Leona appreciates your tweets and efforts.
