I'm a full-time student, I have a part-time job on the weekends, I am the promotions person for my school's art club, and I am half of an art studio I run with a friend. Needless to say, I'll be managing my time carefully and doing my best to not procrastinate or be lazy, regardless of how badly I want to watch Sailor Moon or read The Lord of the Rings. As the project goes on, I'll be updating with a to-do list/calendar to stay on task. Keeping my actions within view of the public will also keep me in line!
When my professor mentioned the idea of making editions — or copies — of KD, I said sure...but paying for printing is beastly! The Text Version will be printed on my studio printer, but the Graphic Novel Version will need to be printed at a store depending on how many of that version I'll be making. Even then, there's the cost of book board, paper, ink, and the intangible cost of time. My first solution to this problem is this campaign. How many editions of these books I make is dependent on how much money I can raise. It will truly be a test of my skills in marketing a product, by seeing if anyone would even want this or not!
Just the Start
KD has the potential of a continuation. My goal is to get these books in the hands of you, so that you can help me continue Leona's story. This initial print run will be a stepping stone along the project's path; first, a few books, then more to be sold at conventions, and then a continuation. So please, even if fantasy isn't your thing, share the project! Sir Leona appreciates your tweets and efforts.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Rees Finlay and 12 months ago i put together Damn Dirty Comics, and through the highs and lows of the comic making process we've had a hell of a year, putting out 5 comics, recieving 5 longlist BCA nominations and meeting and working with some of the most incredible and talented people you could ever meet.

And what better way to celebrate our first year in comics than putting out 'THE DAMNOLOGY' a limited edition hardback collection of all the comics from this year. packed with new and exclusive content. 

What We Need & What You Get

The Damnology Collects:

-Damnation

-Wrestling

-High Priestess #1 (NOW IN FULL COLOUR)

-Damnation: Ultimate Edition

-High Preiestess #2 (NOW IN FULL COLOUR)

-Dee's Nutz

AND MUCH MORE BEHIND THE SCENES PHOTOS, SKETCHES, AND SCRIPTS


Using the sites 'flexible funding' option means there is no 'real' target, even if one person orders the book...they will get their book.

There are many perks to be had, all of which include you getting your name in this book!

The Impact

Rather than use this platform to treat you guys as a cash cow, we are treating this as a pre-order service for an exclusive and extremely limited book.

after print costs, fees and postage there is little to no profit in this, it is purely to put out something we are extremely excited to share. 

Risks & Challenges

The risks are minimal, the books have allready been completed, we have had quotes from the printer and no problems should arise. So backing us is risk free.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the word! and find us on facebook at Damn Dirty Comics

Check out the multi-talented cats that were a part of this (Brentt Harshman, Mitchell Doig, Shunaid Sawyers, Emiliano Correa, Nick Philpott, Jonny Pearson, Karl Jones)

Thanks for reading, and your support is everything to us.

story:
7/7/13 UPDATE!  Behold, our cover.  Funders get this preview issue next week!:

“My best friend and I got the idea about two guys who don’t get along, they’re at each other’s throats, but if they don’t keep the business running, they’re going to end up dead quickly... Plus, there’s supernatural elements. We’re excited. It’s inspired by pulp fiction movies we’ve seen as kids."

Blood Money illustrates the lives of two men who, through a split inheritance, are forced to run a mafia together, or lose their profits to money-hungry rivals. The best way to think of it, is The Sopranos meets Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

There's violence. There's drugs. Car chases.  Club scenes. Smartaleck debates.  Late-night burger runs.  Vampires. Snake gods. Furious fights to the death and beyond.  Everything you want your average spandex story to do, but they can't.  This series has it all.

Oh, did we forget?  This first graphic novel takes place in Detroit.

That's right, we're sticking in all our favorite places of the Motor City, while writing a thrilling story that'll keep you on the edge of your seat.  And it's treated with loving care, from an illustrator who grew up in the Midtown and Goddard neighborhoods of the big D.

It's a wild ride, and but we need your help for the initial push-off.  We're raising 500 bucks for necessary supplies and production costs.  No matter what you can donate, we've got perks for them all.  

And if you'd like to actually preorder your copy, then this is the perfect way to do it.

 

 "Why Only $500?"

Because we don't need that much! We originally intended to just work on this during the next few months without asking for anything at all, and putting up the publication for sale on a website like Comixology, but the first month to push both of us off, is financially difficult all around. Our most valuable asset is time--we haven't had much due to demanding work and school. This summer is a window of opportunity to get this done.

Also, the colorist's wacom is about to go kaput. We decided it was best if we take preorders/donations to help make this happen.

Indiegogo also imposes a minimum of $500, which we didn't like, but since they deliver funds to us directly, it's alright if we don't reach the full $500. We do need to at least reach $350 though.

So while other people may ask for thousands of dollars.. we aren't going to, because it simply isn't necessary (no offense to anyone else's campaign). We only need just a smidge to help us get started.

 

Meet The Cast

Juste 

A native Frenchman, now the boss of the powerful criminal organization in Long Island. After a twenty five-year stint in prison, Juste must keep the business functioning properly and keep dissonance to a minimum, while fighting his own personal demons.

 

 

 

 

Jack 

A definite B-type personality, Jack is the son of a former CEO, who squandered his money and didn't think about the future--until he became a vampire.  Reckless and often focused on where to find a good cheeseburger, Jack is obligated to manage the family business with Juste, his father's former right-hand man.

...And if we gave anything else away, it would be too spoilery!  We can't even introduce the villians, because it would ruin the surprise.

Just tune in and find out what happens. You'll be glad you did.

 

Want To Help In Other Ways?  Here's How.

  • Buy stuff from our store. We have various products there, like tshirts and prints, that are totally affordable and still helps us out!
  • Tell A Friend.  Share this link on Facebook, so others can see what's going on and have the opportunity to support a project they might enjoy.  Tweet, share, sing a song about it at your local bar--go nuts!  Just help get the word out however you can.
  • Tell your local comic shop about this, so they can take preorders.  Some stores might be interested in our title and want to pick us up.  That's a big boost to our campaign!

Want to know more about us?  Visit Ashur Collective's website.

Want to know more about us?  Visit Ashur Collective's website.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Roya Mahboob. I am a 27 year old technology entrepreneur from 

Afghanistan. At 25 I was humbly awarded “Time 100s Most Influential People 

in the World” as a young, female entrepreneur from Afghanistan—3 descriptive 

words that are uncommon in my country: young, female, entrepreneur. Through 

my technology studies and work I had the incredible opportunity to start Women’s 

Annex Foundation  to empowers women through Digital Literacy—

literally teaching them the skills to sustain and empower themselves in the digital 

world we live in. 

Through Women’s Annex Foundation, I began a special project—the Superhero 

Factory, whereby female students design and create their own Superheroes, learn graphic design, and as well as business and marketing. Superheroes do not exist in our culture yet are so important to children, especially in developing, war-torn areas where hope for good is what a child dreams of. It is my passion to inspire children today and provide them with a digital voice and knowledge for their future. 

With your support you will be forever changing the life of many females in 

Afghanistan. Your generosity allows a student to participate in the Superhero 

Factory, inspiring creativity, graphic design, and computer and writing skills. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,000 to jumpstart the Superhero Factory Project in 5 of our 

schools. The funds raised will provide training for 200 female students, teachers, 

and materials. The female students will be inspired to create their own superheroes 

unleashing their creativity, hope, and knowledge through drawing, design and 

writing. We will share the girls’ incredible superheroes with our supporters. If we 

are unable to reach our goal we will limit the number of schools. 

The Impact

Contributors to our campaign will be giving Afghanistan and its young generation 

their own Superheroes to be inspired by. We are building the Superheroes of 

the next generation of Afghan students. We have been successfully empowering 

women in Digital Literacy and our pilot Superhero Factory project successfully 

trained, inspired, gave hope, knowledge, and skills to 100 female students.

Risks & Challenges

In a country where women are not supposed to talk or express opinions very much, 

it will be challenging to inspire, motivate and teach them to think independently. 

We also don’t want them to copy Western Superheroes.

Web Address :http://www.womensannexfoundation.org/

story:
Hi, I'm Luca an Italian illustrator, tattoo artist and concept artist. Some months ago I launched my first crowdfunding campaign to produce this sketchbook, and it was successful. I printed the books and they went sold out early. Some people asked me for a copy and then I decided to re-propose the book again, this time for Indiegogo users.

This book is a collection of many drawings made by me in the last few years: sketches, studies, preliminary pencils and final b/w and color pieces, most of them representing amazing creatures both from my imagination and from the classical canons of fantasy.

Many b/w drawings (preliminary works for full color illustrations) from my publications with Paizo (Pathfinder) are also included in this book.

There are also some superheroes fan-art and commissions, preliminary studies I've made for my old comic projects, and step by step character and creature designs.

What you can get is the PDF of the book, the paperback book that you can see in the pictures (120 pages, color print and signed by the author) with or without an original pencil drawing inside.

 

Risks & Challenges

I've already printed this book, so I have the definitive ready-to-print files and a trustworthy typography, so it is very unlikely to be late.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

-Any share of the project is  very welcome, on any social media or just spreading the voice.

-Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Other places you can find my work:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/LucaSotgiuArt/

 

Thank you,

Luca

story:
Kicking Butt In High Heels

My name's Emily, and I'm 16. I'm among the hundreds of thousands of people who are upset by the lack of female superheroes in comics and graphic novels. There's Superman, Batman, Spiderman - where are the women? Where are our cool role models who kick butt? 

Kicking Butt In High Heels is a series of graphic novels that will have multiple superheroes of different races, so every girl can find someone to look up to.

Everyone who works on Kicking Butt In High Heels will be female, from the artists to the writers to me to the people who print it.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $50,000. Most of that will be going to paying artists and writers, and the rest will be going to publishing costs. If we don't reach our goal, we'll do our best to meet it with what we have.

As to what you get - we have some pretty cool perks, including t-shirts, signed panels from the graphic novel, signed copies of the graphic novel, and copies of the graphic novel itself.

The Impact

This project is going to be valuable to a lot of females everywhere. Think of how amazing it would've been to, as a child, read a book about a female superhero who kicks butt! I think it'll have an amazing impact on females all over.

There's no reason all the superheroes need to be male - us females are just as powerful. It's time to prove it to the world by making this a reality.

Risks & Challenges

Obviously, there are risks and challenges involved. I have two published books, though, based on my viral Tumblr projects (Dear My Blank and The Last Message Received) which both have art accompaniment, so I feel I'm pretty qualified to handle them. We'll be as transparent as possible about everything.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate (or even if you can and you really think we're a cool campaign) tell your friends about the campaign!

story:
INTRODUCTION

My name is Jeff Duvall. Ever since I was in elementary school, I've always dreamed of creating comics. I always found the idea of creating my own world and having people fall in love with it as a fascinating thing. Over the years, I've sold comics at different conventions such as Otakon, Awesome Con, and Baltimore Comic Con. I took a hiatus to grow my skill so I could provide better quality work. Now, I'm more confident in my ability and want to bring a better story to you all.

This Is Where You Come In!

In order for this comic to be a success, I'll need your help. The funds raised here will go towards printing costs, promotional materials, rewards, and shipping the finished products.

Any amount offered is greatly appreciated! Even if it's only a dollar you can contribute, there are still rewards for you. You will get Endlocke artwork as a perk no matter the level and the prizes get better as you go along including physical copies of Endlocke volume 1, fully colored Endlocke comic book issue #0, autographed copies of the work, and more!



No matter if I do not reach my goal, I will release Endlocke vol. 1 in the future. I really want to share this story with all of you and with your help, I can bring this story to you sooner. 

WHY EVEN CARE!?

As an African American comic artists, I'm proud to live in a time where great efforts are being put forth to showcase more diversity. Back in the day, characters like Brodi (Native American/part of the LGBT community), Maxwell (hispanic), and other characters in my comic wouldn't have been displayed in the forefront of the story. I want to make a definitive work that contributes to this healthy trend. I want all ethnicities and cultures to be able to relate to these characters. I want people to see themselves in these characters as they go through this unique adventure. 

Risks & Challenges

I understand this is my first fundraiser and you may be hesistant to trust in me to deliver my products and carry out my publication. Let me just assure you that Endlocke vol. 1 is actually already completed. There is a website for my comic www.endlocke.com and the first 7 chapters are covered in this volume.

Now you may be asking, why would a person fund the comic in physical form when they can just read it online for free? Great question! There are two important reasons. 1. I will be changing the website to a members only site with a small fee (only a $1 a month) in the near future and 2. I have went back over many of the pages to improve the artwork. Not only is there better quality art, there are added panels, and even some dialogue changes to help the story flow better. There is also exclusive art,bonus comic pages, and more in the printed version! The final book is over 200 pages!  

Other Ways You Can Help

I get it! Money is tight! I understand feeding yourself or putting gas in your car for work is far more important! However, you can still help a great deal! Show your support by sharing through your various social media platforms using the share icons above! I really appreciate all that!

Want More Endlocke?

The final product may be coming in the future, but you can still keep up to date on the series going to any of these sources!

Official Website: www.endlocke.com
Follow on Instagram: @endlocke
Follow on Twitter: @fraeofficial1
Follow on facebook: fraeofficial1

story:
Who Am I??

I am Tony Kittrell.  I am a Firefighter/Paramedic, a husband, a father and a grandfather.  I am also a comic book fan for 40 plus years and it was that love that made me want to create my own comics.

With over ten years of experience as a Creator, Editor, Writer and Publisher in the Indie Comics field, I have brought close to fifty comic titles to the industry.  But I have failed at getting a completed Indiegogo campaign...so far.   While I haven’t had a successful Indiegogo campaign yet, I have had eight successful Kickstarter campaigns that shared my creations with the world and more importantly were completed as promised.

Overview

COSMOS is a twelve issue maxi-series that serves as an introduction to my comic book universe and is without a doubt my biggest project ever!  

In the 32 page COSMOS #1, a routine U.S. Space Mission to the moon sees an alien invasion force from another galaxy come to Earth.  Also, the cosmic powers of this universe (known as The Universals) convene as a cosmic threat approaches.  A mysterious hero, Genesis, appears on a planet without any memory of who he is and is met by the cosmic being Enigma the Soultaker.  This begins a journey that will reveal the secret history of the universe but also serve as the catalyst which will either save or destroy all creation!

Not only is this maxi-series bringing together all of my cosmic heroes in one book, it also doubles as the biggest Indie Comics crossover in comics history.  Over 75 Indie Comics Creators & Publishers have come onboard this series to make it truly amazing!  You are in store for several BIG surprises!!

By supporting my campaign, you will be allowing me to introduce new readers to my comics universe, other indiecomics publishers and to hopefully create more great books that will entertain and thrill you.

What We Need & What You Get

I am trying to bring awareness of my comics to everyone who likes comics with good stories, great art and cool & fun characters.  I am only asking for a minimum funding goal since the book is completed and I am trying to introduce my comics to a new audience of as many people as possible.  All funds raised will be going towards printing the book, shipping to backers and to pay for the rewards.

We are offering an awesome new comic series plus some pretty cool rewards.  By becoming a backer, you can receive exclusive trading cards and prints, have you or your character added to the story and more. 

The Impact

By supporting this campaign, you will be introducing yourself to a wild and fantastic comic book universe that is celebrating a decade of great comics as well as supporting the Indie Comic movement itself.  It will personally benefit the team and I because we get to share our book by bringing this series which is a labor of love to the world of Indiegogo.

Also, if this campaign is successful, COSMOS #2 will launch here on Indiegogo in January 2020.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks to this project because the comic is completely done and ready to be sent out to you.  The only thing needed are the rewards and those can be swiftly gotten once the campaign ends.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people can't contribute but you can still help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out about COSMOS and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to bring attention to the campaign.
story_txt:
Who Am I??
I am Tony Kittrell.  I am a Firefighter/Paramedic, a husband, a father and a grandfather.  I am also a comic book fan for 40 plus years and it was that love that made me want to create my own comics.
With over ten years of experience as a Creator, Editor, Writer and Publisher in the Indie Comics field, I have brought close to fifty comic titles to the industry.  But I have failed at getting a completed Indiegogo campaign...so far.   While I haven’t had a successful Indiegogo campaign yet, I have had eight successful Kickstarter campaigns that shared my creations with the world and more importantly were completed as promised.
Overview

Use the Indiegogo share tools to bring attention to the campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Writer Carlos Holguin and artist Matthew Merys bonded over a mutual love of comics and music.  Seeking to combine the two they created the story for a comic book.  So was born "I Don't Wanna Walk Around With You" a story about music, love, and lying to yourself.  It's the story of a young man who desperately wants to be "punk" even to the point of losing who he is.  He meets a girl and begins to find himself, but what happens when he finds this true version of himself isn't the punk who fell in love?  Drawing on influences from the Ramones to Stan Lee to cult comic "Love and Rockets" we plan to tell a familiar story in a way you've never seen and release it on different digital platforms.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise money to create the comic itself.  We will use the money to get a printer/scanner  and paper used to create the 11x17 pages of art.  We will also attempt to hire an outside letterer if necessary.  We will be getting no money up front to create the comic.  This is a work of passion for us. 

You get a number of fabulous prizes depending on how much you donate.  Much like the comic they involve art, music, and the dreaminess of Carlos!

The Impact

We want to create a story that feels at once unique and familiar.  We also hope to remind people that anyone can create a piece of art.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand as broke artists how hard it can be to donate, but please share the things you see here.  Retweet, reblog, share, and even do whatever the myspace equivalent of those things would be.  Anything you can do will help.

story:
This is the Danger-Squad for IndieGoGo! What is Danger-Squad you ask? Well, Danger-Squad is a comedic science-fiction comic book story that takes place around 300 years in the future, in the furthest reaches of the galaxy. A team of disjointed and neurotic characters take a venturesome journey through the universe led by their fearless and erratic captain named Dirk Domingo.

Who's Dirk?

At the center of our story is Captain Dirk Domingo. He’s an eccentric, somewhat sleazy space captain who ventures the galaxy gleefully searching for adventure and the next payday to maintain his ship the "Nachalo Blitz". Deep down, he longs to discover the reason, and meaning to his overall travels. In the meantime, he lives in the moment and teams with a maladjusted group of Squaddies who all have their own intention. Dirk is a "Re-Humanoid" mixed with an Iguana and Coqui frog. He’s originally from the terraforming planet some still call Earth. He is one of billions who are the product of centuries of obsessive bio-engineering by humanity. 

Where Are The People?

Humanity as we know it is all but dissipated. There are rumors and various historical accounts on what ended up happening to humanity, but you must read the story to know the truth. Those rare humans that do exist, are found and captured.

What to Expect

On a lighter note, this is a comedy adventure that touches upon our sense of nostalgia when we think of Calvin and Hobbs, Flash Gordon, Star Wars, Star Trek, Cowboy Bebop or even Duck tales with a twist of retro-futurism. It’s a feel good story that sparks the imagination of the reader through its science-fiction story telling. There's a huge rogue gallery of diverse space villainy, an array of conscious planets, or bizarre deep space anomalies. The Danger-Squad will take us on a fantastic journey few have seen. 

What's in the Book?

The content and packaging of the book is as follows: This is the first Danger-Squad graphic novel, which would be the origin story. It would be 50 pages of colorful high quality paper. The hardcover measures at 8.5" x 12.5" and features the Danger-Squad origin story followed by vivid splash pages.  Looking to have guest artists also contribute to these splash pages with their own creative visual interpretations.

The Budget and Costs

The budget of this comic book includes the collaboration with a colorist, an inker, and letterer. I'm creating 300 copies of this story to share with readers far and wide. I'm looking to invest an amount on the marketing and promotion to put out there for the public consumption and awareness. (Comic-Con, post cards, and travel to various art related events).

These Stories Are A Life Dream 

I'm the creator, writer, and the artist of this story. All these years have prepared me for a special opportunity like this. It's all coming together full circle now. I want this project to represent my passion, respect, and appreciation for the comic book, and science-fiction medium. 

With your support, I can complete, publish, market and distribute my first major comic. I want to make this a quality work, which represents my passion, respect, and appreciation for the comic book, and science-fiction medium. I would be sincerely grateful for any amount you can contribute to this dream!

Thank You

story:
Our Story

Hi, I'm FifthDream. If you've found this page, you probably already know me. I'm an aspiring artist. I dabble in my spare time with painting, and comic book art. I've been drawing almost all of my life, and have been reading comics and manga for a little less time than that. I've always wanted to make comics, and have a lot of ideas, if not quite the skills to do it on my own.

 

Recently, a popular manga-creation program called Comipo! ( http://www.comipo.com/en/index.html ) was released in English. The software allows users to create 3-d characters and pose and place them into comic panel templates, helping to simplify the process of producing manga.

 

At this point in my life, I'm unfortunately struggling financially, and even the modest cost of this software is beyond my reach. But I've always loved the idea of the program, and am eager to be able to use it to practice with, and eventually begin creation of a manga that's been an idea kicking around in my head for years. The characters and story are amusing to me, and I think others would feel the same way. I do believe my own skills as an artist may be a bit limited to produce this manga on my own. but with Comipo!, I think i'd have a good headstart getting this idea out of my head, and onto virtual paper! 

 

So donate to my modest campaign, and help my ideas come to 2-d sequential-panelled life!

 

(NOTE: THE PROJECT GOAL IS STATED AS $500. THIS IS BECAUSE THERE IS A MINIMUM GOAL SET BY THIS SITE. I AM ONLY TRYING TO RAISE $60. I WILL STILL RECEIVE DONATIONS MADE THAT DO NOT MEET THIS IMPOSED MINIMUM GOAL.)
 


The Impact

I'd love to be able to bring my idea idea to life, so that others can enjoy it as much as I do. While I think I'm a decent artist, I'm not sure I I have the skills to produce an ongoing manga without some help.  With this software, I'd have a huge headstart. (And not only with this specfic idea, but with other, random smaller comic ideas that come to me from time to time.) I'd love to be able to start producing this comic and publish it on the web. It might not happen immediately, but having Comipo! to practice with would be a great beginning. Your donation will help produce my vision and publish it for others to see. Don't let what I think is a cool, funny story idea stay hidden from the world forever.


What We Need & What You Get

This is where you come in. I'd like to raise the funds to purchase theComipo! software (just $49.95 US), and cover the fees for my campaign (roughly 7-10% for the host site, and 3% Paypal fees, a total of $60 US). (I REALIZE THE GOAL IS STATED AS $500. THIS IS BECAUSE THERE IS A MINIMUM GOAL SET BY THIS SITE. I AM ONLY TRYING TO RAISE $60. I WILL STILL RECEIVE DONATIONS MADE THAT DO NOT MEET THIS IMPOSED MINIMUM GOAL.) Rewards for donation will include updates on progress with practicing the use of the software, links to future projects created with the software, and higher-end donators will receive custom manga and/or characters appearing in manga. Also, all donators will get some secret information on what the manga will be. Awesome, no? The cost is really low, so any donation will bring the goal much closer to becoming a reality.

 

If I'm unable to raise the full amount, what I do raise will be saved and used for purchasing the program when further funds are avalaible (maybe through another campaign!). Regardless, when the program is purchased, rewards will be provided, maybe just a little later.

Other Ways You Can Help

Promotion would definitely help. Are you part of a community where others may be interested in my project? Let them know! Spread the word! Any help with my campaign is appreciated more than you can know.

story:
Ripped From The Headlines!

Here's a list of Actual Events that inspired this crazy story:

  • Sword-wielding Dallas man beaten by mob after attempting to defend his favorite bar
  • Salt Lake City man threatens crowd with Bow & Arrow
  • McAllen man threatens protesters with Chainsaw
  • Brooklyn lawyers burn NYPD vehicle with Molotov Cocktails
  • Activist calls for riots and then cries to police when his neighborhood is attacked
  • An "autonomous zone" set up in Seattle...where the police aren't allowed
  • Media & Government encouraging people to gather in large groups...just days after shaming them for going to the beach

 

My main challenge was to create a story that accurately portrays the times we live in...without being outdone by some new form of lunacy!

Speed was crucial to capture current events. But it is also part of the aesthetic. Necessary to capture the raw emotions of "these trying times."

 

Already Complete!

This 26-page black-and-white comic book was created in secret while the events that inspired it unfolded!

  •  All art complete
  • Going to press in July 2020

 

Connected to PANdemIC!

  • DO AS YOU'RE TOLD takes place in the same timeline as PANdemIC (which is basically the real world with a few extra pieces of flair)
  • THESE TRYING TIMES Combo Pack includes both DO AS YOU'RE TOLD and PANdemIC
  • This is all leading to a Cross-Over Event titled THEOSOPHY

 

The Team

  • Story & Lettering by Richard C. Meyer (JAWBREAKERS, IRON SIGHTS, THE EXPENDABLES GO TO HELL, PANdemIC)
  • Art by Kelsey Shannon (NORAH'S SAGA,  JAWBREAKERS: LOST SOULS, THE EXPENDABLES GO TO HELL)

 

Story & Art!

Here are some Story Pages and Production Art from the book:

Merch!

A black-and-white CLOTH MASK for a black-and-white comic book

  •  Made in the USA
  • Available as a Perk OR as an Add-On

story:
Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho #2!

Here at Idaho Comics Group we are passionate about the history of comic books in Idaho and promoting comic book writers and artists from the Gem State!  Also, we are passionate about supporting the Boise Public Library.  All the proceeds of the the sales of these comic books will benefit the Boise Public Library.

Last year we successfully Published Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho #1 AND Idaho Comics #1 (seen pictured above) and everyone was very pleased with the results.  We were very gratified when Todd Clark, the nationally syndicated cartoonist of the Lola comic strip, told us that he thought the final product looked "really slick."

Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho #1 even garnered some national attention as our comic book anthology was featured twice in articles in Comic Book Resources.  Also, three pages from TATCOI #1 by Randall Kirby were featured in an article in The Huffington Post.  (Randall's pages are under entry #15).  We were mentioned on the official Edgar Rice Burroughs website.  Lastly, we got a very nice mention on Boing Boing!

Last year people from as far away as California, Texas, Oregon, Ohio, Virginia, England, and AUSTRALIA ordered and bought copies of our anthology.

This is an officially licensed Tarzan comic book from Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc. in Tarzana, California.  After the comic book has been printed, Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc. will keep eight copies of our comic book on file in their archives.

Edgar Rice Burroughs lived in Idaho on three separate occasions in his life and is a big part of our Idaho sequential arts heritage.  That is why we have decided to license his most famous character for our anthology. 

Some of the writers and artists involved in our anthology include:

  • Monte Moore (airbrushed covers for DC and Marvel Comics)
  • Todd Clark (nationally syndicated Lola comic strip)
  • Dennis P. Eichhorn (Real Stuff, Weirdo, The Spirit: The New Adventures)
  • Randall Kirby (BOP! Comics)
  • Scott Pentzer (Rose 'n' Gunn, Sade, Rock 'n' Roll Comics)
  • Andy Garcia (Oblivion City, Seth Throb: Underground Artist, Megazzar Dude)
  • Adrianne Presnell (6x6)
  • Steve Willhite (FUBAR, Mother Russia)
  • Jay O'Leary (Push)
  • Bob Beason (Captain Bengal)
  • Geoffrey C. Everts (Disney cartoons animator, Jethro's Rad Euro-Zine 2.0)
  • Jake Scholl (Blade of the Broken)
  • Bethany Schultz Hurst (award winning poet of Miss Lost Nation)
  • Gaz Asker (TATCOI #1, Idaho Comics #1)
  • Albert Frank Asker (TATCOI #1, Idaho Comics #1, 6x6)

What We Need & What You Get

Here is why we need money.  We need:

  • $250 for the Tarzan licensing fee
  • $500 for printing costs
  • $50 for shipping costs
The artists and writers donated all of the talent, time, energy, blood, sweat, and tears for the good of the Friends of the Boise Public Library.  We again thank them for their efforts.  I will donate the cost of shipping the incentives out if it is over $50. However, it is preferred that donors pick up the comic book in person at the 2015 Library Comic Con on Saturday August 29th where the anthology will make its debut.  If there is any extra money left over, that cash will go to the Friends of the Boise Public Library.

The Impact

You will be able to own a piece of Idaho sequential arts history and help out a great cause at the same time.

Risks & Challenges

We're waiting on a couple of creators pieces so making the deadline will be a little stressful for the editor (yours truly).  We have already obtained the Tarzan license so that won't be a problem.  Also, this is the first time that we have worked with this printer so hopefully they will be able to turn out a quality product for us.

Also, we don't have as many perks this year as last year so it we are going to emphasize volume of perks rather than a handful of big ticket items.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
That's about it.  Thanks in advance for your help.

Tarzan and the Comics of Idaho #1 even garnered some national attention as our comic book anthology was featured twice in articles in Comic Book Resources.  Also, three pages from TATCOI #1 by Randall Kirby were featured in an article in The Huffington Post.  (Randall's pages are under entry #15).  We were mentioned on the official Edgar Rice Burroughs website.  Lastly, we got a very nice mention on Boing Boing!
Last year people from as far away as California, Texas, Oregon, Ohio, Virginia, England, and AUSTRALIA ordered and bought copies of our anthology.
This is an officially licensed Tarzan comic book from Edgar Rice 
Burroughs, Inc. in Tarzana, California.  After the comic book has been 
printed, Edgar Rice Burroughs, Inc. will keep eight copies of our comic 
book on file in their archives.

Edgar Rice Burroughs lived in Idaho on three separate occasions in 
his life and is a big part of our Idaho sequential arts heritage.  That 
is why we have decided to license his most famous character for our 
anthology. 
Some of the writers and artists involved in our anthology include:


Monte Moore (airbrushed covers for DC and Marvel Comics)

Todd Clark (nationally syndicated Lola comic strip)
Dennis P. Eichhorn (Real Stuff, Weirdo, The Spirit: The New Adventures)
Randall Kirby (BOP! Comics)

Scott Pentzer (Rose 'n' Gunn, Sade, Rock 'n' Roll Comics)
Andy Garcia (Oblivion City, Seth Throb: Underground Artist, Megazzar Dude)

Adrianne Presnell (6x6)

Steve Willhite (FUBAR, Mother Russia)
Jay O'Leary (Push)
Bob Beason (Captain Bengal)

Geoffrey C. Everts (Disney cartoons animator, Jethro's Rad Euro-Zine 2.0)

Jake Scholl (Blade of the Broken)
Bethany Schultz Hurst (award winning poet of Miss Lost Nation)
Gaz Asker (TATCOI #1, Idaho Comics #1)
Albert Frank Asker (TATCOI #1, Idaho Comics #1, 6x6)


  What We Need & What You Get Here is why we need money.  We need:
$250 for the Tarzan licensing fee
$500 for printing costs
$50 for shipping costs

The artists and writers donated all of the talent, time, energy, 
blood, sweat, and tears for the good of the Friends of the Boise Public 
Library.  We again thank them for their efforts.  I will donate the cost
 of shipping the incentives out if it is over $50. However, it is 
preferred that donors pick up the comic book in person at the 2015 
Library Comic Con on Saturday August 29th where the anthology will make 
its debut.  If there is any extra money left over, that cash will go to 
the Friends of the Boise Public Library.   The Impact You will be able to own a piece of Idaho sequential arts history and help out a great cause at the same time.Risks & Challenges

 We're waiting on a couple of creators pieces so making the deadline will
 be a little stressful for the editor (yours truly).  We have already 
obtained the Tarzan license so that won't be a problem.  Also, this is 
the first time that we have worked with this printer so hopefully they 
will be able to turn out a quality product for us.Also, we don't have as many perks this year as last year so it we are going to emphasize volume of perks rather than a handful of big ticket items.   Other Ways You Can Help 
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 That's about it.  Thanks in advance for your help.

story: My brother, AKA NintendoCapriSun, is the most giving soul you'll ever meet.  He has given thousands of dollars to me and my husbands to help us get our businesses started.  Unfortnately, due to unforseen circumstances, my husband is no longer able to continue his career in his previous line of work.  And since my line of work is in the arts, (there's a reason they call us "starving artists" after all!) now we are struggling to stay on top of things, let alone ever be able to pay back all the money my brother has lent us.  Well, this is the least I can do to try to redeem myself.  I know that he's so much more for others than he has even for me.  He has convinced some that living is worthwhile,... he has proven to others that just being who you are is just fine, and he has given countless others a laugh to look forward to at the end of a long day.  This gift is as much from all of you as it will be from me!

story:
Save Our Souls is that stunning new magazine that you’ve been waiting for. Featuring seriously great writing, comics and illustrations by brilliant writers, journalists and artists. You have to check it out!

The first issue featured creators and writers from UK, Ireland, America, France, Turkey and Sierra Leone.

Amongst them was a Pixar story artist, a Pulitzer Prize winner and the UK's Children's Laureate! Yikes!

The second issue will be just as mighty with work from as varied as Ireland, Philippines, Spain, New Zealand, The Middle East, Japan and even Liverpool!!

The mag will be in 16cm x 24cm format, full colour, perfect bound with high quality printing. (Page count to be finalized as creators are added but so far 44 pages and counting!)

At this stage of production we are aiming for a release no later that mid June. Earlier if we can. We try to be a little flexible on release date because we would rather have the mag worth every one of your pennies than to have any work inside rushed or not 100%.

The Save Our Souls manifesto...
  •  To be a place that promotes and encourages high quality work while being informative and fun.
  • To help fight the 'work for free and exposure' culture that is infecting the creative fields.
  • To work hard to be a publication that is unique, groundbreaking and 'must own'.



To meet our goals we...

  • We hand-pick and invite our writers and creators fresh from the farm to make sure this will be like nothing produced in the UK before.
  • Includes articles and reports on wide ranging topics and experiences by some of the best writers currently being published in major newspapers, magazines and websites.
  • We crowdfund each issue...

The funds we raise to publish Save Our Souls goes to...

  • High quality printing that does justice to the very lovely artwork and design.
  • So that the first 15 pages of the magazine doesn't have to be full of watch and perfume adverts.
  • We can pay the contributors for their work! The more crowdfunding we raise the more we can pay the creators so please support us all and spread the word!


    • It's also a great help to spread the word for us. Please stick this link wherever you go - http://igg.me/at/sosmag
    • Keep an eye on this page because more creator names and teasers will be added all the time.

  • Save Our Souls is edited by David Ziggy Greene. Best known for his years of illustrated journalism, he has also created work for BBC, Time Out London and numerous publications and created multiple graphic novels. His work can be found at samu.co.uk

Here is a taste of Save Our souls #1 available here - saveoursoulsmag.com

story:
Hi, Indie Go-Goers!

Welcome to Anthasa! Anthasa is a webcomic drawn by Joe Lupo and written by Logan Pietz, based on a role-playing game we play with our friends. 

Our comic is set in a steampunk fantasy world, and revolves around five characters, all outcasts, who are given the choice to save a world in which none of them have ever felt they've truly belonged.

The comic will be updated twice a month, with a total of thirty full length issues after all is said and done, with ten issues for each season. With your help, we can not only promise more frequent updates to the comic, but we'll also be able to make it worlds better.

 

"Sounds cool, guys, but what's in it for me?"

Good question. 

If you check out our handy-dandy sidebar on your right, you can take a few moments to scroll through our incentive list. We're giving away things like original desktop backgrounds, posters, and even a printed and signed copy of the first issue. On top of that, we're giving out a few opportunities to have your likeness appear in the comic. And who doesn't want that?

For us to make this as good as we possibly can, we are going to need $4000. That money will go to a big ol' list of things:

  • The Microsoft Surface Pro tablet PC
  • Programs (Photoshop, Manga Studio, Sketchbook Pro)
  • Webhosting and Web design
  • The cost of printing off some comic books and posters for you fine folk.

If we achieve our goal, we'll be able to make updates more freqently on the website, giving us the ability to put up a full page of the comic every week instead of only twice a month.

 

"Right on, right on. Anything else I should know?"

Like we've said before, we'd love nothing more than to bring you guys this story. It's a world we've been adventuring in for a long time, and we've had a blast working together against some seemingly impossible odds, and became brilliant friends while doing so.

We want to show you how special this world is to us, and we would love to have you come join us.

 

"Well, let's get going then! Any other ways I can help?"

Absolutely, my friend.

Your donation is incredibly important to us, and we're extremely grateful for it. You have our eternal thanks.

If you feel like you'd like to help more, we would appreciate anything you guys can do to get the word out. Tell your friends, your co-workers, your family, anyone you think would like to join us on this adventure. Also, check out the Indiegogo share tools for some more ways to get the word out.

Again, thanks for everything, you guys. 

 

See you in Anthasa.

 

 

The big update is here, Indie Go-Goers!

 HERE IS A LINK TO THE VIDEO. CLICK NOW. heh.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ABFb8kKVh-g

 

As you can see, we've put up the full color versions of the desktop backgrounds that you can get by donating, And for a little bit extra, you'll get one as a poster. How cool is that? And they're colored by none other than our buddy Jon, who is now going to be the colorist for all of our covers. This is where you guys say, "HI, JON!"

Also, we've got the new video up! You can hear about the cast of characters straight from the mouths of the people who play them!

So, surely, the second you were finished reading that paragraph, you said to yourself, "Well, I need to go watch that video!" And surely, you did. And now you're back. And surely, shivering with anticipation.

When our story begins, Anthasa is in it's fourth age. And lots of things have changed. There's a race of sentient robots, sizing from about that of a human, to the size of Ground, and even to the size of a building. Benevolent or malicious, that remains to be seen.

 

Cities of light and magic are now the norm, so we see a steampunk version of a mythical world. Gizmorian is a center of invention, our version of a magical and steam-powered Tokyo. A flying citadel rises our of the ocean near Aman'Dala, a grand castle hearkening back to the world's fantastical past. Serendar, a city of two levels, one an undercity filled with crime and destitution, and the other a plate lifted high above the earth, where the citizens live in the pinnacle of pleasure and comfort, closing their eyes to the suffering of those below. Lake City, home to the descendants of humans and goliaths, is a society that has yet to embrace technology of any kind, and exists as a Spartan-esque city-state where the Sven is king, and battle is glorious. And then there is Dracon Isle; a nearly unexplored island in the middle of the sea populated by the secretive and highly intelligent dragons. 

Our heroes meet by chance in this vast world with a single task: Bring these societies together and save the world from a great terror. From what terror, you ask? Bands of pirates striking fear into the people, perhaps? Or maybe impending war? Is it possible that the terror comes from on high, where the gods of Anthasa decide how to twist the fate of the world into their favor?

Well, maybe it's a bit of all of them.

Only one way to find out, Anthasians.

Are you ready to help us save a world?

story:
Lùmina Preview


The book will be available in Italian, English and French.

Contribute Now 


Lùmina is a bright, colorful italian graphic novel project by Emanuele Tenderini and Linda Cavallini, authors of many titles previously published by names such as Sergio Bonelli, Delcourt, Ankama, Mondadori, Hachette, Les Humanoïdes associés, DeAgostini, Panini.

The book's genre is in between sci-fi and fantasy, mainly inspired by Miyazaki, who you'll certainly recognize in the vast landscapes and open spaces. Wonderful creatures and charismatic characters will be involved in one of the most amazing adventures ever told in a graphic novel.

The plot unveils around the story of two children, Kite and Miriam, brother and sister, who find themselves thrown in a parallel world called Lùmina.

This will be one of the first comic books in the world to be coloured with the hyperflat technique (link) and printed using hexachrome, a six-color printing process (link).

                                            


We decided to bring this project to life through the crowdfunding community, as we believe that the straight connection between the authors and the readers is the strongest factor during the publishing process.

Plus, we are sure that the only way the comics world can be brought to a higher level is through the support of its ultimate investors - the readers.


The story

The planet, Fej Farok, brother and sister Miriam e Kite

Lumina is the whole Universe’s oldest planet. All civilizations come from it and all existing parallel dimensions will converge to it. Lumina is the planet of light and creation, the kingdom of Fej Farok.

The Fej Farok is a parasite and a deity, which can cross the membrane that separates the parallel universes, adjusting their balance if needed. It’s a creature made up of two parts – Fej and Farok – and each of them is hosted by two bodies, two porters, elected among the descendants of the Abyssals, very intelligent and ancient creatures that form the spiritual and religious side of Lumina. When the Fej Farok picks two individuals, the chosen ones, it literally owns their bodies and gives them unimaginable power. They become Fej (Yin), and Farok (Yang).
The dawn of time and Fej Farok ruled the planet Lumina .
However, the ambition and the thirst for conquest of Fej were great : he wished to conquer all the planets in the Universe, in all possible realities , using their immense powers . To achieve his goal , he needed his half Farok , which, however , did not share the destructive plans and conquerors of the counterparty.
Fej so he decided to kill Farok . A few moments before being struck by the sword of Fej , Farok could be projected on a planet , of all possible worlds , in a time among all possible times . In just a few seconds to choose two innocent creatures and give them his share of the parasite and its powers . On that planet , the Earth, in the present, Fej would not be able to find the completion of his power to achieve his evil purposes.
Earth. Today.
Miriam and Kite are two lively kids, as many of their age, divinding their time between school and friends. They’re orphans. Miriam looks after her little brother, who’s not really the easy kind, though. Miriam is a very nice young girl and careful sister but at times she can be a little bit too much harsh with herself and the people around her. Kite is a real force of nature, lazy at school and on the everyday tasks and a real daredevil on the streets while practicing his favorite hobby, the Parkour: he’s a young, flamboyant energy mix.
For some time now, the two have been sharing a strange hallucination: they were both still, hand in hand, in a kind of a mesmerized state, staring at a strange geometric flame containing an immense, very brightly lit opening in its very center. Kite and Miriam have never given too much weight to these visions, till one day, at school, they got suddenly surrounded by very menacing mysterious Black Creatures. Frightened to the bones, they tried to run away, but they soon found themselves in the strange place they’d seen in their common visions.
They got pushed inside the flame and from that moment on their life would’ve never been the same.
When they wake up, Miriam and Kite are right in the midst of a bloody battle between the Black Creatures and a powerful warrior. Above their heads a giant sprawling body materializes and grows exponentially, destroying everything around him. Behind them, a strange man in a hood speaking an incomprehensible strange language, is repeating a magical chant that sounds like an ancient rite.
In no time, the two kids got parted. As is Miriam taken by a Black Creature, Kite stays on the scene, firmly clinging to the strong arm of the warrior. The gigantic creature has disappeared. Now Kite is alone, confused but very determined to find his sister. He will face a long and tough journey, alongside with and fighting against extraordinary creatures. His goal is to find Miriam and get out of that vast and dazzling planet Lumina, as the fearsome warrior Oleg and the abysmal Nohe call it.


REWARDS 

  1. If we reach the 4.000,00 euro target before Thursday, April 17th, an awesome Lùmina desktop wallpaper to all contributors! DONE! :)
  2. If we reach the 14.000,00 euro target before Saturday, April 26th, we will unveil the amazing cover of Lùmina (more than 1000 layers on Photoshop) and all the contributors will receive the desktop wallpaper. FAILED! No problem, together we will MAKE IT HAPPEN! :)


Help us reach the goal! 


Contribute Now



How you can contribute

For this campaign, we have prepared a selection of awesome proposals. We decided to accompany the book with original materials realized on purpose for this event.

The USB pen


The A3 poster

Contribute Now

Sketch Book

Contribute Now



Why we need these funds 

We need € 44.000,00 to cover the following expenses:

  • € 12000 Will cover the basic needs to let Emanuele and Linda work just on Lumina for 8 months.
  • €  3500 for Indiegogo + Paypal fees.
  • € 9840 for about 1000 80-page hexachrome prints of Lumina.
  • € 4000 for about 500 USB keys.
  • € 4000 for Shipping to Italy (about 500 copies).
  • € 4250 for Shipping to Europe (about 250 copies).
  • € 5500 for Worldwide shipping (about 250 copies).
  • € 310 for about 30 Giclée prints.
  • € 600 Funds for the Lumina party and emergencies.



After crowdfunding

This is the beginning of a long journey. We have many ideas and many possible ways in which Lùmina can evolve, and each of them is simply amazing, like comic books, animations, smartphone apps, video games and many, many others!

We want to share our projects with you and color your dreams with imagination. 

You, the readers, will be the real "heroes" of our adventures and we're glad to take you with us into the magical world of Lùmina.

You can find more information on Lùmina here: www.worldoflumina.com

Follow us in these social media: Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, Pininterest.

You can read about Lùmina in these website, blogs and newspapers:

 

                

                       

                                             



I want to help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. In order to reach the goal, we need to share this project as much as possible: share the following pages on Facebook or Twitter, or even simply by e-mailing a friend!

  • For Italian www.worldoflumina.com/it/
  • For English http://www.worldoflumina.com/en/
  • For French www.worldoflumina.com/fr/


Thank you!


                       



Frequently Asked Questions

  • When will the book be ready? 

This crowdfunding campaign is needed to fund not only the printing of the "Lùmina" book but also the sheer creation of all the book's panels. Emaneuele and Linda need about 8 months of intensive work, as the quality and the details of each page require a long and accurate process. We'll make sure your patience will be rewarded with a nice surprise in your pack.

  • In what language is Lùmina printed? 

For this campaign all the materials will be available in Italian, French or English.
Please contact us after your purchase to select your preferred language. 

  • Is it possible to have more information about the story?

Yes, for more details you are more than welcome to visit one of our landing pages! Please, choose your language: ita, eng, fr.

  • Where will be held the LIVE training course?

The LIVE training course with Emanuele and Linda (included in the perk UP-CLOSE) will be held in their house, in Florence, Italy. Three days and six hours for day. The dates will be decided in accordance with the authors.

  • What about the ONLINE training course?
The ONLINE course with Emanuele (included in the perk COLOUR PARTY) consists of five lessons of one hour and one customized exercise corrected by Emanuele.

When the Fej Farok picks two individuals, the chosen ones, it literally owns their bodies and gives them unimaginable power. They become Fej (Yin), and Farok (Yang).The dawn of time and Fej Farok ruled the planet Lumina .However, the ambition and the thirst for conquest of Fej were great : he wished to conquer all the planets in the Universe, in all possible realities , using their immense powers . To achieve his goal , he needed his half Farok , which, however , did not share the destructive plans and conquerors of the counterparty.Fej so he decided to kill Farok . A few moments before being struck by the sword of Fej , Farok could be projected on a planet , of all possible worlds , in a time among all possible times . In just a few seconds to choose two innocent creatures and give them his share of the parasite and its powers . On that planet , the Earth, in the present, Fej would not be able to find the completion of his power to achieve his evil purposes.Earth. Today.Miriam and Kite are two lively kids, as many of their age, divinding their time between school and friends. They’re orphans. Miriam looks after her little brother, who’s not really the easy kind, though. Miriam is a very nice young girl and careful sister but at times she can be a little bit too much harsh with herself and the people around her. Kite is a real force of nature, lazy at school and on the everyday tasks and a real daredevil on the streets while practicing his favorite hobby, the Parkour: he’s a young, flamboyant energy mix.For some time now, the two have been sharing a strange hallucination: they were both still, hand in hand, in a kind of a mesmerized state, staring at a strange geometric flame containing an immense, very brightly lit opening in its very center. Kite and Miriam have never given too much weight to these visions, till one day, at school, they got suddenly surrounded by very menacing mysterious Black Creatures. Frightened to the bones, they tried to run away, but they soon found themselves in the strange place they’d seen in their common visions.They got pushed inside the flame and from that moment on their life would’ve never been the same.When they wake up, Miriam and Kite are right in the midst of a bloody battle between the Black Creatures and a powerful warrior. Above their heads a giant sprawling body materializes and grows exponentially, destroying everything around him. Behind them, a strange man in a hood speaking an incomprehensible strange language, is repeating a magical chant that sounds like an ancient rite.In no time, the two kids got parted. As is Miriam taken by a Black Creature, Kite stays on the scene, firmly clinging to the strong arm of the warrior. The gigantic creature has disappeared. Now Kite is alone, confused but very determined to find his sister. He will face a long and tough journey, alongside with and fighting against extraordinary creatures. His goal is to find Miriam and get out of that vast and dazzling planet Lumina, as the fearsome warrior Oleg and the abysmal Nohe call it.REWARDS 
If we reach the 4.000,00 euro target before Thursday, April 17th, an awesome Lùmina desktop wallpaper to all contributors! DONE! :)
If we reach the 14.000,00 euro target before Saturday, April 26th, we will unveil the amazing cover of Lùmina (more than 1000 layers on Photoshop) and all the contributors will receive the desktop wallpaper. FAILED! No problem, together we will MAKE IT HAPPEN! :)
Help us reach the goal! Contribute NowHow you can contributeFor this campaign, we have prepared a selection of awesome proposals. We decided to accompany the book with original materials realized on purpose for this event.The USB penThe A3 posterContribute NowSketch BookContribute Now
Why we need these funds 
We need € 44.000,00 to cover the following expenses:
€ 12000 Will cover the basic needs to let Emanuele and Linda work just on Lumina for 8 months.
€  3500 for Indiegogo + Paypal fees.
€ 9840 for about 1000 80-page hexachrome prints of Lumina.
€ 4000 for about 500 USB keys.
€ 4000 for Shipping to Italy (about 500 copies).
€ 4250 for Shipping to Europe (about 250 copies).
€ 5500 for Worldwide shipping (about 250 copies).
€ 310 for about 30 Giclée prints.
€ 600 Funds for the Lumina party and emergencies.
After crowdfundingThis is the beginning of a long journey. We have many ideas and many possible ways in which Lùmina can evolve, and each of them is simply amazing, like comic books, animations, smartphone apps, video games and many, many others!We want to share our projects with you and color your dreams with imagination. You, the readers, will be the real "heroes" of our adventures and we're glad to take you with us into the magical world of Lùmina.You can find more information on Lùmina here: www.worldoflumina.comFollow us in these social media: Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, Pininterest.You can read about Lùmina in these website, blogs and newspapers:                                                                                     I want to helpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. In order to reach the goal, we need to share this project as much as possible: share the following pages on Facebook or Twitter, or even simply by e-mailing a friend!
For Italian www.worldoflumina.com/it/

For English http://www.worldoflumina.com/en/
For French www.worldoflumina.com/fr/

Thank you!                        
Frequently Asked QuestionsWhen will the book be ready? This crowdfunding campaign is needed to fund not only the printing of the "Lùmina" book but also the sheer creation of all the book's panels. Emaneuele and Linda need about 8 months of intensive work, as the quality and the details of each page require a long and accurate process. We'll make sure your patience will be rewarded with a nice surprise in your pack.In what language is Lùmina printed? For this campaign all the materials will be available in Italian, French or English.Please contact us after your purchase to select your preferred language. Is it possible to have more information about the story?Yes, for more details you are more than welcome to visit one of our landing pages! Please, choose your language: 
ita, 
eng, 
fr. Where will be held the LIVE training course?The LIVE training course with Emanuele and Linda (included in the perk UP-CLOSE) will be held in their house, in Florence, Italy. Three days and six hours for day. The dates will be decided in accordance with the authors.What about the ONLINE training course?The ONLINE course with Emanuele (included in the perk COLOUR PARTY) consists of five lessons of one hour and one customized exercise corrected by Emanuele.

story:
IMPORTANT NOTE ABOUT PERKS - AS PERKS ARE SOLD OUT NEW PERKS ARE ADDED! CLICK ON UPDATES TO SEE THE LATEST PERKS ANNOUNCEMENTS!

This Just In: We have a testimonial -illustrated in cartoon form no less, from former festival speaker Sandra Bell Lundy at this link. (Or click on "updates")

Another Testimonial from former speaker Hilary Price: KFOC Story

And yet another testimonial from former speaker Stephan Patis: KFOC Story

The Kenosha Festival of Cartooning is a 3 day festival, in Kenosha Wisconsin, from September 25th through September 27th of 2014. There will be live presentations, workshops, a gallery show, panel discussions, and community outreach by some of the nation's top cartoonists. We are asking for a total of $10,000 - this amount will allow us to mount two spectacular gallery shows of original comic art, cover the expenses of the artists, pay for publicity materials and shipping of art for gallery shows, cover backer reward fulfillment, and provide catering for receptions whilst not having to charge admission.

Our AWESOME guest speakers for 2014 are: Jeff Keane of Family Circus, Denis Kitchen of Kitchen Sink Press, Lincoln Peirce of Big Nate, Rick Stromoski of Soup to Nutz, Todd Clark of Lola, Scott Stantis of Prickly City (also staff editorial cartoonist at The Chicago Tribune), Terri Libenson of The Pajama Diaries, Michael Schumacher author of Al Capp: A Life To The Contrary and Will Eisner: A Dreamer's Life In Comics, and Paul Buhle comic historian and author of Comics In Wisconsin. And our panel moderator will be the amazing Tom Racine of Tall Tale Radio.

Don't worry if you cannot attend the festival in person - we still have some VERY cool premiums for our backers in the way of original art and autographed posters and programs from the guest artists. New this year is a specially designed, limited edition, challenge coin - see image below. There will only be 100 of these available and when they're gone they're gone. So don't dawdle if you want one :-) All rewards will be signed and therefore delivered after the conclusion of the festival.

We believe cartooning is a wicked cool artform and have dedicated this festival to providing opportunities for the comic reading public of all ages to meet the artists behind the laughter. But the festival can only remain free if we reach our fundraising goal!

With the festival in its fourth year, we are seeking Indiegogo funding because, while we have some stalwart donors and supporters, those donations don't come close to funding our whole budget.

One of the wonderful things about crowd funding is how affordable it can be. If we can get 500 people to donate $20 - we are there! So never think that small contributions don't matter! And we have some exciting stretch goals if we are lucky enough to exceed our $10,000 mark.

NOTE ABOUT REWARDS: Indiegogo will only allow 20 reward levels at a time - we have a few more than that available and will post them when a particular reward level is "sold out". Also, you can donate more than once if you are interested in multiple rewards - you can mix and match and can also increase your donation at any time during the campaign.

And don't forget to follow us on Facebook and Twitter!!
