story:
We made it!!! How much further can we go?

To be honest I was not at all confident this would work at first. Well, pressure is on, because I made my first funding goal!

Woooo! :D 

If you would like to help you still can!

your backing will make things a lot easier while i complete the book and the days left until Oct 15th are the last chance to get the limited Early Edition of Dream Life | a late coming of age, book one.

Take a look at the updated perk options and please consider jumping in! I took out those few people were not really going for, but the most popular remain. The $5 digital option, easy on the pocket book and cheaper than the standard Digital will be [99 cents less]. The Materialists options, and The Lucid Dreamer & The Pure Conscious Event will get you the very limited Early Edition of the book with extra content, and there's still Parts and Art to be had too. So have at it! 

For those checking out this campain for the first time, there are a 107 backers for the project so far and counting! I feel like dancing. But when you edit a perk here you loose the head count so thats why the low numbers on the perk descriptions.

Backers, don't worry, if yours was one of the perks i took down, all perks will be honoured, my word! If not a few suprises too [working on a few things, probably won't be confirmed till it's time to ship the books so i won't be saying, you'll just have to find out! ;)].

-----

Ok, Meating the goal also means I can expand on my plans publishing wise with confidence. Retailers, Comic shop and Book shop folks, look below to the bottom of this page, or here on my home site, for the new Retailers Only options to participate in the coordinated May 5th formal luanch of Dream Life | a late coming of age. 

No small business

Thanks to the following backers who helped me reach and pass the main goal.

Arna Selznick [thanks mom!], Laurel Douglas Shugarman & Libby Grant, Julie Shugarman, Sarah Power, Michelle Breslin, Jonathan Sugerman, Paul & Elaine Evers, Joanna Murphy, and not least of all, Angela Murphy! All family and pitched in big time, I owe you all a hug and stuff! :)

Freinds and strangers did most of the work though, merci thanks and you're awsome for beliving in me!

Along with 8 of you who did not want to be named, thanks to Fred Laurendeau, Troy Carlson, Michael Wandelmaier & Jessica Fortner [Squidface & The Meddler], Millicent Broderick, Madeline Richards, Alex Megelas, Mark Sable, Keith Perkins, Paul R Skow, Jack Briglio, Monique Montibon Kundahl, A. David Lewis, Scott Gilbert, Omaha Perez, Adam Benjamin, Peter Schmidt, Joe Ollmann, Thomas Murtagh, Andrew Walsh, Ryan Closs, Dewey Guyen, Jen Schultes, Dario Sciola, Alex Megelas, Clive Thompson, Keiren Smith, Mike Campbell, Fiona Smyth, Jason Copland, Zane Grant, Lucas Fehr, Julian Orr, Conor McCreery, Eric Lapointe, Anthony Walsh, Matt Shepherd, Victoria Koldewyn, Nathan Seabolt, William Owen, Jason Quest, JK Parkin, Alice Quinn, Keith Grachow, Jeff Ellis, Andréa Cohen, Jason Franks, Shane Guy, Jimmie Robinson, Chris Noble, Kelly Pennington, James Turner, Benjamin Towle, Alan Bunce, Amber Gertzbein & Brian McLachlan, Soyoung Jung, David Himel, Fabian Fabian, Rémi Paradis, Liam Johnson, Edgardo Ceballos, Nell Casson, Kate McDonnell, Eric Palicki, Elizabeth Watasin, Daniel Ha, Mike Aragona, Maria Turner, Annie Koyama, Denis Rodier, David Lester, Loren Gillespie III, John A Douglas, Len Epp, Anthony Peruzzo, Mikaela Dyke, Pat Shewchuk, Stan Yan, & Niall Eccles! Sorry for the compact list, a line by line version is on the Updates page!

I really have to get to work now, thanks to all of you more than i can say. :D

--Project Description--

I'm just 30 pages shy of completing Dream Life | a late coming of age.

Hi, my name is Max Douglas, I'm a cartoonist, working under the pen name Salgood Sam, and with your help I’d like to get the first half of the longest story I've ever tried to tell completed in time for TCAF 2013.

I'm very close already, over 115 pages are done, just a mere thirty left to complete the first three chapters. I hope with this campaign I can dedicate the rest of this year to making those thirty pages my primary focus.

This story is a labour of love. A work of fiction with fantastic and adventure elements. It borrows from my own life--as close to autobiography as I've dared in many ways. The cast is an amalgam of people I've known and myself, played off archetypes. The situations and conflicts borrow from my own experiences and stories I've been close to.

Charlie's childhood friend is about to die.
Hitch hiking in BC PJ's luck runs out.
Lionel is in existential free-fall.
Leslie is a therapist and part time drug dealer.
It's just occurring to her she hates her job.
Dan's daughter thinks he needs to grow up.
-
The story of five friends.
Dreams, drugs, & denial
all failing to weather
the arc of life unscathed.
Each coming to terms with lives peter panned,
and in danger of going off the rails.

I've worked both commercially and independently for others most of the 20+ years that I've been a cartoonist. I've been lucky to often make my living doing that but there are always trade-offs and limits to the work.

With Dream Life I'm trying to do all the things i've always wanted to, tell a story that I'd want to read--without compromise or conditions.

I've been very lucky to receive grant funding for Dream Life in the past. That had been a huge help getting this far. But life throws us unforeseen curves: In early 2011, I was diagnosed with testicular cancer, and had an operation to remove it. I got lucky, hopefully will stay lucky. But I did lose a lot of time to that, dealing with the stress, distractions, and recovering from the operation.

And just as I was getting back to feeling normal, I got slammed by a bacterial infection in my stomach in the fall, lost fifteen pounds in two weeks, and a couple months due to being laid out and exhausted by that. So while the grant made getting as far as I have possible, and recovering a lot less stressful, I did not get as far as I had wanted to. So close though. So so close.

So it goes. I'm grateful and I'll keep at it one way or another, but the grant funds are gone now. Working as a freelancer takes up most of my time. Between finding the next job and doing the jobs, I’m left with little space to squeak out pages.

So I thought I’d try crowdfunding to make room to wrap up this first half of the book and put a small run of 100 B&W first editions in time for TCAF 2013. To do that I need to finance 3 months of focused work on this and this alone. 

I also plan to upload the book to Create Space [Amazon] so it will be available to all right away, either in print or digitally via their app market.

On my own I’ll get there one day but probably not in time for TCAF, and I have other obligations in 2013 that will probably cause even more delays. So now’s the time to make this happen.

What I Need & What You Get
[update: i've added printed edtions care of Create Space for some!]

The minimum to ensure this all happens is I think, $3500.

I've set the goal here at $3800 because of the site fees. If we reach $3800, what I'll get is just a bit over $3500. If we fall short the fees are a bit higher [4% if we match the goal, 9% if we fall short].

If we can surpass the goal, the surplus initially will go into better printing and/or a larger run for the first edition, and a bit more time/peace of mind.

If it looks like we're really going to knock it out of the park I'll think of some new worthy expanded goals, and perks. More art and reserved copies of the first edition are the first likely candidates.

For now I want to keep the bar low, so $3000 to cover living expenses while I do the work, and $500 to go mostly towards perks, maybe a bit left over for printing the first editions.

The smallest support option is $5, with the perk of getting a digital edition [PDF or CBR, specify your preference when you dontate] of Dream Life | a late coming of age, book one. Like all supporters will get your name listed on the thank you page in the book and on my site unless you request otherwise. This option is essentially a pre-order of the digital edtion which will be sold for about that give or take a cent. I'm considering also making a set of 5 ¢99 versions available too but either way, $5. But by supporting now you will be the first to get Dream life, even before the early print editons are mailed out you'll be able to download your digital copy!

Updated: Folks who took 15 dollar personal digital edition will still get it but i removed it in the list to make room for new options. Personalized editions can still be had via the "get's personal" perks offered: For the supporters backing with $15 or more, their digital editions will be personalized, with a scanned handwritten signature, note, and sketch inside the “front page”. This will be unique to the funding drive.

The physical copy of signature pages will be mailed to you via regular letter post [no express or registered mail]. I'll be sending you an adhesive bookplate too if you're getting a copy of the book now.

Starting at $25 us, $35 for canadian and international backers [postage fees inc], by having supported the project you will receive the Limited Early Edition of the book, with 10 pages of extended content. A preview of book two, art, and other goodies.

You will again be among the first to see it, receiving your copies in March. Before the formal launch in May 2013! Your early editions will be identifiably marked as a result of having contributed Distinguished inside and out from the Launch editions. I'm thinking i'll draw a special back cover and spine for them both. The run will be limited to supporters who back the book before the funding drive ends October 15th 2012.

For $35 us, $ 45 for canadian and international backers [postage fees inc], you get A personalized digital copy, a copy of the singed page with sketch, and the Limited Early Edition of Dream life | a late coming of age. The signature page will be done on paper the right size to fit in your physical copy. I'm including an Adhesive bookplate designed for the Limited Early Edition too now. I'll be happy to do so again in person someday too if I happen to meet you. And shake your hand too! I might get emotional. :D

All Sociaty6 prints and the digital library of my independat work  have been removed as options. Not to worry, those who got them will be honoured of course! And if you miss the prints, you can always go for small donation here and get something from the shop!

For $100, along with all of that. you will get a bit part as an extra for one or more panels in Dream Life. 6 of these have been taken, expect to see cartoonists in this. :)

I'll send you a print of your cameo page along with the signature page in the mail.

Finally, $200 will get you either a piece of original art from Dream Life, or a private commision. Anything you like within reason [I won’t draw something I find offensive or otherwise objectionable]. This perk also comes with the printed book, and the digital catalog including personalized Dream Life-book one.

I've been tweaking the perks. Have a look and see what fits you!

What will be the Impact?

Well put simply, you will make my day, life, etc. It's really frustrating to be so close to being done this chunk of the book, and have to work on it in dribs and drabs.

I want Dream Life to be my BEST work. So, having the freedom to dedicate my energy to it alone for any amount of time will be awesome.

I can't promise you this book will change the world or solve poverty, but it will change my life; getting as far as I have already has, as it's already been noticed and got me nominated for an award last year as a web comic. Completing it and being able to present it in time for TCAF next year will mean the accomplishment of a major life and career goal. And for what it’s worth, I do think work that aspires to the standards and richness I hope to bring to Dream Life, enriches our world over all. Stories that have heart and integrity and try to make us think while being entertaining and beautiful.

With your help that's what I hope to bring forth.

Other Ways You Can Help

I've made it easy to pitch in even a little, but if you're really unable to support Dream Life financially, you can always help by telling as many other people as you can about this funding drive, and Dream Life generally. Use the Indiegogo social sharing tools, ‘like’ the fan page on Facebook, and share this link to the first 100+ pages online, on Facebook, Google+, or the webcomic page here, free to read.

Many thanks.

------------------------------------

I would not have gotten this far without help.
Thanks to Jonathan Sugarman, who helped inspire this story, started the adventure with me and left lots of fun words to play with.

Thanks to Sadoceanspacebear, for the beautiful sounds.

To a.j.duric for showing me how to craft a grant application.

& A.J.Murphy for checking my grammar.

And many more too numerous to name.

And far from least, the generous funding of
the Canadian Council for the Arts

We acknowledge the support of the Canada Council for the Arts, which last year invested $154 million to bring the arts to Canadians throughout the country.

Nous remercions le Conseil des arts du Canada de son soutien. L’an dernier, le Conseil a investi 154 millions de dollars pour mettre de l’art dans la vie des Canadiennes et des Canadiens de tout le pays.

 

 

 !!---------- Retailers Only------------!!

9 days for Second tier goals.

Expanding on plans, publishing wise.

I’ve just met my main goal for a crowd funding campaign to finance completing  Dream Life: a late coming of age!

So with a little over a week left in this funding drive, I’m going to go forward with a modified version of my second-tier goal and put up a set of retailer options!

There are variables that have to be entered manually, make sure you read carfully before entering, and please do contact me too. It would be nice for the exchange to be more personal and we can confirm the package you opted for.

You also have the option of doing this less publicly, via emal and other payment options, we don’t have to use Indiegogo for this.

To have a look at the contents of the book, I’ve created a trailer on youtube, and feel free to read through the 100+ pages here, or here, or here, or via this PDF file.  The web versions has some colour pages, something I was playing with but don’t have time to complete that way in the foreseeable future. 

For now the book is to be black and white like the PDF. The Launch edition will be 150 pages, colour cover, 6”x9”, B&W interiors. Suggested retail price of $16us. But there are prints of the colour art available.

THE DEAL

Following The Early Editions in March for individual backers, exclusively for Brick & Mortar comics retailers I’m adding the opportunity to make pre-orders of The Launch Edition, to be released corresponding with the official launch date of the May 5th-6th weekend of TCAF (Toronto Comic Arts Festival) 2013.

See the glossary at the bottom of this section for full descriptions of the different editions, there are 3, 5 if you include the digital ones!

Retailers in Canada and the US can get 5, 10 or 20 books for their shops, to be made available in the weeks before TCAF. Meant to be released the week & weekend of the official launch at the show.

For Retailers in Toronto, I plan be in town at TCAF 2013 attending. Presenting, confirmation of my attendance pending. So I can arrange to visit your shop that week in person!

And, if retailers elsewhere are interested in participating, I’ll be able to arrange pre-orders for anywhere Amazon delivers. I have less control over the timing abroad though, so I can’t promise these the May 5th-6th weekend.

They could be as much as 22 days later at the end of the month. With that in mind, I’ve posted rates for the UK, EU, AU, & NZ. Let me know if you would like your country estimated.

I’ve set the new retail options up by region, building the shipping fees into the price listed so it’s all straightforward–please take a moment to make sure you enter the right details when contributing.

To keep things simple on this site all numbers are in US currency. I'm warned by Amazon that you may have to deal with duties or taxes on your end. 

Reatilers participating in this presale will have their name and buisness listed on a thank you page. We will also post listings on salgoodsam.com and the official Dream Life site of all the shops that participate. That will include detailed info about where you are located, hours, and contact info.

THE LAUNCH EDITION

For each of these options, you will get…
X number of the official Launch Edition
of Dream Life | a late coming of age. Book one.
published under my own imprint, Spilt Ink.

  • 5 copies: $40 [USA],
    & $50 [Canada] :
    Suggested retail value $80us
  • 10 copies: $80 [USA],
    & $90 [Canada] :
    Suggested retail value $160us
  • 20 copies: $155 [USA]
    & $175 [Canada] :
    Suggested retail value $320us

Shipping times are later for
the UK, EU, AU, and NZ,
as much as 22 days more.

  • 5 copies: $45 [EU/UK]
    & $65 [AU/NZ] :
    Suggested retail value $80us
  • 10 copies: $85 [EU/UK]
    & $100 [AU/NZ] :
    Suggested retail value $160us
  • 20 copies: $165 [EU/UK]
    & $190 [AU/NZ] :
    Suggested retail value $320us

THE HANCOCK

Adds $15 to The Launch Edition packages and you get a pack of adhesive bookplate inserts mailed in the post, signed by hand [by me of course], equal to the number of books you order to insert into your copies. It’s like i was there almost!

  • 5 copies: $55 [USA],
    & $65 [Canada] :
    Suggested retail value $80us
  • 10 copies: $95 [USA],
    & $105 [Canada] :
    Suggested retail value $160us
  • 20 copies: $170 [USA]
    & $190 [Canada] :
    Suggested retail value $320us

Shipping times are later for

VIRTUAL BOOK TOUR

With the bookplates and timing synced around my presenting the book at TCAF and related promotional efforts launching the title, it should make for a nice launch-week boost. I’d love to build on that but my ability to travel is limited. However, If you have the facilities in store – a laptop webcam and decent Internet connection — I was thinking i could make virtual appearances for an hour or so via skype or hangouts to meet with fans and chat in the days before or just after TCAF as well. Schedule permitting, but free!

I would like to get around more but I seldom have the means. So this one of the better chances you have of seeing me ‘in person’ outside of the Montreal/Toronto Corridor.

Inside the Montreal/Toronto Corridor, and Southern Ontario: retailers interested in me making an appearance should contact me about scheduling a singing in your store between May 8 to August 5th.

These pre-sales are final after the close of this pre-sale Oct 15. It would be nice but i can’t support returns, sorry.

Again I will likely have a later round of pre-orders around the holidays so don’t feel pressured to commit  They will be the same prices too.

Details about that, order sizes over 20, or anything else can be discussed via email before you pledge. Feel free to contact me with questions!

 

GLOSSARY OF EDITIONS

The Books will be produced via CreateSpace and shipped in North America to arrive the week before May 5th. Up to 22 days Later overseas. 150 pages, colour cover, 6”x9”, B&W interiors. Suggested retail price of $16us. The digital edtions will be PDF or CBR files, the retail price is expected to be $5.99.

  • Limited Early Edition | March 2013

The first edition exclusively created for Indiegogo backers of the book, with 10 pages of extended content. A preview of book two, art, and other goodies.

It will be published and shipped through out March 2013. Before the formal launch of Dream Life book one in May 2013.

Early editions will be identifiably marked as being a gift of appreciation for  having contributed. Distinguished inside and out from the Launch editions by unique art and printed bookplates. A special back cover and spine for them each is planed. The run of the Limited Early Editions will be limited to individual supporters who back the book before the funding drive ends October 15th 2012.

  • The Launch edition | May 2013

Like the first Early editions, The Launch edition will have it’s own unique markings and a printed decorated book plate inside the front cover with blank space for a sketch and signature. The spine and back will sport art unique to it as well.

This edition will be a limited run, closing within 3 months of the launch date – May 5th to the August 5th – or when 2000 copies are published, whichever comes first.

  • The Standard Edition | August 2013

After August 2013, orders from retailers and online orders from Amazon will be fulfilled with the standard edition  It will have it’s own unique markings and a printed decorated book plate inside the front cover with blank space for a sketch and signature. It will be nice but somewhat less elaborate. The spine and back will sport art unique to it as well. But it will not be limited at all.

You will not be able to order the Lunch or Early editions on Amazon online, only the standard edition  The Early editions will only come from backing this drive, and the Launch editions only from retailers or me directly at shows for the Launch period.

This by the way is not meant to encourage readers to buy all three. You’re welcome to, but my desire was to build in a way for backers and retailers to have an edge while ultimately planing for the longest tail possible.

  • The Standard Digital Edition | August 2013

A PDF of Dream Life | a late coming of age, book one. it’s planed to retail at 5.99, and be broken up into six 99 cent units as well. 

It will also be included in the purchase of the physical books from me online or in person after august.

  • The Personalized Digital Edition | March 2013

Exclusively from the Indiegogo funding drive. It is being offered during the funding drive exclusively at $5.

99 cents less than the standard edition. 

This one will include the cover art for the first two Editions, and a personalized sketch and signature. It will be available in PDF or CBR. The signed sketch will be mailed to the backers who receive this version. For those getting the physical book they will also receive an adhesive bookplate to include in their copy. This edition will be a digital copy of the Early Edition, and include the same extra 10 pages, modified to include a copy or your unique sketch and signature.

We made it!!! How much further can we go?

To be honest I was not at all confident this would work at first. Well, pressure is on, because I made my first funding goal!
Woooo! :D 
If you would like to help you still can!
your backing will make things a lot easier while i complete the book and the days left until Oct 15th are the last chance to get the limited Early Edition of Dream Life | a late coming of age, book one.
Take a look at the updated perk options and please consider jumping in! I took out those few people were not really going for, but the most popular remain. The $5 digital option, easy on the pocket book and cheaper than the standard Digital will be [99 cents less]. The Materialists options, and The Lucid Dreamer & The Pure Conscious Event will get you the very limited Early Edition of the book with extra content, and there's still Parts and Art to be had too. So have at it! 
For those checking out this campain for the first time, there are a 107 backers for the project so far and counting! I feel like dancing. But when you edit a perk here you loose the head count so thats why the low numbers on the perk descriptions.Backers, don't worry, if yours was one of the perks i took down, all perks will be honoured, my word! If not a few suprises too [working on a few things, probably won't be confirmed till it's time to ship the books so i won't be saying, you'll just have to find out! ;)].
-----Ok, Meating the goal also means I can expand on my plans publishing wise with confidence. Retailers, Comic shop and Book shop folks, look below to the bottom of this page, or here on my home site, for the new Retailers Only options to participate in the coordinated May 5th formal luanch of Dream Life | a late coming of age. 
No small business

Freinds and strangers did most of the work though, merci thanks and you're awsome for beliving in me!

--Project Description--
I'm just 30 pages shy of completing Dream Life | a late coming of age.

Hi, my name is Max Douglas, I'm a cartoonist, working under the pen name Salgood Sam, and with your help I’d like to get the first half of the longest story I've ever tried to tell completed in time for TCAF 2013.
I'm very close already, over 115 pages are done, just a mere thirty left to complete the first three chapters. I hope with this campaign I can dedicate the rest of this year to making those thirty pages my primary focus.
This story is a labour of love. A work of fiction with fantastic and adventure elements. It borrows from my own life--as close to autobiography as I've dared in many ways. The cast is an amalgam of people I've known and myself, played off archetypes. The situations and conflicts borrow from my own experiences and stories I've been close to.
Charlie's childhood friend is about to die.Hitch hiking in BC PJ's luck runs out.Lionel is in existential free-fall.Leslie is a therapist and part time drug dealer.It's just occurring to her she hates her job.Dan's daughter thinks he needs to grow up.-The story of five friends.Dreams, drugs, & denialall failing to weatherthe arc of life unscathed.Each coming to terms with lives peter panned,and in danger of going off the rails.

I've worked both commercially and independently for others most of the 20+ years that I've been a cartoonist. I've been lucky to often make my living doing that but there are always trade-offs and limits to the work.
With Dream Life I'm trying to do all the things i've always wanted to, tell a story that I'd want to read--without compromise or conditions.
I've been very lucky to receive grant funding for Dream Life in the past. That had been a huge help getting this far. But life throws us unforeseen curves: In early 2011, I was diagnosed with testicular cancer, and had an operation to remove it. I got lucky, hopefully will stay lucky. But I did lose a lot of time to that, dealing with the stress, distractions, and recovering from the operation.
And just as I was getting back to feeling normal, I got slammed by a bacterial infection in my stomach in the fall, lost fifteen pounds in two weeks, and a couple months due to being laid out and exhausted by that. So while the grant made getting as far as I have possible, and recovering a lot less stressful, I did not get as far as I had wanted to. So close though. So so close.
So it goes. I'm grateful and I'll keep at it one way or another, but the grant funds are gone now. Working as a freelancer takes up most of my time. Between finding the next job and doing the jobs, I’m left with little space to squeak out pages.
So I thought I’d try crowdfunding to make room to wrap up this first half of the book and put a small run of 100 B&W first editions in time for TCAF 2013. To do that I need to finance 3 months of focused work on this and this alone. 

I also plan to upload the book to Create Space [Amazon] so it will be available to all right away, either in print or digitally via their app market.On my own I’ll get there one day but probably not in time for TCAF, and I have other obligations in 2013 that will probably cause even more delays. So now’s the time to make this happen.
What I Need & What You Get[update: i've added printed edtions care of Create Space for some!]
The minimum to ensure this all happens is I think, $3500.
I've set the goal here at $3800 because of the site fees. If we reach $3800, what I'll get is just a bit over $3500. If we fall short the fees are a bit higher [4% if we match the goal, 9% if we fall short].
If we can surpass the goal, the surplus initially will go into better printing and/or a larger run for the first edition, and a bit more time/peace of mind.
If it looks like we're really going to knock it out of the park I'll think of some new worthy expanded goals, and perks. More art and reserved copies of the first edition are the first likely candidates.
For now I want to keep the bar low, so $3000 to cover living expenses while I do the work, and $500 to go mostly towards perks, maybe a bit left over for printing the first editions.The smallest support option is $5, with the perk of getting a digital edition [PDF or CBR, specify your preference when you dontate] of Dream Life | a late coming of age, book one. Like all supporters will get your name listed on the thank you page in the book and on my site unless you request otherwise. This option is essentially a pre-order of the digital edtion which will be sold for about that give or take a cent. I'm considering also making a set of 5 ¢99 versions available too but either way, $5. But by supporting now you will be the first to get Dream life, even before the early print editons are mailed out you'll be able to download your digital copy!
Updated: Folks who took 15 dollar personal digital edition will still get it but i removed it in the list to make room for new options. Personalized editions can still be had via the "get's personal" perks offered: For the supporters backing with $15 or more, their digital editions will be personalized, with a scanned handwritten signature, note, and sketch inside the “front page”. This will be unique to the funding drive.
The physical copy of signature pages will be mailed to you via regular letter post [no express or registered mail]. I'll be sending you an adhesive bookplate too if you're getting a copy of the book now.
Starting at $25 us, $35 for canadian and international backers [postage fees inc], by having supported the project you will receive the Limited Early Edition of the book, with 10 pages of extended content. A preview of book two, art, and other goodies.
You will again be among the first to see it, receiving your copies in March. Before the formal launch in May 2013! Your early editions will be identifiably marked as a result of having contributed Distinguished inside and out from the Launch editions. I'm thinking i'll draw a special back cover and spine for them both. The run will be limited to supporters who back the book before the funding drive ends October 15th 2012.
For $35 us, $ 45 for canadian and international backers [postage fees inc], you get A personalized digital copy, a copy of the singed page with sketch, and the Limited Early Edition of Dream life | a late coming of age. The signature page will be done on paper the right size to fit in your physical copy. I'm including an Adhesive bookplate designed for the Limited Early Edition too now. I'll be happy to do so again in person someday too if I happen to meet you. And shake your hand too! I might get emotional. :D
All Sociaty6 prints and the digital library of my independat work  have been removed as options. Not to worry, those who got them will be honoured of course! And if you miss the prints, you can always go for small donation here and get something from the shop!
For $100, along with all of that. you will get a bit part as an extra for one or more panels in Dream Life. 6 of these have been taken, expect to see cartoonists in this. :)
I'll send you a print of your cameo page along with the signature page in the mail.
Finally, $200 will get you either a piece of original art from Dream Life, or a private commision. Anything you like within reason [I won’t draw something I find offensive or otherwise objectionable]. This perk also comes with the printed book, and the digital catalog including personalized Dream Life-book one.
I've been tweaking the perks. Have a look and see what fits you!
What will be the Impact?
Well put simply, you will make my day, life, etc. It's really frustrating to be so close to being done this chunk of the book, and have to work on it in dribs and drabs.
I want Dream Life to be my BEST work. So, having the freedom to dedicate my energy to it alone for any amount of time will be awesome.
I can't promise you this book will change the world or solve poverty, but it will change my life; getting as far as I have already has, as it's already been noticed and got me nominated for an award last year as a web comic. Completing it and being able to present it in time for TCAF next year will mean the accomplishment of a major life and career goal. And for what it’s worth, I do think work that aspires to the standards and richness I hope to bring to Dream Life, enriches our world over all. Stories that have heart and integrity and try to make us think while being entertaining and beautiful.
With your help that's what I hope to bring forth.
Other Ways You Can Help
I've made it easy to pitch in even a little, but if you're really unable to support Dream Life financially, you can always help by telling as many other people as you can about this funding drive, and Dream Life generally. Use the Indiegogo social sharing tools, ‘like’ the fan page on Facebook, and share this link to the first 100+ pages online, on Facebook, Google+, or the webcomic page here, free to read.
Many thanks.
------------------------------------
I would not have gotten this far without help.Thanks to Jonathan Sugarman, who helped inspire this story, started the adventure with me and left lots of fun words to play with.
Thanks to Sadoceanspacebear, for the beautiful sounds.
To a.j.duric for showing me how to craft a grant application.
& A.J.Murphy for checking my grammar.
And many more too numerous to name.

We acknowledge the support of the Canada Council for the Arts, which last year invested $154 million to bring the arts to Canadians throughout the country.
Nous remercions le Conseil des arts du Canada de son soutien. L’an dernier, le Conseil a investi 154 millions de dollars pour mettre de l’art dans la vie des Canadiennes et des Canadiens de tout le pays.

So with a little over a week left in this funding drive, I’m going to go forward with a modified version of my second-tier goal and put up a set of retailer options!
There are variables that have to be entered manually, make sure you read carfully before entering, and please do contact me too. It would be nice for the exchange to be more personal and we can confirm the package you opted for.
You also have the option of doing this less publicly, via emal and other payment options, we don’t have to use Indiegogo for this.
To have a look at the contents of the book, I’ve created a trailer on youtube, and feel free to read through the 100+ pages here, or here, or here, or via this PDF file.  The web versions has some colour pages, something I was playing with but don’t have time to complete that way in the foreseeable future. For now the book is to be black and white like the PDF. The Launch edition will be 150 pages, colour cover, 6”x9”, B&W interiors. Suggested retail price of $16us. But there are prints of the colour art available.
THE DEAL
Following The Early Editions in March for individual backers, exclusively for Brick & Mortar comics retailers I’m adding the opportunity to make pre-orders of The Launch Edition, to be released corresponding with the official launch date of the May 5th-6th weekend of TCAF (Toronto Comic Arts Festival) 2013.
See the glossary at the bottom of this section for full descriptions of the different editions, there are 3, 5 if you include the digital ones!
Retailers in Canada and the US can get 5, 10 or 20 books for their shops, to be made available in the weeks before TCAF. Meant to be released the week & weekend of the official launch at the show.
For Retailers in Toronto, I plan be in town at TCAF 2013 attending. Presenting, confirmation of my attendance pending. So I can arrange to visit your shop that week in person!
And, if retailers elsewhere are interested in participating, I’ll be able to arrange pre-orders for anywhere Amazon delivers. I have less control over the timing abroad though, so I can’t promise these the May 5th-6th weekend.
They could be as much as 22 days later at the end of the month. With that in mind, I’ve posted rates for the UK, EU, AU, & NZ. Let me know if you would like your country estimated.
I’ve set the new retail options up by region, building the shipping fees into the price listed so it’s all straightforward–please take a moment to make sure you enter the right details when contributing.
To keep things simple on this site all numbers are in US currency. I'm warned by Amazon that you may have to deal with duties or taxes on your end. 
Reatilers participating in this presale will have their name and buisness listed on a thank you page. We will also post listings on salgoodsam.com and the official Dream Life site of all the shops that participate. That will include detailed info about where you are located, hours, and contact info.

story:
[LETTORI ITALIANI / ITALIAN READERS: SCORRETE AL FONDO DEL DOCUMENTO]

[LECTEURS FRANçAIS / FRENCH READERS: ALLEZ AU FOND DE LA PAGE]

[ENGLISH READERS... READ!]

Black Odyssey overturns the legendary epic poem by Homer, making it a darker and erotic story, and it rewrites the myth of Odysseus/Ulysses, deceitful speaker and villainous soul manipulator, the only survivor of an age of looting and murders.

Black Odyssey is an ambitious project by Passenger Press, one of the most daring and innovative indie publisher.

Format and packaging are absolutely original, as for every other Passenger Press products: three volumes, featuring texts in three languages (Italian, French and English), composed of double spread pages that recall ancient Greek art, collected in a box printed in limited edition 

Black Odyssey will come out for Lucca Comics and Games 2012 (1-4 November 2012) and will be presented also at Festival International de la Bande Dessinée d'Angoulême 2013 (31 January - 3 February 2013).

THE ARTISTS!

Every single volume of the Black Odyssey will be the work of a team of international creators, who will retell the main three story sequences of the poem: Telemachus quest for his father, Odysseus’ travels and at last his return to Ithaca.

The first chapter is written by Alessandro Cremonesi, scriptwriter for Lateral Studio (My Funny Valentine), with art by Christian G. Marra, visualizer and story board artist for international brands and directors, and founder of Passenger Press.

Valentino Sergi, writer of comicbooks and short stories for several Italian publishers, and comicbook reviewer, together with Portuguese artist Jorge Coelho, illustrator for famous international magazines like Penthouse, sign the second book.

The last chapter is another daring piece of work by the scriptwriter and novelist Adriano Barone, one of the most inventive author of the international scene, and the dark talent of the Belgian artist Alain Poncelet.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We want to make this project giving you the greatest quality and we need $1000 for the packaging and the print. Our three books will be in black ink on coloured paper and they'll be collected in a wonderful limited edition box.

Some of our perks include a ultra-limited edition print drawn by italian artist Adriano De Vincentiis. Only 50 Copies will be produced! Check it out!

Estimated shipping date of perks: around February 2013.

 

[The full packet, with Black Odyssey, Print and Sketch]

[The normal version]

[Another view of the normal version, that could be yours with the 25$ perk]

[Adriano De Vincentiis' signed print]

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the word, you can do it also on facebook and/or tumblr. Help us in making better comics for a better world!

Sketches, updates and trivia on the development of the project will appear regularly on Passenger Press website and on Seirenes Decameron, a blog of short stories published biweekly, that presents fabulous memories of the last four sirens survived in our world. Every story is written starting from a sentence provided to the authors by the anonymous blog readers. So pay attention during comicbook events when you will be asked “Please give me as a gift a sentence about the sea”: you could become part of the Black Odyssey…

[BOOKTRAILER created by Graziano Molteni and Adriano Barone. Many thanx friends!]

[IT]

“Ti racconterò, o poeta, la verità di colui che è odiato. Un bastardo senza pari in scaltrezza divenuto mito, che vagò per il mondo conosciuto dopo aver distrutto la sacra roccaforte di Troia. 
Egli depredò le città di molte genti, avido ne consumò l'anima e le donne dimentico di ogni clemenza, mentre il suo popolo gioiva di quell'assenza e pregava Ade affinché lo guidasse nel regno delle ombre.”

Passenger Press presenta Odissea Nera un romanzo grafico in tre atti (e tradotto in tre lingue) raccolti in un elegante cofanetto e a firma di

I - TELEMACHUS
Alessandro Cremonesi – Christian G. Marra

II - ULYSSES
Valentino Sergi – Jorge Coelho

III - PENELOPE
Adriano Barone – Alain Poncelet

Per i preordini su indiegogo una splendida serigrafia limitata di Adriano De Vincentiis.

[FR]

“Je te raconterai, ô poète, la vérité de celui qui est haï. Un bâtard, avec une finauderie sans pareille qui devint un mythe et qui a erré de par le monde connu aprè avoir détruit le château fort sacré de Troie. 
Il dépouilla les villes de nombreux peuples, il en consomma l’âme et les femmes, sans aucune clémence, tandis que son peuple jouissait de son absence et priait Hadès qu’il le guide dans le royaume des ombres.”

Passengere Press présente Noire Odyssée, un roman graphique en 3 actes (et traduit en 3 langues) rassemblés dans un élégant étui.

I - TELEMACHUS
Alessandro Cremonesi – Christian G. Marra

II - ULYSSES
Valentino Sergi – Jorge Coelho

III - PENELOPE
Adriano Barone – Alain Poncelet

Pour les ordres sur indiegogo une magnifique sérigraphie en édition limitée de Adriano De Vincentiis.
story_txt:
[LETTORI ITALIANI / ITALIAN READERS: SCORRETE AL FONDO DEL DOCUMENTO]
[LECTEURS FRANçAIS / FRENCH READERS: ALLEZ AU FOND DE LA PAGE]
[ENGLISH READERS... READ!]
Black Odyssey overturns the legendary epic poem by Homer, making it a darker and erotic story, and it rewrites the myth of Odysseus/Ulysses, deceitful speaker and villainous soul manipulator, the only survivor of an age of looting and murders.
Black Odyssey is an ambitious project by Passenger Press, one of the most daring and innovative indie publisher.
Format and packaging are absolutely original, as for every other Passenger Press products: three volumes, featuring texts in three languages (Italian, French and English), composed of double spread pages that recall ancient Greek art, collected in a box printed in limited edition 
Black Odyssey will come out for Lucca Comics and Games 2012 (1-4 November 2012) and will be presented also at Festival International de la Bande Dessinée d'Angoulême 2013 (31 January - 3 February 2013).

THE ARTISTS!
Every single volume of the Black Odyssey will be the work of a team of international creators, who will retell the main three story sequences of the poem: Telemachus quest for his father, Odysseus’ travels and at last his return to Ithaca.
The first chapter is written by Alessandro Cremonesi, scriptwriter for Lateral Studio (My Funny Valentine), with art by Christian G. Marra, visualizer and story board artist for international brands and directors, and founder of Passenger Press.
Valentino Sergi, writer of comicbooks and short stories for several Italian publishers, and comicbook reviewer, together with Portuguese artist Jorge Coelho, illustrator for famous international magazines like Penthouse, sign the second book.
The last chapter is another daring piece of work by the scriptwriter and novelist Adriano Barone, one of the most inventive author of the international scene, and the dark talent of the Belgian artist Alain Poncelet.
 





WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET
We want to make this project giving you the greatest quality and we need $1000 for the packaging and the print. Our three books will be in black ink on coloured paper and they'll be collected in a wonderful limited edition box.
Some of our perks include a ultra-limited edition print drawn by italian artist Adriano De Vincentiis. Only 50 Copies will be produced! Check it out!
Estimated shipping date of perks: around February 2013.



 
[The full packet, with Black Odyssey, Print and Sketch]

[Another view of the normal version, that could be yours with the 25$ perk]

[Adriano De Vincentiis' signed print]

story:
Hi!

Not on crack but greetings!

I'm trying to print up my hand drawn, computer edited comic book "Death Cat Comics Issue #3".  

Who am I?  

I'm a crazy person!  I make music, film & comics and work at a movie theatre as well as freelance film production work.  I'm from Detroit MI but moved to Los Angeles attempting to get rich & famous like everyone else so that I can pay off my loans, help my family out and bring dough back to Detroit to keep genuine art flowin'.

What is Death Cat?

I love cats.  Death Cat is the immortal feline.  It's my band and the comics are an extension of the music but in a more visual and narrative way.  

The comics are a mixture of surrealism, horror, scifi, avant garde, suspense, poetry and straight up non-sense.  As far as my comics go, this is my best work and evolution of the storylines.  There are four main stories and other fun things found in most Death Cat comics.  They include: Moon Balloon, Gatto di Morte, Skull Guts & Empty Chimera for issue 3.

All comics are 28 pages of full color.

All $$$ goes towards printing and shipping for the comics.  

I need at least $150 to print any.  If over $300 is raised, there will be a re-print of Issue #1.

Get your copy!

Love & Madness

ToM Zarzecki

story:
Présentation de l'œuvre

Azvaltya est un monde de rêve, une sorte de parabole qui fait allusion à 
notre vie intérieure, à nos pensées et à nos émotions. Sur sa route,
Marcel, le personnage principal, rencontre amis, potes, amour mais aussi trahison
et impasses. Ses problèmes sont devenus un fardeau qu’il traîne péniblement
derrière lui. Il est paumé dans un monde fantastique peuplé de fleurs géantes,
de montagnes, de monstres et de routes vivantes et psychologiquement instables.
Marcel se croit seul, mais c’est faux, car le créateur d’Azvaltya en personne
veille sur lui. Et les embûches qu’il permet sur son chemin sont en fait des marques
d’affection de sa part – même si seul le lecteur s’en rend compte.

Il est désormais possible de précommander la BD Azvaltya2 sur le site de l'auteur en suivant ce lien : https://www.auderset.com/shop/product.php?id_product=96

Dans ce tome 2, le créateur franchit un cap relationnel en approchant Marcel
davantage. Il cherche son cœur et pénètre son âme pour y attiser la foi et éveiller
sa soif d’absolu. Il met Marcel face à lui-même, face à ses incapacités, pour tenter
de le sauver de lui-même.    

Le but de l’auteur ?

Cette histoire nous met dans la même situation que Marcel, face à notre Créateur.
Car l'auteur est convaincu que Dieu aussi place des gens à Lui sur notre chemin,
Il se décarcasse pour éviter que l’on sombre dans notre épaisse bêtise.
Son but n’est pas de nous critiquer car personne ne nous comprend mieux
que Lui. Et même si on ne capte que dalle, Il continue à nous visiter en rêves, en
pensées et via les circonstances de la vie. Il cherche à nous rencontrer et cette BD
en est justement un moyen.  Mais qu'on y croit ou non, cette histoire est un
voyage plein de surprise. Et si le but de l'auteur est de nous ramener à une réalité
qui nous échappe, c'est aussi un divertissement qui paradoxalement permet de
nous évader de notre réalité quotidienne. Le temps d'une lecture nous aurons
comme l'impression bizarre d'avoir vécu un rêve...

Œuvre d'art Lorsque les dessins originaux de l’auteur – Alain Auderset, un
artiste plusieurs fois primé – sont présentés à des galeries d'art,
les professionnels sont unanimes pour reconnaître la grande force que dégagent
ces esquisses très travaillées.
C'est ainsi que l'idée de faire sa BD Azvaltya entièrement en esquisse a germé
dans l'esprit de son auteur. Pour une planche, comptez 8h d’esquisse pure.
Puis l'artiste scanne son dessin et le retravaille encore 10h sur Photoshop sans
passer par l'encrage. Le résultat est bluffant : un dessin abouti et fignolé,
qui contient toujours l’énergie de son esquisse de départ.

 
 

Besoin de vous

Situation financière de l'Atelier Malgré un succès d’estime, l'auteur ne peut
sortir cette BD sans une aide extérieur. Et même si la question de la survie
financière de l’Atelier revient presque à chaque fin de mois, A. Auderset reste
confiant en l'avenir.

Besoin de votre complicité La première recherche de fonds a été une expérience enthousiasmante : plus que la victoire que représente la somme obtenue,
c'est ce sentiment de ne pas être seul. Réaliser que toute une communauté
de lecteurs est derrière son œuvre est un encouragement formidable. Plusieurs
participants ont témoigné la joie qu'ils avaient de ne plus être que spectateurs,
mais participants.

 

Live en direct

Suivez et participez à l’avancement du projet en direct !

Tous les jeudis à 19h00 Rendez-vous sur Facebook à partir du 25 avril 2019
et jusqu’au 6 juin,
Alain Auderset (l’auteur) sera en direct sur vos écrans pour des moments sympas
et drôles, des partages et des témoignages, mais aussi pour communiquer des
infos fraîches sur l’évolution du projet. Les internautes auront la possibilité de
donner leurs impressions et leurs idées. Et pour ceux qui n’ont pas Facebook,
il sera aussi possible de nous suivre en direct sur www.auderset.com
et de réagir par e-mail.  

Les goodies

Un petit cadeau de remerciement à caractère exclusif (qui ne pourra pas s’acheter
par la suite) sera offert aux participants. Pour ce 2ème tome, nous avons décidé
de faire au plus simple avec seulement 4 paliers dont un collector Azvaltya.

 

Sentorette / 20 €

1. Pour un don de 20 €, vous recevrez : Une sentorette à mettre dans votre voiture
    (ou sous vos aisselles).

 

Tableau / 90 €

2. Pour un don de 90 € : Un tableau 20cm x 20cm, imprimé sur toile.

 

BD Collector / 180 €

3. Pour un don de 180 € : La BD d’Azvaltya en version Collector 

 

Couteau Suisse / 270 €


 

4. Pour un don de 270 € : Un couteau Suisse Victorinox gravé au nom
     de l’Atelier Auderset

 

Autres dons

Il est toutefois possible de verser un don sans passer par l’un des 4 paliers.
Même si vous ne donnez qu’un euro, ça compte grave !
Car si tout le monde s’y met, ça fera la différence !
(Hein? Euh oui, donner 1 milliard ça devrait être possible aussi...)

 

 

La BD Collector

  

Cette année, c’est vraiment du jamais vu !
Le livre est au format A3, (le double d’un livre normal).
Ceux qui aiment se perdre dans les détails de paysages hors du commun vont
se régaler.
Deux livres en un C’est le premier collector d’Azvaltya et il est composé des
deux premiers tomes de la saga.
L’idée ingénieuse du cadre
Il est livré avec un cadre en bois spécial dans lequel on peut insérer le livre afin de
l’accrocher au mur tel un tableau. L’avantage, en plus d’avoir une belle déco pour
son intérieur, est de ne pas avoir à trouver une place pour le ranger. Le cadre a été
pensé avec un système facile permettant de retirer ou remettre le livre en place
à tout moment.

- plus de 120 pages (2 livres en 1 !)

- art book intégré - Format A3

- Papier épais (140gr) - couverture et tranche gaufrées

- marque page en fil (tissu rouge)

- tirage numéroté et signé attestant son caractère exclusif.

- tirage limité selon le nombre de précommandes
  (mais ne devrait à priori pas excéder 150 exemplaires.)

story:
About the Story

"The Pipers" is based on a short story by Philip K. Dick, who wrote over 100 short stories and over 40 books — many of which are responsible for films such as Blade Runner, Minority Report, Total Recall and The Man in the High Castle.

 

About the Creators

We are siblings! We were born 18 months apart in Portland, Oregon to parents who self-published over 20 books — books are in our blood! Paul du Coudray is a designer / artist / illustrator living in Taos, New Mexico. Beth is an author, speaker, and illustrator living in Portland, Oregon. She has illustrated books such as Before They Were Authors, I, Parrot, and The Girl Who Named Pluto.

 

Why Print?

Mascot is publishing books as a way of creating 'artifacts' and some artifacts deserve to be held. We also recognize that making a book requires resources and the actual impact of consuming resources is exponentially more complicated than just what goes into making a book. As we strive to make all printed works as tree-worthy as possible, we are additionally donating money for at least 1 tree to be planted per printed book.

 

Why Indiegogo?

Indiegogo is the perfect platform to fund the completion and printing of this book, and offers us the ability to produce books for exactly how many people would like to buy them! We already have a print broker lined up, a warehouse in Colorado ready for shipping & fulfillment — so why are we asking for money? We want to know how many books to print for you! One of the most exciting things about this project is that we are done... with the WHOLE book... let's go to print!

 

Affordability

We're offering an e-book for international supporters because shipping books outside of the U.S.A. is crazy expensive. We also want to make this book accessible to anyone in the world, and to honor the rights-free status of Philip K. Dick’s story. If for any reason you can’t afford the print version and don’t have a dollar to spare for the digital version, you can direct message Paul on Instagram when the project is over and we’ll send you a link for a free download!

 

Gifts

Do you want to give this as a gift to someone for the holiday or just because? Send the following link, or download the PDF to give to loved ones while they await the book in the mail! Check it out:

https://www.mascot.studio/gift

 

Timing

When the Indiegogo ends we'll know how many books to print and we'll place an order shortly thereafter! The process of printing takes about 3 months, so you could expect your book(s) sometime in early Spring :-)

Credit

Paul du Coudray

Co-creator of The Pipers

Founder / Studio Mascot

instagram.com/paulducoudray

mascot.studio

 

Beth Haidle

Co-creator of The Pipers

Art Director / Collaborator / Studio Mascot

Creative Director / Illustoria Magazine

instagram.com/ehaidle

docucomix.com

d.rip/ehaidle

 

Fern • animated trailer • website

Jonathan Haidle • music • instagram

Megan Dailey • layout and design • website

Joz Martinez • video • instagram

Samantha Bunn • making it all happen • linkedIn

Chyna Dixon • making it all happen • instagram

 

Mascot

Studio Mascot, founded by Paul du Coudray, is growing up to be a group of practitioners who are exploring a variety of themes within multiple mediums.

 

Mascot Press • A small press devoted to important works. We have several more books planned for 2019.

 

Mascot Films • We are working on a couple of film projects, ranging from animated films to documentary style.

 

Mascot Foundry • Our mini-foundry was created in order to share the hand-written fonts that we use in our projects with other artists. Why? Because most of the hand-written fonts out there suck. We hope ours don’t suck and that you enjoy using them.

Please visit us at http://mascot.studio

Thanks!

Risks and challenges

(1) International shipping is expensive and therefore a major challenge is that the bulk of the minimum funding necessary will need to come mostly from people within the U.S.A. (2) Quality control can also be a challenge when printing, but we're using the same print brokers in Colorado that have helped us — and our family — in the past multiple times!

Why Print?
Mascot is publishing books as a way of creating 'artifacts' and some artifacts deserve to be held. We also recognize that making a book requires resources and the actual impact of consuming resources is exponentially more complicated than just what goes into making a book. As we strive to make all printed works as tree-worthy as possible, we are additionally donating money for at least 1 tree to be planted per printed book.
 
Why Indiegogo?
Indiegogo is the perfect platform to fund the completion and printing of this book, and offers us the ability to produce books for exactly how many people would like to buy them! We already have a print broker lined up, a warehouse in Colorado ready for shipping & fulfillment — so why are we asking for money? We want to know how many books to print for you! One of the most exciting things about this project is that we are done... with the WHOLE book... let's go to print!
 
Affordability
We're offering an e-book for international supporters because shipping books outside of the U.S.A. is crazy expensive. We also want to make this book accessible to anyone in the world, and to honor the rights-free status of Philip K. Dick’s story. If for any reason you can’t afford the print version and don’t have a dollar to spare for the digital version, you can direct message Paul on Instagram when the project is over and we’ll send you a link for a free download!
 
Gifts
Do you want to give this as a gift to someone for the holiday or just because? Send the following link, or download the PDF to give to loved ones while they await the book in the mail! Check it out:
https://www.mascot.studio/gift

 
Timing
When the Indiegogo ends we'll know how many books to print and we'll place an order shortly thereafter! The process of printing takes about 3 months, so you could expect your book(s) sometime in early Spring :-)
Credit
Paul du Coudray
Co-creator of The Pipers
Founder / Studio Mascot
instagram.com/paulducoudray
mascot.studio
 
Beth Haidle
Co-creator of The Pipers
Art Director / Collaborator / Studio Mascot
Creative Director / Illustoria Magazine
instagram.com/ehaidle
docucomix.com
d.rip/ehaidle
 
Fern • animated trailer • website
Jonathan Haidle • music • instagram
Megan Dailey • layout and design • website
Joz Martinez • video • instagram
Samantha Bunn • making it all happen • linkedIn
Chyna Dixon • making it all happen • instagram
 
Mascot
Studio Mascot, founded by Paul du Coudray, is growing up to be a group of practitioners who are exploring a variety of themes within multiple mediums. Mascot Press • A small press devoted to important works. We have several more books planned for 2019. Mascot Films • We are working on a couple of film projects, ranging from animated films to documentary style. Mascot Foundry • Our mini-foundry was created in order to share the hand-written fonts that we use in our projects with other artists. Why? Because most of the hand-written fonts out there suck. We hope ours don’t suck and that you enjoy using them.
Please visit us at http://mascot.studio
Thanks!

Risks and challenges
(1) International shipping is expensive and therefore a major challenge is that the bulk of the minimum funding necessary will need to come mostly from people within the U.S.A. (2) Quality control can also be a challenge when printing, but we're using the same print brokers in Colorado that have helped us — and our family — in the past multiple times!

story:
HEY EVERYONE!

 

I'm Ethan Van Sciver!  As we close out the CYBERFROG BLOODHONEY campaigns and everything ships out, I'm offering a second chance on the books that are left over!

I've got 800 SALAMANDROID CHROMIUM books, the rarest of all of the variants, and PLENTY of CYBERFROG 1998: THE DIARY OF HEATHER SWAIN ashcans, which will come with the AMPHIBIONIX ashcan as well!  If you missed the ashcan, it's a new 20 page story about how HEATHER SWAIN survives the invasion, and shouldn't be missed!

 

CYBERFROG Chromium covers will be available in a different campaign, probably later.  It turns out that I'm going to have fewer of those available, but I'll try to offer what I have to you when all returns and replacements are processed!

Books will ship in January of 2020!

 

I'll leave this campaign up for ten days, or for as long as supplies last!

story:
Hey all Bokuman here! Living in a tropic exotic country, and drawing pinups and making doujins.

Been in the videogame development, doing pinup artwork and comics for 10+ years. I want to produce this doujin and if is posible run a small print and much more! all is posible with your help. :D

Me and my team are really looking forward to doing this project, we will do our best!

Hello and welcome to the world of Sexy Helper Pet Chapter 02! Where you can download your very own personal lover to play with! Customize them to your preferences then download and indulge in your deepest sexy fantasies! 

In this new chapter we introduce the creator of technology of Sexy Helper Pet with his new creation... Sabrina!

Starring real world cosplayer Sabrina Nichole (https://twitter.com/SabrinaTheBunny)

In a brand new 16 pages comic with art by Bokuman Studio Team and written by MrObscura101

Some example pages

 

3000 US - 16 pages Digital version. 

3500 US - 16 pages Digital version, Aditional cover, Poster.

5000 US - 16 pages Digital version, Aditional cover, Poster, 10 bonus pages.

XXXX US - to be defined

 

When will I receive the digital files?

  • I will working on this comic while the campaign is running, maybe a month or two  after the campaign is ending.

More to be added as asked.

Is the second time i running a campaign like that, but digital distribution is easy, and i have a lot experience creating comics, we want to get some funds for pay the production, time work, and some cookies for the team!

  • Make an 1$ contribution
  • Share the campaign on social media
  • Tell your friends, your family, your cat!

story:
* Side note, before we get started, I was going to have a video intro, but where I'm currently staying the internet is absolute shit, so uploading a video is impossible at the moment. *

The Misfortune Chronicles: A 2020 Johnny Segura Sketchbook

The Misfortune Chronicles will be a 40 page, fully hand rendered sketchbook.
The funds raised on this campaign will go towards helping me get resettled.
I lost my home in Hurricane Laura.
Being displaced really fuckin' sucks and is really fuckin' expensive.
So, I wanted to do this sketchbook as a way to ask for help and to make sure that for everyone who helps me out gets something AWESOME in return!

* the actual sketchbook being filled *

I stayed in town during the storm. Spent 4 days in town and then had nowhere to go.
So, I grabbed the essentials and went to go stay with my sister in Dallas.
I wasn't able to grab much. Mainly, my Copics and my Cintiq and my tower.
So when I got to Dallas, I was lacking a ton of shit. My sister got me a Strathmore MIxed Media sketchbook. Which is how the idea for this project came about. I plan to have all 40 pages filled before the campaign is over and will have the original pages up for grabs.
The sketchbook up for grabs will be a page by page reproduction of the original.
The contents will be everything from original works to NSFW goodies to fanart.

*the final product will be completely uncensored*

Along with the regular cover of the book, I'll be offering  commissions to go along with it as well as stretch goals! :D
So, thank you all so much for helping to make this happen.
This book is going to come out bad ass and you will get something amazing along with helping me out.
Needless to say, I really appreciate it.

Shipping
All packages will be shipped Priority via USPS and you will tracking numbers to make sure your books get there safely.
And all 11x17 packs will be shipped flat via USPS Priority.
All US orders should take 3-5 days to get to you.
All foreign orders will take a bit longer depending on your region.

In closing
I just wanted to say thank you and I love you all.
Thank you for having faith in me and my work.
And if you have any questions, feel free to hit me up!
E-mail: JohnnySegura3rd@gmail.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ArtofJohnnyJSeguraIII
Instagram: JohnnySegura3rd
Twitter: JohnnySegura3rd

story: BRIGADE is my long gestating magnum opus that I’ve been fine tuning amidst a sea of changes! It’s ready to take flight and the funds raised are poured back into the production and distribution of this project. Since our initial campaign, so many have asked how they can participate and this indie a go go campaign is intended to provide participants a means to jump on board! I have poured many years and hours into this project and I look forward to getting it into your hands!

I have poured many years and hours into this project and I look forward to getting it into your hands!

story:
What is Malevolent Rising?

Malevolent Rising is an indie, sci-fi, superhero comic book. It's aliens, conspiracies, monsters, everything that makes the art form of comics fun!  

An alien, whose entire race is enslaved by an evil intergalactic empire called The Sovereignty escapes his masters and flees to a primitive planet outside of Sovereignty space called Earth. On Earth he meets new allies, discovers new threats, and may have accidentally set events into  motion that may lead his former captors to his new home world.  

But don't just take my word for it, See for yourself!

What will the funds be used for?

The first issue is already written and drawn and I'm hard at work on issue number two. These funds are to have the book professionally colored to help really bring the pages to life. I also need to cover the costs of printing and getting this book to you, the reader. Lastly, I will pay my collaborators and the creators who helped make this awesome book a reality. 

Stretch goals will go to enhancing the final product.

$10K-behind the scenes sketchbook and extra pages of early character designs included at the end of the book.

$20K-Upgraded paper stock for interior pages.

40K-Prestige format cover

50K-(Here's hoping) 48 page double issue featuring a second full length original story starring another all new character, The Dark Hood! 

And I'll keep adding more perks past that if we reach it!

story:
PLEASE NOTE: You can pledge multiple times to receive multiple perks!

About The Artist

A graduate of the University of Cincinnati with a degree in painting, Russell has run the gamut in comics. After establishing a name for himself at Marvel on Killraven and Dr. Strange, he went on to become one of the pioneers in opening new vistas for this underestimated field with, among other works, adaptations of operas by Mozart (THE MAGIC FLUTE), Strauss (SALOME) and Wagner (THE RING OF THE NIBELUNG). Craig has completed five volumes of comic-book adaptations of the FAIRY TALES OF OSCAR WILDE and has beautifully brought to life characters as diverse as Batman, Conan, Hellboy, The Spirit, Death and The Sandman. His more recent work includes comic book adaptations of Neil Gaiman’s CORALINE and THE GRAVEYARD BOOK.

Our Fourth Art Restoration Campaign

We are pleased to launch our fourth art restoration-related crowdfunding campaign to raise funds for the scanning, restoration and preservation of the original color art that P. Craig Russell created for his comic-book adaptation of THE JUNGLE BOOK stories "The King's Ankus" and "Red Dog!"

Coloring Comics In The 1980s

Back in the 1980s and early 90s, well before computer coloring, P. Craig Russell decided that he wanted to hand-color a number of his creator-owned projects using mixed media to allow for more gradations in color, mood and effect. To start with, he had his original black-and-white line art reproduced on letter-sized sheets of clear plastic. He then placed that plastic copy over another piece of letter-sized art paper. When hand-coloring, he would lift the plastic sheet repeatedly, over and over and over again, so that he could apply the mixed-media color to the bottom sheet. It was an insanely time-intensive process, but the end results were uniquely and undeniably beautiful. When the art was published, it was shot from the reduced color “masters" with the reduced black & white linework overlaid via the plastic.

In recent years, this original original color art has deteriorated badly, with much of it becoming “mottled,” chipped, faded and decayed. The plastic overlays with the black and white line art have also yellowed, shrunk and flaked away. These first color "masters" are pretty much unusable for any future presentation of these groundbreaking stories. All are in dire need of both restoration and preservation. This includes the color art for such landmark projects as SALOME, THE MAGIC FLUTE, PELLEAS AND MELISANDE, THE JUNGLE BOOK, HUMAN REMAINS. THE GIFT OF THE MAGI and more. We are attempting to restore and preserve all of these masterworks on a project-by-project basis.

To date, we've successfully crowdfunded restorations of  ARIANE AND BLUEBEARD, THE DREAMING CITY and WHILE THE GODS LAUGH. This fourth campaign is to restore and preserve P. Craig Russell's original color art for two of his JUNGLE BOOK stories—"The King's Ankus" and "Red Dog."

Our Restoration and Preservation Process

First, an “Artifact Scan” will be made of each original comic art page. While appearing to be in black and white, each original art page is scanned in color to show blue pencil and other corrections. This is to create a digital file of the original page for preservation and posterity:

The second step will be to create a second high resolution scan—this time in black & white—to capture Craig's black ink art in as pristine a manner as possible. The bitmap scan is then gone over with a fine-tooth “digital comb” to remove as many imperfections as possible—again, to capture the ink art as crisply and cleanly as possible:

We then take Craig's original mixed-media hand-coloring and scan it at a very high resolution:


 

Finally, the super-sharp, original black line art is taken from our second scan and combined with the newly-restored hand coloring in an all-new, high resolution digital file. This is the cleanest, clearest presentation that this stunning art has ever had—and it’s now beautifully restored and preserved for generations to come:

What We Need & What You Get

This multi-year undertaking is going to be extremely expensive and time-consuming, so we are raising funds for the restorations via a series of project-related crowd-funded campaigns. 

Please keep in mind that after we pay IndieGoGo fees, PayPal fees for credit card processing, income taxes (funds raised via crowdfunding campaigns are considered as income and thus are taxable) and the substantial costs of creating, manufacturing and shipping our physical perks . . . not a lot of money is left over. After the dust clears, we still have to have sufficient funds remaining for the primary purpose of the campaign—to restore and preserve P. Craig Russell's original art.

By supporting this campaign, you are making these projects happen as a valued pledge partner. Our illustrated cards and fine art prints are basically the equivalent of the books, calendars or mugs that viewers receive when donating to a PBS Pledge Drive. However, we hope that you will agree that our perks are much more unique and of long-lasting value.

Reward Perks

Signed Commemorative Cards

We will snail-mail you this beautifully-illustrated, full-color 5x7" "Thank You" card—personally signed by P. Craig Russell!

Signed & Numbered Limited Fine Art Giclée Prints

ALL-NEW PRINT DEBUT! The Jungle Book Signed Giclée Print: Image size is approximately 10x10" with a white border on all sides. Our fine art Giclées are printed with archival UltraChrome inks on 100% cotton acid-free rag paper. Each print comes personally signed by P. Craig Russell.

P. Craig Russell's Guide to Graphic Storytelling (Elric Edition)

A full-length instructional video (Region 0, NTSC DVD) featuring artist P. Craig Russell teaching the art of comic-book storytelling by examining sequences from "The Dreaming City" and "While the Gods Laugh." This SPECIAL LIMITED EDITION comes with a beautifully-illustrated insert that is both SIGNED and NUMBERED by the artist!

Original B&W Art Rewards

PCR will create an original b&w illustration just for you! Image will be an inked drawing (approximately 10x15") on standard comic art board. Choice of characters includes Conan, Elric, Dr. Strange, Sandman, as well as Jungle Book, Arabian Nights or Lovecraft-inspired pieces. Other characters are possible, but please inquire before pledging.

Original Color Art Reward

PCR will create an original, oversized hand-colored illustration just for you! Image will be 15x15" in full color mixed media (pencil, pen, inks, paint, etc) on strathmore two ply art board. Craig would like to do a "Jungle Book" or "Killraven" inspired piece, but other characters are possible. Please inquire before pledging.

story:
Malevolent Rising is a sci-fi superhero book about and alien slave that escapes his captors and flees to Earth. It's a fun ride filled with over the top action and a compelling story. The first issue was funded by a previous indiegogo campaign and was fulfilled on time. This book has been completely made possible by the support of my wonderful backers, and I truly hope that you will consider coming on board for issue 2!

What you get...

This time around, we will be offering even more ways to get the book. Variant and sketch covers, and a tier that will allow those of you who missed the first issue to get both books and enjoy the story from the beginning. All of that plus extras and original artwork.

How will I use the money that I raise?

All of the funds will be put back into the book and my creative team that helped this come together. It will cover coloring, printing, and getting the book to the readers as well as extras such as stickers, prints, and premium covers. The more contributions we receive, the more I can create to give back to my backers. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my project, and I really hope that you will consider backing issue 2 and joining our growing Malevolent Rising community.

All of that plus extras and original artwork.How will I use the money that I raise?All of the funds will be put back into the book and my creative team that helped this come together. It will cover coloring, printing, and getting the book to the readers as well as extras such as stickers, prints, and premium covers. The more contributions we receive, the more I can create to give back to my backers. Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my project, and I really hope that you will consider backing issue 2 and joining our growing Malevolent Rising community.

story:
CHE COS'È AGENZIA INCANTESIMI?

Agenzia Incantesimi è una serie a fumetti pubblicata gratuitamente sull'omonima pagina. Ne sono protagoniste Jasmine e Myriam, due ragazze che, grazie ai loro poteri magici (la prima è una potente maga, la seconda è figlia della regina del Popolo Fatato), indagano su tutti quei casi in cui sia coinvolta la magia.

Le nostre due protagoniste vivono infatti in un mondo in cui esiste la magia e tutta una serie di creature fantastiche come elfi, orchi, fate e altri ancora camminano tranquillamente in mezzo a noi. Un po' come se la Terra di Mezzo o Faerun fossero stati il nostro mondo durante il Medioevo, insomma.

LA TRAMA DI QUESTO EPISODIO IN BREVE

Myriam e Jasmine si ritrovano a dare la caccia a un mostro che infesta le fogne di Parigi. E se vi attendete brivido, orrore e raccapriccio, tenete presente che quel terreno di caccia è anche il "regno" di un'abituale avversaria delle nostre due eroine...

"Nato dalla terra" (10 pagg., a colori) è un episodio di Agenzia Incantesimi scritto da Federico Memola e disegnato da Giuseppe Guida, con i colori di Alessio Nocerino.

DI COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO

Nonostante la realizzazione di questa storia non dipenda da questa campagna, al momento Giuseppe e Alessio stanno lavorando gratuitamente. Nonostante i miei più sinceri ringraziamenti contribuiscano indubbiamente a colmare i loro animi di gioia, ci terrei però a fornire loro un segno più tangibile della mia gratitudine. O, per dirla tutta, a corrispondere una giusta retribuzione per il loro lavoro! Questa campagna servirà quindi a pagare i due artisti grazie ai quali potrete leggere un'altra avventura di Myriam e Jasmine.

A CHE COSA SERVIRANNO I VOSTRI CONTRIBUTI

Come ho già detto, per prima cosa i fondi raccolti verranno utilizzati come retribuzione per Giuseppe e Alessio. Ma l'entità delle donazioni può anche influenzare la realizzazione delle prossime storie. Infatti contribuendo a questa campagna non solo mostrerete un tangibile apprezzamento per il lavoro dei due autori, ma incentiverete anche altri disegnatori a cimentarsi con le avventure di Myriam e Jasmine. Il vostro sostegno, quindi, potrà aiutarci a produrre altre storie di Agenzia Incantesimi.

Noi porteremo avanti in ogni caso questo progetto, ma voi ora potete fare la differenza permettendoci di intensificare le "uscite" e ottenendo in cambio la possibilità di leggere un maggior numero di storie all'anno. Il che mi auguro sia una gradita eventualità!

ALTRI MODI IN CUI POTETE AIUTARCI

Se non avete la possibilità di contribuire economicamente, magari potete aiutarci ugualmente segnalando sulle vostre pagine e ai vostri contatti questa campagna. Noi ve ne saremo comunque grati!
