story:
About the project

'Undocumented: The Architecture of Migrant Detention Centres' is a graphic account of the conditions in Canada's horrific migrant detention system by author and activist Tings Chak. Here's Tings in her own words:

"On September 17, 2013, just two weeks into my final semester of architecture graduate school, something historic happened: 191 migrant men in immigration detention centre in Central East Correctional Centre—a maximum security prison in Lindsay, Ontario—went on hunger strike. These men—among the thousands of women, men, and children across the country detained every year indefinitely without charge or trial—refused meals, refused enter their cells, and did so in the face of already great repression and isolation. They were resisting the fact that their freedom was being stolen simply because they were born in the "wrong" place.

As a student who felt too politicized, too radical, and too involved in migrant justice movements, I struggled to talk about detention centres in architecture settings. To me, it was clear how architecture gets used to uphold state violence against migrants, particularly working class Black and Brown migrants. To me, immigration detention was an architecture problem if only for the fact that architects design, build, and profit off of the detention of migrants!

Even the most well-meaning of liberal architects and architecture students alike would end up asking me, What about a better (more humane/green/socially responsible) detention centre? 

But my answer would be: No prisons. No detention. No families separated by cages. The answer is: Freedom to move, return, and stay.

During those months following the hunger strike, while intensely organizing with grassroots groups like No One is Illegal - Toronto and End Immigration Detention Network that took leadership from immigration detainees, I explored more this question of the architecture of migrant detention. But the more I searched, the more I realized how hidden this world was—intentionally so. The buildings, like the people locked inside them, were undocumented.

So began this unusual project of using the architectural tools of representation I learned in school as a political tool of documenting and reconstructing these sites of detention. Unbeknownst to me, what emerged was a graphic "novel," or visual essay, or architectural documentary called Undocumented: The Architecture of Migrant Detention.

This is a project about implicating the many hands who participate in and profit from the design and construction of detention centres. This is a project about bringing in these out-of-sight-out-of-mind realities into our conversations about the built environment.

But most importantly, this is a project about provocation, inviting YOU, the reader, to join us in the political project of dreaming (and building) a world without prisons and without borders.

tings chak"


Whether we are situated in the United States, Canada, Australia, or anywhere in the European Union, the nature of migrant detention centers remains much the same. This book will help readers and activists around the world better understand the consequences of a world that militarizes its borders, and criminalizes those who cross them in the name of "national security".

 

The basics about Undocumented:

  • It was first published as a series of zines, then as a small-run of less than 1,000 copies.
     
  • This time, we're aiming to print 3,000 copies.
     
  • Ad Astra Comix is a Canadian publishing collective dedicated to producing social justice comics.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal:

  • This is a pre-order campaign. For the most part, you'll be ordering a copy of the book, which you'll receive as soon as it's printed (approximately a month before the book will be available in stores).  $8000 pays for the book's printing, transport, and related operating costs. If we raise more than $8000, we have some exciting ideas that we can share with you when the time comes.
     
  • Royalties on this title are being donated by the author to the End Immigration Detention Network, so every book purchased helps in the fight for migrant justice!
     
  • We've set a goal that will allow us to print 3,000 copies. If we don't raise the full amount, we will do a smaller print run to ensure the book still reaches as many people as possible - including you, as a funder.
     
  • A number of rad artists around the world have contributed unique, original art for sale to support the crowdfunder. If you order one of these prints, you'll not only be supporting the publication of the book, but supporting the important work of political artists. In short: you're awesome!

The Impact

By pre-ordering a copy of this book, you are making this special edition of "Undocumented" possible. Here's why that matters:

  • Migrant detention is a horrific practice that is largely unknown, even in the communities that host migrant detention centers. We hope that this book (and the art from our art drive) can help raise awareness about this struggle.

  • This book will be an invaluable resource for understanding the conditions in the migrant detention system. The success of this crowdfunder will send a message that awareness around this issue is growing, and add to the chorus of voices challenging the practice of migrant detention.

  • Supporting this crowdfunder helps show the world that there is a demand for projects like this one - comics that are not only entertaining, but informative! Your support on this project helps us continue to make comics about social justice--that inform AND engage.

 

Risks & Challenges

This isn't our first time to the crowdfunding rodeo. Here's what we're facing:

  • We've run three pre-order campaigns for books so far. Two of them raised the necessary funds for the print run we hoped for. The third fell short, and as such, we had to reduce our print-run. Despite this, all funders still got their perks--we just didn't get to make as many books as we wanted. 
  • We've learned from this experience and have developed a model where we can anticipate and succeed with several campaign outcomes. Despite this contingency planning, we remain confident that "Undocumented" will be our most successful campaign yet.
  • In the unlikely event that we don't raise enough money to fund a proper print run (1,000 copies or more) we will refund all orders.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford a copy of the book? Waiting for it to appear in your local book store? Already own two copies and can't defend purchasing a third? No problem! There's still plenty you can do to support us:

  • Inform yourself about migrant detention in your area. Who does the system effect? Who does it benefit? Feel free to share your thoughts, stories, photos, drawings, etc. with us!
  • We're doing our best to produce content in support of the campaign - news, video, original art and more. Watch our social media for opportunities to share content -  We're active on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and Instagram.
  • Reach out to your local migrant justice organizing and see what you can do to help!
  • Talk with your classmates, co-workers, friends and family about the topic of migrant detention. How much do they know about this system?
  • Request a copy of the book at your local library! You'll need the book's 13-digit ISBN number, which is: 978-0-9940507-6-2

 

Thanks for everything! Your support makes a world of difference.

story:
OMG! A Horror Anthology #1

I am Robert Dieterle I started  Aequitas Comics in July 2018 with the idea of bringing a fresh new way of publishing new comics using veteran and up and coming artists from around the world. What better of a way than an anthology to makes it easy to mix up old and new talent. 

Our horror anthology is the ground work for introducing a variety of new characters that will have the opportunity to become their own stand alone comic series. We have a dozen short stories in production for issues 2 and 3 along with 2 stories we hope to be successful by themselves.  

By contributing to our project you will help us bring new talent to the industry with new ideas. As you all know Anthologies can go on forever and we plan on keeping them scary, funny, dramatic, and to have the person reading the stories thinking to themselves OMG!  at the end of each short story.

 

The goal is 5k

5k would fund the printing of the book in the united states. That way we can start shipping the day the campaign ends. Remember the book is done, all edits are complete and its ready for print.

Each book will be inspected prior to shipping and packed with press board to prevent damage. If we reach our goal everyone gets a 8 x 10 print of a random character from the book, by one of the following artists; Ryan Kincaid, Tone Rodriguez, Chris Ehnot, Jose Varese, Candice Dailey, or Josh Church.

If we do not reach the 5k we will still print the necessary amount of books to fill every order placed. If we surpass the goal every $2500.00 we will add stickers, bracelets, koozies, and metal trading cards.

Success!

Getting a good comic book with awesome artists working together on great content is what the success of this campaign will bring to the world of comics. Here is the list of contributors for issue #1; Tone Rodriguez, Ryan Kincaid, Rob Broussard, Chris Ehnot, McLain McGuire, Jose Varese, Jeremy Clark, Jake Goodman, Damon Pellican, Candice Dailey, Raymund Lee, Bill Morrison, Jorge Cortes, Albert Morales, Joshua Church, David Delanty, and Robert Dieterle.

Risks & Challenges

The book is complete and ready for print, all we need is for a massive group of contributors to believe in us and we will not fail you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If by some reason you can not contribute please take a moment and share our project with your friends. Leave us a comment of encouragement. We love our fans.

story:
"Define the Line" is a workplace harassment training tool in the form of a comic book to help train, educate, and empower employees, managers, and business owners to create workplaces that are harassment free. 

Within the pages of Define the Line employees, managers, and owners will have checklists to know what next steps to take. Included in the pages we'll have self-checks and evaluations to ensure everyone knows how to Define the Line for themselves and others.

simplyHR LLC, cofounders, Tina Todd and Nikki Larchar, have over 15 years of experience helping business owners go through the process of investigating harassment claims. Inspired by real-life accounts, "Define the Line" will highlight some of the most frequent and common types of harassment in the workplace. 

With 1 in 3 women ages 18 - 34 reporting that they have experienced workplace harassment, traditional training methods aren't working. 

With 6 different scenarios within "Define the Line" readers will be witnesses to harassment in varying levels of severity. Each scenario will show:

  • How we naturally respond to harassment (freeze up, ignore it, etc), 
  • How we can be confident and define the line when it's crossed, and
  • What co-workers (our greatest heroes) can do to help create workplaces that are safe and secure for everyone. 

Employees and harassers come in different shapes, sizes, and genders. We are working with Moriah Hummer the comic book artist for Flat Track Furies to create characters that showcase just how wonderfully diverse our workplaces are. 

Human Resource gurus, Nikki Larchar and Tina Todd, guide readers through the scenarios and provide best practice information throughout in order to help employees understand what next steps they should take.  

"Define the Line" will not only be a way to educate employees and employers but will also empower individuals to work together to create workplaces and organizations that are free from harassment. 

It was a dark and stormy night... Okay, it was a slightly above average Tuesday, and we were sipping on margaritas, because as some well-informed person on the internet somewhere once said, "no good story every started with having a salad."  

As the second round of margaritas made their way to our table, we began brainstorming about how we could make harassment training more interesting. And then, something fascinating happened. Stories of each of our own individual experiences with harassment started to emerge.  

Unsolicited storytelling started to happen EVERYWHERE. As we met with other business owners, community members, and friends, we began to hear their narratives. Their stories ranged in level of severity, but all had a common thread. There weren't any resources to help educate on what to DO if you're harassed or if you see someone else being harassed. 

And we were like... wait, WHAT?  

Being the HR nerds that we are, we began doing research. Like LOTS of research. And you know what we found out? There aren't very many studies on harassment training (interesting...). The few studies that have been done had some fascinating insights: 

And alas, the Comic Book idea was born! With so many tools and resources being offered in only a digital format, there is something magical about having a physical book. Something that you can flip through, that you can go back to as a reference, and that's different from the rest of the training, online modules, and videos that we are constantly bombarded with. Something you can refer to not only in a work setting but anywhere! ANY TIME!

story:
I Need to Comic Strip.

My name is Alexander Shen and I'm pretty avid comic strip drawer. I love comic strips and the fact I get to tell a story or joke in such a limited amount of space.

There are times when I have a great idea, but don't have anything to jot it down on. Sometimes the only piece of paper I have is the back of a ketchup stained receipt. Sometimes I don't have access to my tablet or I forgot my sketchbook at home because I was working on something non-comic related.

The Comic Strip Notepad gives you 50 pages of blank comic strip panels to keep at all the places (the office, your car, at school, wherever) so you're never without a place to draw comics.

Why $600?

No frills, my friends. It allows me to get enough notepads printed to keep costs down and to ship them to you.

What does the notepad look like?

Each Comic Strip Notepad offers:

  • 50 pages
  • The notepad measures 4.25" x 5.5"
  • 4 panels - each 2" x 1.75" (to be used horizontally or vertically)
  • 3 lines for writing down notes

Um... that's it?

That's all there is to it! Now a few more comic strips.

story:
Into the Breach

The ACOR asset recovery team is contracted to track down and recover invaluable data from a lost terraforming ship the Argo, that was bound for Saturn's moon, Titan.  Immediately after boarding, Logan, Sam, Nikki, Bjorn, Wil and their handler, Angelica quickly find themselves in a fight for their lives with a rival recovery firm and an unknown species of space-faring parasites quickly labeled "xeno-morphs" that have been feeding off the cargo.

Can Logan convince the rest of the team to work with their rivals long enough to fight off the xeno-morphs and finish the contract before the Argo meets its doom?

(Page 1)

(Page 4)

(Page 6)

(Promo art)

(Sample panels before color)

(Cover mock-up subject to change)

Why the Campaign?

The book is 95% complete. All pages are inked and lettered except for the last page and the cover. These two items are being done traditionally and offered as a Perk reward.  As I send pages to the colorist I will on occasion change up a panel or two.  A fantastic artist, KOHONOMOKO is slated to do the coloring and he needs to get paid, so this campaign is designed to cover that as well as the printing. Your backing will help bring this project to life and for that, I am very appreciative.

I have made the campaign a fixed goal in order to help me gauge interest in the story and let me know if folks might support the full story (The planned 120 page graphic novel).  The graphic novel is script complete and I will start on the art as soon as I get an idea if this campaign will succeed.

This project was started a while ago and I am excited to finally get it finished up and out to action sci-fi comic lovers everywhere.

Who Are You?

My name is Bruce and I've been in the art industry for a while. I self-published two comic titles back in the mid '80's. After the small press implosion, I had to move on. For the last 15 years I worked in the video game industry as a 3D artist and eventually found my way back to comics, the thing I enjoy the most.
"The Wreck" started years ago as a video game proposal and ended up as a comic script.  That's when I decide to bring it to the public with this campaign.  It's an action adventure, sci-fi romp that I am sure you will enjoy especially if you are a fan of "Aliens", Starship Troopers", or something a little more horror-centric like "Pandorum".

 

Any Help is Appreciated

Even though I have tried to keep the Tiers reasonable, I understand not everyone can contribute monetarily so if you like what I have to offer you can help by spreading the word. I am on Twitter, Instagram and Facebook, and Indiegogo has some great sharing tools.  Any help is greatly appreciated.

story:
The Dream

I have had a long time dream since 2008 of opening my very own comic book shop. But when I had my daughter, I thought that dream was over. After doing my research, I realized that dreams don't have to be shelved just because you're a parent. And I want to teach my daughter the same.

The Details

My goals of success for Kawaii & Comics are: 

  • To have reliable Product Distributors to be able to constantly keep the best (and affordable) items in stock and ready for clientele.
  • Create an environment that makes customers what to hang out at location.
  • Create in-store Events that will motivate community and additional streams of revenue: 
    • Themed Movie Nights
    • Video Game Championships
    • Comedy Showcases
    • Local Comic book Artist & Traditional Artist Exhibitions
    • Popular Artist Visits
    • Comic Convention Booths to sell inventory

The Business of it a Dream

A comic book store will likely cost between $40K+ in startup expenses.

This can vary.

  • 6 months rent and utilities
  • Full stock of comic book, anime, manga, and figurine inventory
  • Flat-screen televisions, projects screens, streaming memberships, gaming consoles and latest games
  • Bluetooth Sound System
  • Internet, WiFi, customer computer for in-store search
  • Security system
  • iPad Register

Other Ways You Can Help

  • SHARE, SHARE, SHARE... On all your social media
  • Donate what you can, when you can.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Thanks guys!

story:
Objective:

We are raising funds for the publication of the graphic novel adaptation of the feature film Barnone.

The money raised will go towards formatting the 125 page graphic novel for print. Printing costs and DVD mastering costs for the 3 films included.(Barnone, Waiting for Love and Lunch)

 

Barnone – The Movie

Synopsis:

This is the 1997 feature film about the life of 4 bartenders. This slice of life film explores the trials and tribulations of bartending life and it's many challenges and amusements.

Vimeo link:

http://vimeo.com/channels/41217/4280303

 

You can watch the film in chapters.

 

Barnone - The Graphic Novel

Synopsis;

This is a beautiful 125 page adaptation of the feature film. Like the film the graphic novel is produced in glorious black and white. Beautifully characterizing the films actors and situations.

Web-site link

http://barnonethemovie.com

 

Barnone – The People

Ramie Balbuena

Bio:

Ramie has been an artist all his life.  In the midst of his professional success in the field of marketing,  he dropped his hardware and pursued his movie making career to live up to the mission of  the prestigious film institute in Manila where he was one of its scholars.

In 2007, he wrote the story and script, created the storyboards, co-produced, directed, held the camera and edited his TV Series, “Olisi”.  The program was aired weekdays over INTV CCTN Channel Cebu for three months. Then, for three years he was involved with a New York Production company as the Executive Art Director.  He created most of the images of this production company and directed its official comicbook trailer.

His current activities are:

1. Producer, Writer and Illustrator of the eComicbook, “Argonus”

http://www.facebook.com/argonus.comicbook.  

2.  Producer, Scriptwriter and Director of  the upcoming indie movie, “Cacoy”, the  biography of  the living legend of “Eskrima”, Supreme Grandmaster Ciriaco Cañete of the Cacoy Doce Pares World Federation;

The samples of Ramie’s other works can be viewed at his website.

Website- link:

http://www.artsehub.com/

 

Mark Tuit

Bio:

Mark began making films at the age of 14 years old. His first feature film “Barnone” was an accumulation of bartending stories he experienced within the restaurant industry. The cult favorite went on to play film festivals world wide, a North American distribution deal, and garnered runner up for audience favorite at the 97, VIFF.

Over the next several years Mark has written, produced and directed 7 feature films, including “Subhuman” starring Earl Pastko (Highway 61, Land of the Dead). The VFX heavy “Blood: A Butcher’s Tale” starring Aaron Douglas (Battlestar Galactica, The Bridge), Mark has just recently completed the 3-D animated family feature “Bunny Tales”.

Mark has instructed various aspects of film production in Vancouver, at such institutions at Gastown Actors studio, CDIS, New Image of Fine Arts and Columbia Academy, where he was part owner in the school.

Mark was also CEO of the Vancouver based film studio Pacific Gold Entertainment for three years, where he oversaw $12 million worth of production. He has recently opened up his own production shingle Red Ronin Media, where he in post-production with the black comedy feature “Scratch” and in Pre-production with the 3-D, science fiction feature “Modified”.

Website- link

http://marktuit.com/

 

Barnone – The Perks

Perks for your contribution.

$5. Link to full movie and Thank you on our sponsorship page on the Barnone web-site

$10. Digital PDF of Graphic Novel and link to full movie.

$25. Signed Graphic Novel/ DVD Bundle/ Name on the “Thank You” page of the Graphic Novel

$50. Signed Graphic Novel/ DVD Bundle/ Name on the “Thank You” page of the Graphic Novel/ Tee-shirt

$75. Signed Graphic Novel/ DVD Bundle/ Name on the “Thank You” page of the Graphic Novel/ Tee Shirt / Signed Poster (Fill size)

$100 Signed Graphic Novel/ DVD Bundle / Name on the “Thank You” page of the Graphic Novel / Tee Shirt / Signed Poster (Fill size)/ Barnone baseball cap.

Use of Funds

-Lettering

-Formatting for print.

-Printing.

-DVD mastering of films.

-Directors commentary on all films.

Packaging.

Merchandise.

 

Visit our facebook page.

http://www.facebook.com/barnonethemovie

story:
Our Story:  is full of action, thriller and suspense. Its a perfect example of how the good wins over the Evil. 

What are you backing?

 

  • This is a 55 page one shot comic.
  • Superhero genre
  • Young and Teen Readers

Preview: 

 

 

Aniruddha Creator/Story

Born in New Delhi, India. He owns and operates Bishop Publishing. Creator or co-creator of comics such as Free men, Knights watch, Knights commander, Night is full of terrors. 

Arjan Jain - Artist

I'm a Comic book artist from a small town Gurgaon, India. I have beenA fasn of superhero Comics since I was 4. My career began with Reliance entertainment where i did many titles.  I am known for my high tech superhero art also for beautiful action scenes. I have won the best sketcher award for Knights Commander. I am now working with Bishop Publishing and other indie publishers from around the world.

story:
Hey!

I am an artist and writer and I have decided to put together and publish a graphic novel of my own short stories and I need your help! I was fist published in comics at the age of 14 and over the years I have worked on many cool projects  including an illustrated story for Heavy Metal Magazine which I will include in this book! To let you know a little more about me I have also done design and illustration work for games, film and television working on some fantastic projects such as Through The Worm Hole With Morgan Freeman, Tugger The Ship and the game Dungeon Crawler. I have even wrote and directed a short film about a shape shifter called "Shifter"

This awesome new graphic novel will showcase some of my coolest sci-fi and fantasy work! THE BOOK will feature 12 short stories, ranging from 1 or 2 pages to 20, and as mentioned will include my Cyberpunk story "The Living City" published by Heavy Metal Magazine. We are hoping to have the book out and in print by March 2016 but are hoping for an earlier release date if all things go well.

To the right I have some wonderful incentives for you to look over as you consider helping make this awesome publication a reality. I still have some work to do to complete The Book but most of the $5,000.00 in funds will go to the printing costs, a portion of it will also go to my very good friend and team member, Rene Vriends who is helping with lettering, scanning original pages and other odds and ends to help the production go more smoothly. THE BOOK will be 60 plus pages, full colour, square bound and beautiful! Here is your chance to become a part of its creation!

Please and thank you,

George Todorovski


Here below are pages from the graphic novel anthology...

THE BOOK


This is a page from one of the shorter stories in The Book which still needs to be lettered.

A few pages from the story "A Ghost In Time" one of the longer stories in The Book

- Guided by a Guru, Becky travels through time and space to confront an unknown evil in her life to bring it to light.






Before The Smoke

A page from a short story I am currently working on for THE BOOK about Giomo - a leader of his people seeking wisdom from Kima - a wise mystic, on how to deal with a threat that may lead to war. 

Another piece for THE BOOK


Here below are three pages from "The Living City" a Cyberpunk story I did that was published by Heavy Metal Magazine which will be re-published in this graphic novel!


Inking a cover I drew for issue #6 of the awesome comic Black Hole Hunters Club!
When drawing straight in ink nothing is ever lost in the translation. I have used this technique while working on comics from time to time. Three of the shorter stories in The Book were created this way.

Below are two images for the signed print perks.

"In The Woods"

"At The Gate"

story:
Hi there. My name is Gareth Gaudin and I am a cartoonist in Victoria, BC Canada and I've worked in a comic book store for 25 years. Three days ago, a woman came into my shop with the most beautiful copy of Amazing Fantasy #15 that I've ever seen. It's the iconic first appearance of Spider-Man from 1962, and, after the first appearances of Superman and Batman, pretty much the most sought-after comic book around.


She had heard that copies had sold for ridiculous amounts of money (like a million dollars) and asked me if I'd be interested in selling it for her. What could I say? I'd TRY. You really want a million Canadian Dollars for it? Yes. She had bought it as a teenager in the eighties for under five hundred dollars and it seems that now was the time to set it free. My first step (there was not much I could do while she was standing in front of me with it) was putting a photo on Instagram, asking if anybody had an extra five hundred thousand dollars on hand. She said "No, ask a MILLION" (I put half a million). It's a crazy amount of money either way.

 

Within hours, I got a call from a reporter named Lauren Boothby (from a local newspaper called Victoria News) who came down to do a piece on it: http://www.vicnews.com/news/rare-1-million-firs...

First thing the next morning, however, my phone started really ringing! I had four film crews at my shop by mid afternoon and by the end of the day I'd been interviewed seven times. CTV in Toronto had me live on the evening news, The CBC had cameras on me for television and had me into the studio for a radio interview. CHEK Six News was even there. (EDIT: One week in, and I've been interviewed 17 times now).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bq_LvPaIgtM

The mini media circus continued this morning, as I was on CFAX Radio, Global TV from Vancouver, and Newstalk 1010 in Toronto.  More calls are still coming in!

With all of this talk about the comic and what could be done with it, the suggestion came to me that perhaps if I had one million people chip in $1.00 each, I could buy the book off of the owner for the amount she wants and then simply offer it to the Royal BC Museum, an art gallery, or a continuing series of art galleries and museums across Canada and the US to showcase. Who wouldn't want to see this Pop Art masterpiece in person?

It's not seriously worth a million dollars, right? No, probably not (at least not YET). It's in Fine/Very Fine condition which, according to all realistic comic book retail knowledge, should be maybe in the $100,000.00 region perhaps? But c'mon... These comics HAVE SOLD for over a million dollars in recent years and it's that price point that not only brought it into my store but also brought the weight of the entire region's media into my shop.

It's a good story and it's a great comic.

I don't really want to send it off to CGC to get professionally graded if I don't have to. Slabbing it in plastic is what I'd do if I were simply to sell it to the highest bidder and make a real commodity out of it. I do, however, want to raise the money myself and buy it from its owner and put it on permanent public display. A difficult task? Probably! But I'm game to give it a try.

I've been one of the Artists In Residence at The Royal British Columbia Museum for the past few years, I've worked for the Art Gallery Of Greater Victoria, and I'm good friends with the owners and operators of the National Toy Museum Of Canada. These are the first few local places at which I'd want to begin showing the comic but just imagine the adventure of taking the book out on the road! Sending gig posters ahead and driving across Canada with it and having it arrive at small town libraries and book reading events? There would be fears of thieves, bandits, highway robberies, and muggings! It could be its own rock band! But I digress...

I see this as equal to an Andy Warhol print. Its iconic Jack Kirby and Steve Ditko cover would surely be a draw for a small town gallery, right? Everyone knows Stan Lee, right? We might even get a new generation of kids into art galleries. So, without much forethought or regard for a Plan B, I put a PayPal link on my Facebook page with my idea. Four hours later, I'm deep into it. People are throwing money at this project already.

So, my plan as of now (and, keep in mind I'm an artist and I can surely change direction as whims decree) is to see how much I can raise towards purchasing this book. Just because she WANTS a million dollars doesn't mean I can't try for less... Perhaps she'll accept an offer. What is it REALLY worth? It's worth making an art project out of all this free publicity I think.

If we don't raise enough to buy THIS copy, I'll just buy a different copy that costs the amount we DO raise. Whatever the total funds donated come to, I will purchase an Amazing Fantasy #15 and make it available for permanent public display. Each of those who donate will have their names etched into a book about the experience.

All these donations are in Canadian Dollars by the way, which makes this comic sound way more expensive than it really is.

This could be fun.

But this is the goal: Raising enough money to buy a museum quality edition of the first Spider-Man comic and making it available to the public forever. Easy.

Thanks for reading!

Gareth Gaudin

Victoria, British Columbia
story_txt: Hi there. My name is Gareth Gaudin and I am a cartoonist in Victoria, BC Canada and I've worked in a comic book store for 25 years. Three days ago, a woman came into my shop with the most beautiful copy of Amazing Fantasy #15 that I've ever seen. It's the iconic first appearance of Spider-Man from 1962, and, after the first appearances of Superman and Batman, pretty much the most sought-after comic book around.She had heard that copies had sold for ridiculous amounts of money (like a million dollars) and asked me if I'd be interested in selling it for her. What could I say? I'd TRY. You really want a million Canadian Dollars for it? Yes. She had bought it as a teenager in the eighties for under five hundred dollars and it seems that now was the time to set it free. My first step (there was not much I could do while she was standing in front of me with it) was putting a photo on Instagram, asking if anybody had an extra five hundred thousand dollars on hand. She said "No, ask a MILLION" (I put half a million). It's a crazy amount of money either way. Within hours, I got a call from a reporter named Lauren Boothby (from a local newspaper called Victoria News) who came down to do a piece on it: http://www.vicnews.com/news/rare-1-million-firs...First thing the next morning, however, my phone started really ringing! I had four film crews at my shop by mid afternoon and by the end of the day I'd been interviewed seven times. CTV in Toronto had me live on the evening news, The CBC had cameras on me for television and had me into the studio for a radio interview. CHEK Six News was even there. (EDIT: One week in, and I've been interviewed 17 times now).https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bq_LvPaIgtMThe mini media circus continued this morning, as I was on CFAX Radio, Global TV from Vancouver, and Newstalk 1010 in Toronto.  More calls are still coming in!With all of this talk about the comic and what could be done with it, the suggestion came to me that perhaps if I had one million people chip in $1.00 each, I could buy the book off of the owner for the amount she wants and then simply offer it to the Royal BC Museum, an art gallery, or a continuing series of art galleries and museums across Canada and the US to showcase. Who wouldn't want to see this Pop Art masterpiece in person?It's not seriously worth a million dollars, right? No, probably not (at least not YET). It's in Fine/Very Fine condition which, according to all realistic comic book retail knowledge, should be maybe in the $100,000.00 region perhaps? But c'mon... These comics HAVE SOLD for over a million dollars in recent years and it's that price point that not only brought it into my store but also brought the weight of the entire region's media into my shop.It's a good story and it's a great comic.I don't really want to send it off to CGC to get professionally graded if I don't have to. Slabbing it in plastic is what I'd do if I were simply to sell it to the highest bidder and make a real commodity out of it. I do, however, want to raise the money myself and buy it from its owner and put it on permanent public display. A difficult task? Probably! But I'm game to give it a try.I've been one of the Artists In Residence at The Royal British Columbia Museum for the past few years, I've worked for the Art Gallery Of Greater Victoria, and I'm good friends with the owners and operators of the National Toy Museum Of Canada. These are the first few local places at which I'd want to begin showing the comic but just imagine the adventure of taking the book out on the road! Sending gig posters ahead and driving across Canada with it and having it arrive at small town libraries and book reading events? There would be fears of thieves, bandits, highway robberies, and muggings! It could be its own rock band! But I digress...I see this as equal to an Andy Warhol print. Its iconic Jack Kirby and Steve Ditko cover would surely be a draw for a small town gallery, right? Everyone knows Stan Lee, right? We might even get a new generation of kids into art galleries. So, without much forethought or regard for a Plan B, I put a PayPal link on my Facebook page with my idea. Four hours later, I'm deep into it. People are throwing money at this project already.So, my plan as of now (and, keep in mind I'm an artist and I can surely change direction as whims decree) is to see how much I can raise towards purchasing this book. Just because she WANTS a million dollars doesn't mean I can't try for less... Perhaps she'll accept an offer. What is it REALLY worth? It's worth making an art project out of all this free publicity I think.If we don't raise enough to buy THIS copy, I'll just buy a different copy that costs the amount we DO raise. Whatever the total funds donated come to, I will purchase an Amazing Fantasy #15 and make it available for permanent public display. Each of those who donate will have their names etched into a book about the experience.All these donations are in Canadian Dollars by the way, which makes this comic sound way more expensive than it really is.This could be fun.But this is the goal: Raising enough money to buy a museum quality edition of the first Spider-Man comic and making it available to the public forever. Easy.Thanks for reading!Gareth GaudinVictoria, British Columbia

story:
Welcome to the world of Venus as a Boy. Where the Roman empire never fell and the great Gods rule Olympias. But this world is no different then our own, the people are just as obsessed with social media and celebrities just as ever! So it's no guess that the Gods themselves take just as much interest and amusement in the lives of humans.

In Venus as a Boy we follow the adventure of a group of fangirls after they get mixed up in the kidnapping of two very famous celebrates. But they have the deal with more then just evil fangirls as they get mixed up in a far more larger plot being pulled by the Gods and gain control of magical jewels.


Venus as a Boy is a serial comic with at the moment 15 issues planned. But of course that can change as I flesh out the story. In the mean time I want to start off with the print of the first issue! Lost at Sea. A 16 page comic (+ covers and fun stuff) that will introduce everyone to most of the characters and begin their journey. If this fundrasier is successful I will then start another to print the second issue!

 This story is one that's been growing in my head for quite a while. After I found a style that suited the writing style I began working on it digitally. It would be a great accomplishment to get the whole series completed and published!

Aside from sending the book out to all these who help fund the book here on kickstarter, I will also sell the extra books at conventions. I'm also lucky enough to live in a large city of New York which is an active hub of comics. I also plan on physically visiting comic shops throughout the city to directly sell copies to be put on shelves! By selling these comics I not only fund the rest of the series, but my artistic/comic career in general!

It may seen like a lot to ask but 90% of the funds from my goal amount is going to be used to send the comic for print. The other 10% goes to making your rewards and shipping cost. My only payment for all the hard work I have put into this project is what ever I make later on from sales of the printed comic.

Even if you cannot donate spreading the word also helps! Share this page, the facebook page or the video! Thanks!

For a simple $2 donation you get a 2.5 tall high gloss sticker of Zoie!

 For $5 you get the comic itself! This includes the shipping cost (within USA)

 For $7 you get the comic AND the high gloss Zoie sticker (shipping included)

 For $10 you get the book, sticker AND a plastic framed dragon keychain.

 $12 Gets you the comic, keychain, Zoie sticker AND larger sticker of Zoie and the Celebrities.

 $20 Gets you the comic AND a 11x17 high gloss poster of the cover art (no keychain or stickers in this set).

 $25 Gets you the comic, poster, Zoie sticker and keychain

 $30 Gets you everything + a personalized autograph by me, the creator.
(To _____, with message)

 $35 Gets you everything PLUS a personalized doodle in the inside cover in the Venus style. (black and white made with sharpie)

 $50 Gets you everything PLUS a high res digital drawing emailed to you in the Venus style! Drawing will be of ONE subject.

 For an extra $25 get that image made into a high gloss poser!

 The best reward for the most help! Get a whole page of comic art done of you! Just send a simple script/layout and I will make a comic page in the Venus style for you! This will be sent digitally in a high res file.

Q&A

Q: That name Toby Markham sounds familiar.
A: Toby is a real person, a bit of a internet personality. Even before I made this comic I asked him if he wanted to be a main character. In my comic world he is a famous actor. In real like he is a cosplayer who makes movie characters come to life.

Q: What happens if you don't meet the goal
A: I wont keep any money and I will be very sad

Q: What if you make 200% of your goal?
A: Then I would also send to print issue number two as it should be done buy the time thus fund raiser is over. It wont be pocketed but rather drive this project even further!

story:
The Crying Man appeared when the sun began to set. 

He was carrying something

At first, when he was still far, it looked like wet clothes, salvaged from a ship-wreck. 

The waves washed him ashore, and when he was close enough to stand and start walking, the thing he carried looked like a huge fish, its scales red in the sunlight, turning everything around them into ground meat. 

But then again, looking more closely, it couldn’t have been a fish- who could catch a monster like that without a boat, or a fishing-rod?

Avram stood and waited, watching with care. 


Synopsis

Andromeda sleeps is a graphic novel about the lives of 3 wrecked men, each dealing with his own emotional trauma, and the ways their lives change when a sleeping child comes out of the sea. 

It's a story about survival, recovery and reconciliation, taking place in a timeless urban surroundings.  


This Project

During the last couple of years I have illustrated and published several books, some written by me and some by others, for indie publication and for big publication houses in Israel. I take big proud in each and every one of these books. But for me, none of them is anything like "Andromeda sleeps".

"Andromeda sleeps" started as my final project in "Minshar for art" college and was then improved & finalised, self-published & distributed in Israel. It is based on a short story by the good friend and great writer Shachar Galek, whom has been my duo in artistic projects for the last 9 years.

This project's goal was set based solely on the translation and production's costs. I'm well aware of how high it is, but sadly - printing a 172 pages book costs a lot, and the projects' goal amount should be just enough to do that.

For me, spreading the book across seas will be a dream come true. It's about sharing my most primary and intimate works with the world, giving them independence and reaching new audiences that might feel connection and get inspired by what i've created. 


(Click here to see Aharon's story in Words Without Borders' February 2014 issue)


The Book

The book will be a hard cover ~180 full colored lacquered pages.

The project's funding will cover translation fee and printing costs. 

Since the original (Hebrew) version has already covered the time invested on planning, sketching, drawing, sawing, painting, cutting, pasting and computer-processing, the only thing left is to translate and assimilate the translated text into the spreads. 

That also means that the book should be shipped very soon after the project's funding phase ends.


What can you get?

Other than helping spread the rumor, investing in the project entitles you to great perks:

1 USD - a token of your appreciation, that will entitle you for project's updates and a thank-you Email.

For 5 USD, you can get a thank you post-card, sent by mail to your home, that will be a proof for your early support in the book.

For 45 USD (or 40 USD, for the first 50 backers), you can have your very own copy of the book, sent to anywhere in the world, as soon as it is ready!

For 50 USD, you can have the Hebrew version of the book. This way, I can exchange Hebrew copies with English ones.

100$ entitles you a limited edition (100 copies), numbered and signed copy of the graphic novel, AND your name will be added to the credits page in the book. 

For 200$ you'll get the 100$ perk, and an original sketch of one of the characters of your choosing!

And for 2,000$ you'll get the signed limited edition and one of the original illustrations from the book! Be aware - the originals are different from what you see in the book, since it's not computer processed, for better and worse. 


One more Perk you can't see in the perks list on the right

Please spread the rumor!

Each share of theis page by Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or any other way, will make me one bit happier! You've read right - paying NOTHING at all, you can contribute to the making of the book!  Ain't that a great perk?!



The creator

That's me.


If you're interested in my work, you are invited to contact me for any question or comment, either via Email or through Facebook

story:
WHAT IS KUZIMU?

Kuzimu is a horror comic book about the realm of the dead and the consequences of a single life across time. Once a Maasai shaman, Pt'eros must face the truth of his existence to find peace and escape the afterlife. It is a dream-like book filled with interpretive visuals, symbolism and fantastically weird beings.

It was first self-published as a webcomic, then as the first independent comic published through Graphicly's digital platform. Now this year it is being released as 194-page full colour graphic novel (paperback) by indie publisher 215 Ink, in stores and at Baltimore/New York Comic Con.

I am looking to raise $1750 for travel to and accommodation in New York for Saturday 13th and Sunday 14th October.

 

WHY I NEED YOUR HELP

I have 3 other Kuzimu Graphic Novels planned and would love to have the full story see the light of day. Naturally, this depends on not only sales of the book but also awareness of it. If there is a perfect place to do this, it is at Comic Con, where I can turn the press, fans and comics professionals onto my work.

Getting a comic to this stage largely on my own has taken a toll on personal finances, relationships and my health to a degree. It is make or break time to take it to a higher level.

I need some help to raise the money to get me and my pencils to the next step toward a career in comics.

 

GREAT AND PRECIOUS THINGS FOR YOUR SUPPORT

This book has been a personal journey for me. Having created the main characters at 15 and then developing the book for the last six years, this will be the culmination of about half my life.

Because this means so much, I promise to repay each contribution in some personalised way.

All funders will be mentioned in the next issue of Kuzimu (no 8), which is scripted and should be ready for release Winter 2012/13. Mid level perks get you a signed copy of the book 'Kuzimu Volume 1' with a personal message from me (you can ask for something specific). Higher level perks get you a unique inked or coloured sketch of any character you like (as specific as you please, it is up to you).

The most precious thing I can offer at the highest levels of funding is a piece of original inked artwork from my book. Every page is like a baby to me, but getting the work out there is so much more important!

 

SPECIAL OFFER FOR COMIC CON ATTENDEES (AT 215 INK'S BOOTH 2279):

As the event itself is the goal of this campaign, if you're going to New York I can do something a little extra for you.

Each mid to high-level perk contains the option to have it shipped to you, or to collect it from me personally on Saturday 13th/Sunday 14th October from my publisher 215 Ink's booth (number above). You can even let me know whether you want me pre-prepare it or if you want me sign your book etc. and draw your sketch on the day!

Two of the basic mid-level perks are specifically set up for this. One is cheaper to allow for collection at the con and the other adds international shipping. all higher level perks allow for shipping.

 

ANY HELP YOU CAN GIVE IS VITAL

It's a tough time and a tough world out there. I understand that you might not have money to give. But you can still help me if you believe in my work. Please help spread the world on Twitter, Facebook, your blog or anywhere your friends are via a direct link or the share buttons.

If you're not convinced, here's some kind words said about the book:

'Kuzimu isn’t quite like any comic I’ve come across before.' - Comics Bulletin

'The experience of reading an epic such as Kuzimu changes you a little...

Brett has opened my eyes to a different type of storytelling.' - Randy Haldeman, This isn't Work

'A cool looking comic' - Jeff Lemire

If you want to know more, please visit - www.kuzimu.co.uk

Or you can check here for updates - @kuzimu - Kuzimu Comic (Facebook) - Kuzimu (Tumblr) - Brett Uren (Google +) - Brett Uren (Youtube)

story:
О чем эта история?

Девушка и собор - это не сухой пересказ истории. Скорее, в духе Маленького принца, это необыкновенная история маленькой девочки с островом на Сене. Там она начинает сад, но не сад цветов. Это будет сад людей, говорит она: Париж. 

В центре своего сада маленькая девочка сажает свое величайшее сокровище из всех: Нотр-Дам де Пари. Она смотрит, как небеса достигают через окна собора. Она задается вопросом, как люди в ее саду изменяются через королевства и империи и революции. Она плачет, как война разрушает и горит. За 850 лет истории ее сад меняется - как и должны люди. И через все это ее самый любимый цветок, Нотр-Дам, решительно предлагает божественное утешение и свет, и маленькая девочка узнает много о жизни, свободе, любви, потере и славе новых начинаний. Это история о Нотр-Дам, но гораздо глубже, это история обо всем, за что стоял Нотр-Дам. 

Built into the front cover are a series of stained glass windows (made with printed clear plastic). Hold the book up to the light, and each window glows!

Introduces children to famous figures

Astute readers will find references to famous Parisians who changed the world. You'll spot:

  • Famous thinkers and scientists like Madam Curie
  • Artists, writers, and musicians like Debussy, Ravel, Monet, Jules Verne, and Victor Hugo
  • The first hot air balloon flight!

Basic Book Packages

 

Deluxe Gift Packages ($65-85)

Includes:

  • Your name included in the Book Angels section of the book
  • Your gift message, printed and enveloped with a fleur de lis wax seal
  • 1 beautifully hand-wrapped copy of The Girl and the Cathedral 
  • Set of six 8" x 8" prints (frames not included) featuring the architecture of Notre Dame
  • One 8" x 10" print (frame not included) of vintage Paris city map
  • A handmade, limestone-finished gargoyle magnet patterned after one of Notre Dame's most famous gargoyles
  • 1 "Shine On" Notre Dame commemorative vinyl cling
  • 1 book donated to kids in need

Exclusive Honors

Put Me in the Story ($1000):

  • A likeness of your child illustrated in one of the scenes in the book!
  • Your name included in the Book Angels section of the book
  • 10 hardcover copies (plenty to share with friends and family ;)
  • 10 books donated to kids in need
  • PLUS, pick any one of the Deluxe Gift Packages above

Why we created this book and how we're giving back

For more than 850 years, Notre Dame brought a piece of heaven to her island on the Seine. Her people loved her. She loved her people. Her song rang across the city and across the years, bells mingled with mystery through the ups and downs of joy, war, suffering, prosperity, and happiness. Her story spans the ages of kings, emperors, presidents, revolution, and change. 

And then, like most of the world, we were stunned as we watched flames erupt through her roof. Like the light that pours through her windows, we had come to believe she would always be there—a beacon of hope and inspiration, a quiet touch of the divine in the midst of the world's clamor.

We are grateful to know that Notre Dame will always be there, due in large part to the generosity of the world and those that love her. 

While that reconstruction goes on, we wish to offer a tribute of our own—a story of hope and love, of life and rebirth. In this book, through illustration and prose, we pay homage to the grand story of Notre Dame—who she is, how she was, and what she has come to mean to millions the world over for 850 years. And in the spirit of giving back, we pledge that for every book sold, we will donate a book to kids in need—book for book. 

Risks and challenges

The illustrations are mostly finished and the manuscript is in editing. For publishing, we're partnered with Bushel & Peck Books, a children's publishing company. Their team has published hundreds of books in the course of their publishing career, including several with complex engineering (such as this one!). Their experience means the risks to this project are very minimal.
story_txt:
О чем эта история?Девушка и собор - это не сухой пересказ истории. Скорее, в духе Маленького принца, это необыкновенная история маленькой девочки с островом на Сене. Там она начинает сад, но не сад цветов. Это будет сад людей, говорит она: Париж. В центре своего сада маленькая девочка сажает свое величайшее сокровище из всех: Нотр-Дам де Пари. Она смотрит, как небеса достигают через окна собора. Она задается вопросом, как люди в ее саду изменяются через королевства и империи и революции. Она плачет, как война разрушает и горит. За 850 лет истории ее сад меняется - как и должны люди. И через все это ее самый любимый цветок, Нотр-Дам, решительно предлагает божественное утешение и свет, и маленькая девочка узнает много о жизни, свободе, любви, потере и славе новых начинаний. Это история о Нотр-Дам, но гораздо глубже, это история обо всем, за что стоял Нотр-Дам. Built into the front cover are a series of stained glass windows (made with printed clear plastic). Hold the book up to the light, and each window glows!Introduces children to famous figuresAstute readers will find references to famous Parisians who changed the world. You'll spot:
Famous thinkers and scientists like Madam Curie
Artists, writers, and musicians like Debussy, Ravel, Monet, Jules Verne, and Victor Hugo
The first hot air balloon flight!
Basic Book Packages Deluxe Gift Packages ($65-85)Includes:
Your name included in the Book Angels section of the book
Your gift message, printed and enveloped with a fleur de lis wax seal
1 beautifully hand-wrapped copy of The Girl and the Cathedral 
Set of six 8" x 8" prints (frames not included) featuring the architecture of Notre Dame
One 8" x 10" print (frame not included) of vintage Paris city map
A handmade, limestone-finished gargoyle magnet patterned after one of Notre Dame's most famous gargoyles
1 "Shine On" Notre Dame commemorative vinyl cling
1 book donated to kids in need
Exclusive HonorsPut Me in the Story ($1000):
A likeness of your child illustrated in one of the scenes in the book!
Your name included in the Book Angels section of the book
10 hardcover copies (plenty to share with friends and family ;)
10 books donated to kids in need
PLUS, pick any one of the Deluxe Gift Packages above

story:
DANNY AND HARRY PRIVATE DETECTIVES: THE CASE OF THE MISSING TRUNK is a digital series published Markosia and available on Comixology and DriveThru Comics.

Issues #1-#4 of 6 have been published.

Back this campaign and we finish the series by publishing issues #5 and #6.

What do you get? The complete graphic novel, 144 pages, which includes everything that was in #1-#4, and everything in #5-#6. Digital only for this campaign. (There will be a print version, but not through this campaign.)

Just $4,00. (Typically the retail would be $7.00 or more. And print? Probably $18.00.)

So, a deal for sure.

Want a taste of Danny and Harry, no charge? Go here and get the free 10-page complete black-and-white story, "Set up for a Fall." This story will not be included in the "Trunk" graphic novel. But, so what? It's free, here: https://www.subscribepage.com/z8b8t3

The stories are hard-boiled crime.

The characters are animals. Literally. And figuratively.

You might kill for the missing trunk--but would you die for it?

Who are we? Walter Brogan and Charles Santino.

We've been around the block a few times. We've got a few battle scars. But, folks, there's no substitute for experience.

Walter Brogan (story, line art, and color) has contributed to Cracked magazine, Marvel’s Crazy magazine, and has drawn storyboards for J Walter Thompson and other leading agencies.

Charles Santino (story and script) is best known his adaptations of Louis L’Amour, Edgar Rice Burroughs (for the web comic site), and his original Conan stories for Marvel.

Some guy named Kurt Hathaway is doing the lettering. And doing a damn fine job of it.

OK.

Now it's your move.

Thanks.

-- The Management

story:
The world is ruled by majors. The biggest and most powerful of them, StripTemple Inc., which is born as a nightclub
franchise, trains its dancers as professional killers. Agent and pole dancer Kelly V. is on the road to dismantle a rebel
organization. Dancing to the tunes of famous songs, Kelly carries out her job hiding the ruthless assassin behind her
voluptuous body.

StripTemple is a full-colour 96 page graphic novel made of action, adventure and tons of music. It's the first "musical-action" graphic novel which came to light thanks to authors' musical passions: Pop for Emilio Pilliu (artist) and Rock for Fabio Jtp Corrirossi (author).

-What we ask and what you'll get-

We ask for a minimum amount of money to make our work possible and to print it (check the perks list).
So help us realize our project, let its deep story and music draw you into it.

Help us to make the world of StripTemple possible, a world where musical notes will set you free for real!
Thanks for your attention, we hope we've intrigued you!

 

 

Regards from Emilio Pilliu and Fabio Jtp Corrirossi!

 

 

ILLUSTRATION UPDATE: Enjoy Kelly and her P.R.!

 

UPDATE! Here's the Track 01 pilot issue. ENJOY!

story:
Monsters, ghosts, and murderers, oh my! You will find all that and more in the Skin Crawling Comics Anthology. From giant cockroaches, to vampire-victim support groups, to killer garden gnomes, Skin Crawling Comics offers tales of the grotesque and the macabre to give the readers a unique taste of terror.

"Hunger", artist Sarah Elkins. See Perks. 

Skin Crawling Comics is a 180 page, color horror anthology comic book that draws inspiration from the spooky storytelling styles of classics like Creepy, Eerie, and Tales from the Crypt. Skin Crawling Comics will appropriate for readers ages 16 and up.

Skin Crawling Comics is designed with the creepy in mind and rejects the idea of "splatter porn" as a substitute for storytelling. This doesn't mean we don't get gruesome, just that we do so with a purpose.

 

"F.V.K.", artist Sha-Nee Williams. See Perks.

What We Need & What You Get

All of the work required to create Skin Crawling Comics is already complete. We just need an infusion of capital to actually print and manufacture the finished product. Our goal is to raise $18,000 to make Skin Crawling Comics a reality. The costs break down to:          

1) Printing = $6,000

2) Shipping = $10 - $25 per book, depending on the destination. Overseas shipping is available.

3) Costs of Perks = $2,500

4) Cushion = IndieGoGo takes a 4% commission, and expenses tend to increase unexpectedly, so we're building a safety net into the campaign itself.

5) Page Rate for Contributors = Paying the artists for their contributions. If we meet our goal, not only do the pledgers get a wonderful book but the 40 creators who made Skin Crawling possible get a very modest page rate for their hard work.

 

What if the Artist or Podcast Perks Run Out?

IndieGoGo will only allow 20 active perks. As soon as one sells out another will rise up like a zombie horde. 

                                  

"Wesley", artist Aaron Hazouri. To get in on the zombie action see the Return of the Living Dead perk or the Retailer perk.

 

Stretch Goals

If we surpass our goal then eveyone that pledged enough to receive a physical copy of the book (or more) will be automatically eligible for extras if the following funding levels are reached:

  • $30,000 = A signed, original print by artist Alex Sauvik, created specifially for Skin Crawling.
  • $50,000 = A limited, hardcover edition of Skin Crawling Comics, available only through the IndieGoGo campaign.

 

Make an Impact

In order to get published one has to be published. Confusing, I know, but Skin Crawling hopes to help out 40 creators with that problem. Skin Crawling Comics not only brings back spooky storytelling, it works as a portfolio piece for the creators involved. 

Please click on the contributor's name to see some of their works.

WRITERS

Rachel Pandich 

Gerald Rathkolb

Adam Wollet

Paul Chapman

Heather Royston

Jeremy W. Kaufmann

Geoffrey D. Wessel      

Sabrina James Riley

Lauren Burke 

Jody Houser

Thomas Pandich

Christine Brunson

Tatiana Christian

James Greene

Scott Ziolko

Bryant Dillon

Carl Boehm

Greg Sorkin

                                                                                               Adam Wollet

                                                                                               Peggy von Burkleo

"Hoard". artist Ashley Lanni-Hoye. See Perks.

 

ARTISTS

  • Edmund Dansart
  • Nick Valente
  • Kate Carleton
  • Cliff Green
  • Sarah Elkins
  • Sha-Nee Williams
  • Jenay Gordon
  • Sherri Rose
  • Ashley Lanni-Hoye
  • Josh Hoye
  • Aaron Hazouri
  • James Greene
  • Laura M Bearl               
  • Scott Ziolko
  • Chris Thorne
  • Star St. Germain
  • Anissa Espinosa          

LETTERS

  • Adam Wollet
  • Various artists that lettered their own stories (lots of talent!)

COLORISTS 

  • Joaquin Ezequil Pereyra
  • Jesse Campbell
  • Christine Brunson
  • Various artists that colored their own stories.

 Sharing is Caring

If you dig the idea of Skin Crawling, then please spread the word about it on your social media sites.  Every Tweet, Tumblr post, Facebook share, etc. makes a difference.  

"The Borley Reports", artist Anissa Espinosa.

 

Thank you Josh Rudloff for putting together the Skin Crawling video.

story:
Short Summary

Esther is speaking vibrationally. But Esther is not Esther. Abraham (non-physical entities of infinite intelligence) are speaking through Esther. Then there's her husband, Jerry, who also has something to say.

For one week only, they'll help you be on the 'leading edge', 'vibrate' and 'get into the vortex'!

Are you ready to listen? Then let the manifestation begin!

This outrageous show is a satirical send up of the original Law of Attraction gurus, Esther and Jerry Hicks. 

'Absurd, unpredictable and utterly hilarious! ★★★★'  Arts Review
'Kyle Walmsley was hysterically funny' Australian Stage
'Claire Pearson is comedic gold!' SYNfm 

Directed by Elizabeth Millington

Featuring: Claire Pearson & Kyle Walmsley

Created by Claire Pearson

What We Need & What You Get

Valuable fund will go towards Jerry & Esther's venue costs, registration, rehearsal fees and registration to be part of Melbourne International Comedy Festival.

Be on the leading edge and for a small donation, you too can be part of the magic!

 

$5 - A personal thank you and shoutout on social media from Esther or Jerry

$10 - A personal thank you and shout out on social media from Esther and Jerry + your own personal affirmation for the day!

$20 - A personal thank you and shout out on social media from Esther and Jerry + your own personal affirmation for the day + you're allowed to ask Esther and Jerry a question about what you would like manifested in your life!

$50 - A personal thank you and shout out on social media from Esther and Jerry + your own personal affirmation for the day + you're allowed to as Esther and Jerry a question about what you would like to manifest in your life + 2 Golden Vibrational seats for a performance of your choice!

$100 -   personal thank you and shout out on social media from Esther and Jerry + your own personal affirmation for the day + you're allowed to as Esther and Jerry a question about what you would like to manifest in your life + 2 Golden Vibrational seats for a performance of your choice + a signed copy of Book and CD "Getting into the vortex" given to you on your night of attendance!

story:
Shark of War

It's Jaws Meets Robocop

 

Read Issue 1 For FREE - CLICK HERE 

For fifty years, we've had dozens of shark stories. One was great, a few were good, most were mediocre to bad. But they all had one thing in common, the shark was the monster. The creature for the human heroes to defeat. What makes Shark of War different is that there is never any doubt who the hero of this story is - it's the shark. Whether he's escaping the scientists who created him or the bad guys who will do anything to kill him, he's the one we're rooting for. And even though his intelligence has been increased, he's still a shark and when push comes to shove - he does what a shark does best.

Sample pages from issue 2!

The Shark of War Aids A Navy SEAL Team

The Cartel has tracked down the Shark of War

The battle begins but who has the upper hand?

What You're Getting:

  • First and second issue of exciting five issue story arc of the world's first shark (anti)hero.
  • The dark humor of Robocop.
  • More shark action than all the Jaws movies combined.
  • 28 interior pages of story in each issue.
  • Saddle stitched with gloss paper and cover.
  • 2 variant covers for each issue.
  • Digital deluxe pdf full of extra content for each issue (over a 110 pages of content all together)
  • Both issues are 100% complete
  • All backers get the paper Shark of War toy template - make your own Shark of War.

The Paper Shark of War

Meet The Creator

I've been an engineer for 30 years and have degrees in nuclear, aerospace, and mechanical engineering. I've used this to integrate actual science into over the top science fiction in the technology used to power a cyborg shark.

I've wanted to write comic books all my life, but I didn't know any artists and didn't know how to draw. But I've always been good with computers. So when I had the idea for Shark of War, I knew I had to get it made no matter what. I spent the last year learning the different digital drawing and modeling programs that let me create exactly what I envisioned.

Check out the covers!

Base Cover

Jaws Tribute Cover

Piranha Attack Cover

story:
Who am I?

Hi, my name Andrew Blackman, also known as Rivenis, an illustrator and writer from Barbados. I've been working on an ongoing graphic novel series called Diskordia since 2009. In Late 2013 I finished the first 9 chapter story arc 'Feels like Falling'. Thats almost 300 pages of content. I'm really stoked to get it out there into the world in printed form.


What is Diskordia?

Diskordia is a surreal dark fantasy comic that explores themes such as the nature of reality, consciousness and self-determination. It does so with equal doses of hilarity and mind numbing horror.

The main story follows Jackal Black, a cynical and sarcastic young man as he is yanked from his dull life into the bizarre dreamtime; a transit hub between dimensions. He will travel through these strange and varied realms encountering curiously odd creatures and terrifying foes while discovering the true horrific and baffling nature of the world he thought he knew.



You can check out the series if you're curious. Thats right! you can read the series in its entirety online by going to the blog. Or alternately checking it out on Comixology.


What's this campaign about?


I aim to get the entire saga printed in style; namely a deluxe collected edition. It will be a 6"x10" 330 page sewn binding hardcover tome with the entire 'Feels like falling' saga as well as sketches and illustrations created around the time the comic was being worked on.

After gathering quotes and researching the best quality I've determined that a print run of 500 copies will come up to around $7000 (including shipping and tax) The rest of the money will go towards manufacturing and shipping out rewards. As well as covering paypal and indiegogo's fees. 

 Anything raised over the initial goal will go towards a bigger print run and improved rewards. Ideally i'd like to print a run of 1500 copies that i can travel with to comic conventions all over the world as well as to sell online.

I decided to go with a fixed funding scheme so that if I were to receive money I could be completely confident in fulfilling the rewards. If the campaign is successful I mean to send the book to the printers in April and then have the finished product in my hands and ready to send to you by July.





How does this work?

If you're not familiar with IndieGogo or crowdfunding in general, here's a brief overview. 

For the next 40 days, you'll be able to make pledges to help support this project, ranging from $1 to whatever you can afford . You can select one of the perks on the right, corresponding to the amount you wish to donate. This means you're not only being awesome: you are also receiving stuff as proof of that! 

If the final deadline comes and we've reached our goal, then everyone gets charged the amount they pledged at the same time, and after Indiegogo and paypal get their share, I start printing and mailing books and goodies. But if for some reason we don't meet our goal, the whole thing is called off. No one gets charged, no fees are applied, everyone just keeps their money. 

Of course, if we fail to meet the goal, then no one gets any rewards, and that would kinda suck.



Rewards

For starters everyone who contributes will get their name mentioned on the Diskordia facebook page as well as a permanent spot on the 'thank you' page of the upcoming Diskordia webpage. we also have nifty things like posters in two sizes: 11"x17" and 24"x36", as well as buttons and bookmarks, not to mention exclusive printed editions of the upcoming 10th issue of the series. At higher tiers things get even fancier with one of a kind sketches and original commissions. I have some more reward ideas planned for the Stretch goals.





Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing money isn't everything. Just as vital is getting the word out. The more people that hear about this the greater the chances of making this happen. Tell your friends, tell your lovers, grafitti it on walls, get it tattooed on your chest. Well you get the idea. Share, share share!

story:
It's been over ten thousand years since the CASTS war had ended and the golden Imperatur AYA rules the twin star system with an iron fist. An imperum's daemon named GALLUS learned a horrible truth, so he begins a rebellion to overthrown the tyrant, however an old profecy from the ancient forbidden book is yet about to happen.     

Hello my name is Salvatore La Vattiata and I am a comic book and animation artist. Several years ago I worked as a penciller and inker in two major mexican publishing houses, last year me and two friends developed an animated television show for the biggest mexican animation studio. Now I'm going to launch my own independent comic book project..."The Forbidden Book of the Arthax" a story about redemption and the human condition. set in space and lots of planetary systems with it's own mythology and mystic, it has action, drama, love and a compelling story about family ties.  

I have been working on this project for a long time now and this is the official launch of the very first issue. Personally I expect it becomes the next big thing!

A 32 full color page first issue with your name in it!

 All contributors will receive an e-mail and facebook thank you, but those who donate $25 USD and up will get their names printed on the last pages of the comic book! 

"The Forbidden Book of the Arthax" is about 12 issues long saga and part one of a trilogy, this comic book it's under work, it has not been printed nor posted online before so you will be amongst the first ones to get a hold into.

Help us to bring this project into reality, we need $4000 USD to print it. 

Why color? well, the story develops in a number of assorted situations (like space battles) and strange settings, so I needed to portray them with awesome "special effects" that  can't be fully shown in b&w.       

      

Quid pro quo, a surprise for you!

However, I intend to open my own studio, For that reason if we reach $8000 USD or more (It´s difficult to open a studio with $8000 USD but it´s a start!) I will toss the very first Arthax comic book I made back in 1999 (21 b&w pages) for free (all will get the PDF and from $25 USD you'll get the printed comic!). Where it all began. Here's some sample pages .

 

This will be the only chance to get this particular issue for I will not print it again due to it´s part of the Arthax mythos and will be portrayed (brand new of course) in the current Arthax story.

 Great and exclusive perks you may never see them again!

There will be T-shirts with an exclusive art of GALLUS and a couple of resin figurines from clay sculptures (made them myself, they have my own fingerprints!) All this stuff won't be available anywhere else but here!

                

                                                 This project will get printed in one way or another...

This will be a fixed campaing, so if the minimum amount of $4000 usd can't be reach, nobody will be charged and (sadly) I'll have to take this book to a publishing house to get it done, and you will miss the oportunity to be part of this great project.

This is my baby, and I want to share it with the world and now you have the opportunity to be one of the first to contribute to realizing this dream and enjoy a great adventure filled with thrills. Donate now, it's going to be  an amazing ride!

Hey, if you can´t donate...

I know that not every one can donate but ANY help is very welcome, so help us by spreading the voice so more people can find about "The Forbidden Book of the Arthax" and this way it'll become a hit!

And for your time...

I want ot thank you to take the time to check out this campaign!

story:
Short Summary

Dhalmun is a mix of different ideas I decided to put together and make one, hopefully consistent, world. 
 
I started working on "Dhalmun: Age of Steam" sometime in 2010. Didn't get too far with that one, though. After that, in summer of 2011, I launched a webcomic "Dhalmun: Age of Smoke" and it has been my main project since.
 
"Age of Steam" is a story trying to go back to the roots of heroic/superheroic characters, connect with characters like Zorro, Robin Hood or the Four Musketeers. Maybe with a slightly darker tone. I wouldn't call it a steampunk comic, even though, as the title suggests, the steam-based technology is a major part of that world.
 
"Age of Smoke" is a story set in the same world, generations later. As AoS deals with the beginning of a superhero era, this one deals with its end. Now, people with powers don't seem to be as good as they used to be. Or maybe they just have more power.
 
"Dhalmun: Age of Smoke" is available to read here.
 
Since I've been posting stuff for free on the Internet, naturally I have no money (shocking, I know). I work on an 8-year old computer (which is fine, except for the fact that I live in constant fear of it breaking down), and I have no marketing skills (which raises a question of how in the hell am I going to promote this campaign).
I'm doing all this by myself and I want to be able to focus on the work that is to be done. And I guess this is where you guys can help.  
 

What We Need & What You Get

  • If you contribute $1, you get digital copies of both "Age of Steam" short stories, "Age of Smoke" #1-4 (which will be also published online), "Dhalmun: Lesser Evil" #1. You also get whatever gets unlocked in the GOAL PACK.
  • If you contribute $5, you get all of the above plus "Dhalmun - Mythology", a short, illustrated summary of the myths and gods of Dhalmun.
  • If you contribute $20, you get the above and a digital, hi-res (300dpi) sketch/speedpainting of a Dhalmun character of your choosing
  • If you contribute $50, you get the $5 perk plus a detailed digital painting of a chosen character/location from Dhalmun

THE GOAL PACK

If the campaign reaches these goals, i'll be able to make more work, and each of the contributors will get it:

  • If the campaign reaches $1400, the pack will contain a short "The Cleaning Lady"

  • If the campaign reaches $2000, the pack will also contain "Dhalmun: Lesser Evil" #2

  • If the campaign reaches $3000, the pack will also contain "Dhalmun: Age of Steam" #1

 

So, the more money this campaign makes, the more each one of you gets. Sounds good?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also show your support for this project by:
  • Following Age of Smoke on Facebook
  • Following my blog, Tumblr, or deviantART
  • Sharing this EVERYWHERE.
 
I know 30 days is kind of short to get this thing going, but if I didn't believe in this project, how could I expect you to, right?
